My most worshipable Gurudev,
 Please accept my humble obeisances at your divine lotus feet.
 On this auspicious day of your divine Appearance, I bow with deep gratitude. I have no
 qualification to speak, yet by your mercy, a humble desire arises within me to offer these
 reflections in appreciation of your compassion and shelter.
 Whatever small understanding I have received in my spiritual life is entirely due to your mercy.
 Even one as weak and unworthy as I am has been given the opportunity to take shelter of Lord
 Krishna, to hear His pastimes, and to serve His devotees - all because of your kindness. I
 cannot fully comprehend the depth of your mercy, yet even a small part of it has brought a new
 life of devotion into my heart.
 By your inspiration, I have come to see that surrender to Lord Krishna is not merely a ritual, but
 a humble offering of the heart - free from personal motives, steady in faith, and grounded in the
 wish to please Him. Although my understanding is limited, your association has planted the
 seed of devotion within me, which continues to grow by your guidance.
 Through your mercy, I have begun to experience bhakti, the eternal function of the soul - a
 natural readiness to serve the Supreme Lord, not for reward, but out of love and humility. I know
 my own limitations, yet your guidance has allowed me to hear the teachings of the Bhagavatam
 attentively, chant the holy names with care, and serve the devotees to the extent I can. These
 are blessings I cannot repay, and I remain deeply grateful.
 By your example, I have also learned the meaning of compassion and respect for all living
 beings. Even I have been inspired to see souls as parts and parcels of Lord Krishna, worthy of
 kindness and care. I bow to this vision, knowing it comes entirely from the shelter of your lotus
 feet.
 You have inspired me to visit the holy dhamas - places where the Lord’s pastimes are eternally
 manifest. With your guidance, I have had the privilege of walking in Vrindavan, Radha-kund,
 Shyama-kund, the Krishna Balaram Mandir, Govardhan, Mayapur, and Jagannath Puri. These

 strength. Through your care, I have learned to rise early, attend mangala-arati, hear

 them on my own.

 anger, greed, and dishonesty are losing their hold, even as I continue to stumble. I offer these
 small changes at your lotus feet, fully aware that any goodness I may show is only by your
 mercy, not by my strength.

 humble reminders. They bring me to my knees, showing me that I must rely not on myself, but
 on the shelter of Lord Krishna, on your guidance, and on the mercy of the Vaishnavas.
 I offer my deepest, most sincere gratitude for:
 ● Your unceasing kindness and shelter
 ● The association of the Vaishnavas, which has become my spiritual family
 ● The opportunity to hear and study Srimad Bhagavatam and the Bhagavad-gita
 ● The chance to visit the holy dhamas
 ● The simple blessing of chanting, serving, and hearing - even to the small extent that I
 can
 Realizing my own inadequacy, the only thing I can place before you is my sincere desire to
 serve - however small and imperfect it may be. I pray that I may be allowed to continue serving
 this mission, this community, and this shelter with devotion, steadiness, and gratitude.
 Your unworthy servant,

Dear Guru Maharaj.
 Please accept my humble obeisances.
 
 What can I say Maharaj, I am a fool blessed by your mercy. I don't know what unimaginable mercy has come upon me. And from there, we came to your SB class. I don't remember much of the class, but after the class, you were strolling around the temple, and suddenly some devotee said this is the opportunity to touch the lotus feet of Maharaj. All matajis were touching your feet, and I also felt I should not miss this opportunity. I could touch your feet and soon I thought, what a fool I am, so arrogant to touch your feet.
 I was feeling very sorry, but then I thought I could ask for forgiveness. Then soon I was standing in the courtyard of Radha Gopinath mandir, and you came. I bowed down and in my heart offered a prayer and asked for forgiveness, and you compassionately gazed at me as if you understood everything. After this, only my spiritual life took off. From this day onwards, I never looked back. All my life is just a smooth journey personally orchestrated by Krishna. Only thing I regret is I could have taken birth a little earlier and helped you in manifesting the Chowpatty project. My only aspiration is in the next life, I assist you very closely in making another Chowpatty Mandir in some universe right from the scratch.
 Here now, as I am serving in ISKCON Pune NVCC as a brahmacari, what a great blessing it is to be here under the care of HG Radheshyam Prabhu. Who is an apt representative of yours. Only by the great inspiration of HG Radheshyam Prabhu did the devotees come into my college, and I could get connected. He is like a great father, only because of whose timely guidance I am in the brahmacari ashram today.
 Dear Guru Maharaj, in the recent Kartik Yatra in Govardhan, when you were doing kirtans, you were repeatedly saying, "Let us give our self fully to the Holy Name." This gesture of yours has deeply empowered my chanting. Whenever I now chant, I chant with this effort of giving myself fully, and I feel I am more closer to the Holy Name. Whenever the mind is trying to cheat, your rock-solid and steady image gives me so much solace and strength that I feel I will surely make it in this lifetime by your grace. I wish in some lifetime I come with you, catching your hand at Radha Kunda, the same famous painting where Srila Bhakti Siddhanta Saraswati Prabhupada is giving his instruction to our Srila Prabhupada at Radha Kunda, and Srila Prabhupada's son is catching his hand. I am an ignorant fool to think and imagine like this, but this is only what I can think of. Thinking of meeting Radha and Krishna is beyond my scope, but surely I can assist you in your service to Srila Prabhupada.
 And since it is Srila Prabhupada's glorification, if I don't do it here, you will not like it, so I will put my best effort to glorify Srila Prabhupada also. I can only dare to hear the sound of the waves on that ferocious ocean in which Jaladuta was crossing the Atlantic. I can't dare to imagine the seasickness there and what pain Srila Prabhupada could have undergone is unimaginable. I wonder what kind of determination that is; it is humanly impossible. Such tolerance and such burning desire to fulfill the words of Guru. How much faith Srila Prabhupada had on the Holy Name and the message of Srimad Bhagavatam. His love for His disciples is beyond measure.
 So much he has given Himself to everyone. So much he tolerated. And what a compassionate friend He was of Gandhiji. That at the fag end of Gandhi's life, Srila Prabhupada remembered him. He wrote him and advised. Who else can be such a well-wisher of anyone? He was indeed the ever well-wisher of everyone. His love is beyond comparison. Love of a million mothers is insufficient in front of Srila Prabhupada. So much focus Srila Prabhupada had on the mission. Tireless translations and classes with the clarity of diamond. This certainly can't be imitated. He envisioned a future of which today I am reaping immense benefits.
 He is still there in the very same temple I am serving, so much accessible through His books. He is an acarya. He can never leave us. He is watching me. I feel I am not doing my best to please Him. Some day I can serve my best to please Him. He speaks with the authority of all the acaryas and yet is as gracious as a swan. He speaks like a concerned father calling his loved son - "Brahmananda" or "Bali-mardana"... "You can take charge of this project here." So much encouragement and empowerment He gave to all. I can feel a tinge of the loss the disciples of Srila Prabhupada might have felt when He left the planet.
 As an irreparable loss, this is like a calamity. But Srila Prabhupada lives in His instructions and the faithful followers. As a constant guide, He is there in His books. I have no more words to speak. I wish to just try to follow to the best of my capabilities the teachings of Srila Prabhupada. The mountain of anarthas in my heart is huge, but there is hope in the power of the Guru parampara.
 Srila Prabhupada was a fearless preacher, always thinking big.
 Dear Guru Maharaj, as you rightly know me as a fearful and timid servant, you have rightly blessed me by your mercy to take shelter of Srila Prabhupada.
 Your aspiring servant,
 Abhaya Govinda Dasa.

Hare Krishna, dear Guru Maharaj,

I feel immensely fortunate to have received whatever I have through ISKCON. Though differences, perceptions, and ego clashes may naturally arise in this material world, amidst all such challenges I remain deeply grateful to you—for training us to become humble and to tolerate difficulties with faith.

By your mercy, and by the boundless compassion of Srila Prabhupada, I have received more than I could ever repay. My only prayer is that I may steadily, sincerely, and without any ulterior motives dedicate my body, mind, and words in glorifying Srila Prabhupada, Sri Sri Radha-Krishna, and Sri Sri Gaura-Nitai.

My sole aspiration in life is to chant and dance in the association of devotees, engage wholeheartedly in the various devotional services prescribed by you, and remain absorbed in the study and recitation of Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam. I feel that nothing more is required—life is complete in such service.

Yet, if the envy, illusion, and pride within my heart could be destroyed, that would bring the greatest joy—for only then could my devotional service be pure and pleasing to you and to the Lord.

For me, it is a lifelong — in fact, life after life — project to follow this one verse, which I see fully embodied as your divine opulence:

tṛṇād api sunīcena
taror iva sahiṣṇunā
amāninā mānadena
kīrtanīyaḥ sadā hariḥ

Respected Maharaj

All glories to Srila Prabhupada

This is our first offering to you Maharaj after initiation, which happened last year on December 27. We feel more connected to you and Sri Guru Parampara, praying daily on the beads you had kindly chanted upon. Although there is a deep sense of satisfaction for myself, yet, I feel sad for the devotees who missed initiation, which was scheduled for the next day. So many devotees who were much more qualified than me should have received shelter, at least before me. They were waiting for the next day.

Yet there is a positive aspect too. By Srila Prabhupada's grace, so many devotees are
eager to surrender to chanting of the Holy Names. The preaching is increasing, and thus ISKCON as a society is also growing! And I feel very grateful for the efforts you have put in, from the very beginning of accepting Krishna Consciousness to the advanced age today—we always see you tirelessly serving Srila Prabhupada and his divine instructions.

Taking so much effort, every single year you have taken Kartik yatra for all of us. This one festival of coming together, leaving aside as much as possible all our worries and anxieties over petty issues of life, and taking our time for pure Krsna Katha and seva to devotees, is a panacea for continuing us year after year. Hearing from you, we understand how easily we forget the most basic principles of Krishna Consciousness! But it is to our great fortune to be reminded by the words emanating from your lotus mouth. My only wish is to have my consciousness purified by these words and instructions.

Guru Maharaj, in trying to serve in our respective teams, we are also now getting exposed to more and more of the organizational side of ISKCON. Unfortunately, long gone are our days when we were new, thinking everyone to be a pure devotee. Now every single incidence and every involved devotee no longer feels perfect, either within the team or across various teams and various leaders. The issues we face within our team are still overcome, thanks to the able guidance of our seniors, who are following your footsteps. But now, growing up in society, there are more organizational challenges being faced with other teams.

This year the third time in three years we see a similar situation evolving, where all our efforts are put on toss for some little misunderstanding or underlying emotions against us. As a team, we have suffered various setbacks earlier, and only by the causeless grace of the Lord were we able to come out of these. Yet repeated failures, born not directly out of our mistakes, are deeply saddening. And as we understand, this is because of the material attachments which these leaders bring into devotional service: attachments like possession of money and land, ruling over followers and properties, and needless to mention, strong non-KC attachments for wife, children, and family.

It is certainly because of my imperfect vision towards devotees. And the very reason I am pointing this out is because these issues exist within my very self. Swearing on our beads, I don't share this to complain, Maharaj, but only for the reason that a child can cry to his parents. And also, because these setbacks make devotees go through enormous pain. Please pray for these of your crying children, Maharaj. We need strength to carry on following your footsteps. Attachment to your lotus feet is certainly the perfection that will fulfill all our desires. For not only are your lotus feet our shelter, but they have shown the path to walk on the thorny roads of this material world. We have faith; if we stick to the example you have led, we will one day be able to please Sri Sri Radha Krishna.

Maharaj, I feel the need of your blessings, mercy, and prayers even more than ever. On this auspicious occasion of Sri Vyas Puja, I also beg for forgiveness for the countless offenses I have committed at your lotus feet. Please save us from the very anarthas that we are realizing in ourselves. Please award us the service to Vaishnavas.

I also pray to always feel this dependence upon you every moment and aspire forever to serve your lotus feet.

Your servant

 tapyante loka-tāpena

 “It is said that great personalities almost always accept voluntary suffering because of the suffering of people in general. This is considered the highest method of worshiping the Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is present in everyone’s heart.”

 You are the one who lifts my vision
 from the dust of this world
 toward the shining horizon of Goloka.

 and the path of bhakti becomes illuminated
 like Śrī Yamunā shimmering under the full moon.

 your life is a garland of seva,
 strung with the flowers of humility, courage, and tireless compassion.

 my compass,
 my silent companion
 on the journey of surrender.

 like the first monsoon rain,
 awakening seeds of devotion
 I did not know were sleeping.

 your teachings shine like Arjuna’s Pārtha-sārathi,

Seeking the Essence beneath and Lessons to learn
There is a saying, "We should not go through situations but grow through situations." It is easier said than done, because when confronted with situations, one gets overwhelmed by them and cannot think of anything else. But your life is filled with examples. In every situation, you were looking for the essence behind it. Your friend's untimely death because his car skidded—you pondered about the uncertainty of life. Proposal from Irene—you contemplated the path led by great souls throughout history. Just sitting on the bank of the Ganges, you learned so much, without a single lecture or class, because of your hunger to see the essence behind it. Deadly passage of Istanbul, one night with a mongoose—just by reading that incident, one can feel horrified, but you were so grateful to the mongoose for teaching you patience. After one month of fasting, when you were about to break your fast, one monkey jumped and took away everything. A few peanuts fell, but another monkey came and not even a single nut was spared. Anyone can feel frustrated at such an incident, but you saw such a beautiful lesson: Material acquisitions are like peanuts in comparison to the spiritual treasure. How in material life people are lying, crying, and dying for a few of those peanuts… and there are endless examples in "Journey Home." Every situation became an opportunity to deepen your spiritual wisdom and strengthen your connection with Kṛṣṇa. Thank you, Guru Mahārāja, for teaching by your example how to look for the essence in every situation. I beg at your lotus feet to bless me with strength to cultivate such spiritual vision, so that I don't get carried away by external situations but can seek the essence, learn the lesson, and gratefully thank Kṛṣṇa in every situation.

ys,
Adishyam Das

महाराज श्री, आपकी 75वीं व्यास पूजा पर आपको हार्दिक शुभकामनाएं।
महाराज श्री, मैंने "The Journey Home" बुक तो नहीं पढ़ी, लेकिन जितना आपके बारे में समझा, उससे यह समझ आता है कि आप प्रभुपाद से कितना प्रेम करते हैं। और यह भी समझ आता है कि प्रभुपाद कितने दिव्य हैं, क्योंकि आपने इतने सारे साधु-संतों का संग प्राप्त किया, परंतु अंततः आप प्रभुपाद के शरणागत हुए। और इससे यह भी समझ आता है कि आप पहले से ही काफी बुद्धिमान थे, क्योंकि आप जानते थे कि वास्तविक गुरु कौन है और कौन आपको सही रास्ते तक ले जा सकता है। और वह थे हमारे श्रील प्रभुपाद, जो कि कोई चमत्कार या सिद्धि से नहीं, बल्कि प्रेम से सबको कृष्ण तक ले जाने का मार्ग समझाए। श्रील प्रभुपाद की जय।

आपका श्री वृंदावन धाम के लिए प्रेम, बृजवासियों के लिए प्रेम और सभी जीवात्माओं के लिए करुणा, आपकी विनम्रता, हर परिस्थिति को देखने का आपका दृष्टिकोण, कृतज्ञता, और श्री राधा-गोपीनाथ के साथ गहरा संबंध; यही सब वह गुण थे जिन्होंने मुझे आपकी ओर आकृष्ट किया। एक भक्त बता रहे थे कि कम्युनिकेशन का मतलब सिर्फ बात करना नहीं होता, बल्कि सुनना होता है। कैसे आप सबकी बातों को बहुत धैर्य पूर्वक सुनते हैं, यह हमें वास्तविकता में कम्युनिकेशन की परिभाषा सिखाता है। और विशेषकर, आपका यह गुण कि भक्त समाज को कैसा होना चाहिए, एकजुट होकर कैसे भक्ति में आगे बढ़ना चाहिए, कैसे एकता के साथ रहना चाहिए; विशेषकर यह सब आपकी ओर आकृष्ट किया। परंतु चिंता की बात यह है कि मैं आपको कैसे प्रसन्न कर पाऊंगी, क्योंकि मुझे हमेशा यही चिंता लगी रहती है कि मैं कृष्ण के प्रति शरणागत नहीं हो पा रही हूं, और जब तक कृष्ण केंद्र में नहीं हैं, तब तक मैं कुछ भी ठीक से नहीं कर सकती। श्रील गुरु महाराज, मुझे समझ नहीं आ रहा है कि मैं कैसे कृष्ण से प्रेम करूं, कैसे उनकी सेवा करूं, कैसे उन्हें प्रसन्न कर पाऊं। और मुझे इस बात का भी दुख है कि मैं अपने कर्तव्य भी ठीक से नहीं कर रही हूं, और इस बात के लिए मुझे शर्मिंदगी भी होती है। पर अब प्रयास करते-करते इतना थक चुकी हूं कि अब प्रयास करना ही छोड़ दिया है। मुझे बहुत ही निराशाजनक महसूस हो रहा है। कृपया आप ही कुछ रास्ता सुझाएं।
यह जानते हुए भी कि श्रील प्रभुपाद मेरे दादा हैं, आप मेरे शिक्षा गुरु हैं, वह मेरी ऐसी कायरता भरी प्रवृत्ति से कभी प्रसन्न नहीं होंगे, फिर भी मैं ठीक से अपने कर्तव्य नहीं निभा रही हूं। मेरा मन इतना चंचल हो गया है कि मैं इस पर नियंत्रण बिल्कुल भी नहीं रख पा रही हूं, और मुझे कुछ समझ नहीं आ रहा गुरु महाराज, क्या करूं, कैसे करूं? सब कुछ बिगड़ता जा रहा है।

महाराज, मैं आपका अधिक से अधिक दर्शन चाहती हूं, परंतु मैं जिस स्थान पर रहती हूं, वहां से आपके दर्शन लेना दुर्लभ है। आपका उज्जैन आने का इंतजार मैं न जाने कब से कर रही थी, परंतु मैं इतनी पतित हूं कि साल में एक बार ही आप मध्य प्रदेश आते हैं, और इस बार मेरे माता-पिता से मुझे उज्जैन जाने की अनुमति तो मिल गई, परंतु आपका दर्शन नहीं मिला। अब ऐसा मौका मुझे नहीं मिलेगा कि मैं आपके दर्शन प्राप्त कर पाऊं, पर आपकी कृपा अगर हुई तो यह जरूर संभव है। आपका इंतजार रहेगा।
हम नरसिंह देव से आपके अच्छे स्वास्थ्य के लिए प्रार्थना करते हैं, ताकि आप श्रील प्रभुपाद के आदेशों को अच्छे से पूरा कर पाएं। मैं तुच्छ जीवात्मा हूं, मुझमें कोई सामर्थ्य नहीं है कि मैं आपके लिए कुछ कर सकूं, परंतु यह प्रार्थना की शक्ति है जो आपके मिशन को पूरा करने में आपकी मदद करेगी।

आपके चरणों में जीवन अर्पित।

When he visited Rishikesh and meditated on the banks of the Ganges, sitting on a rock that was 20 feet above the water, he observed many objects being swept along in the current of Mother Ganges—leaves, flowers, uprooted trees, a dead buffalo, and even human corpses. The flow of the Ganges carried them to the banks. Maharaj explained that the spiritual path and spiritual teacher are like the current of Mother Ganges, and the disciples are like the objects carried along by the river. If we remain faithful to the current of the holy teachings, we will be carried to the ocean of spiritual truth. Radhanath Swami Maharaj exemplifies this quality throughout his life by remaining faithful and dedicating himself completely to Srila Prabhupada, spreading the message of Krishna consciousness to the entire world.
 
 The other pastime I would like to share highlights His compassion towards other living entities. Once, while traveling in Mumbai, Radhanath Swami Maharaj’s car stopped at a traffic signal. Some beggars approached and knocked on the window, asking for food. Maharaj gently asked the person with him, “Do you have any rice puffs or pancakes to give them?” The person replied, "No, I don't have food packets to give." Although they later gave the beggars some money, Maharaj was not satisfied. He spoke about how important it is to carry food packets at all times. He said, “It is very humiliating to be begging,” and then, in a softer tone, he added, "It is even more humiliating when you do not give."  Your eternally grateful servant and aspiring daughter,

Dear Srila Gurudeva,
Please accept my humble obeisances.
All glories to Srila Prabhupada. All glories to Srila Gurudeva.

It feels daunting to speak of your glories, as I am acutely aware of my own limitations. Anything I say about Srila Radhanath Maharaj seems like “small mouth, big talk”—I am not worthy to describe your greatness, for you embody the qualities of a true sadhu whose life is dedicated to serving others. Yet, following my counselor’s advice and seeking purification of my own heart, I offer these words.

You personify all Vaishnava qualities, and as I reflect on each, I see your perfection in them. In this offering, I would talk about your exemplary leadership—always leading from the front, living every instruction you give. Recently, I heard the top five instructions you shared with your followers on your 75th birthday:

1/ Go deep into hearing, chanting, and service:
No one exemplifies depth in spiritual practice as you do. When I chant Hare Krishna, I utter words; when you chant, you invoke Krishna’s presence. Your attention to detail in every service for Krishna’s pleasure is inspiring.

2/ Cultivate the mood of pleasing Guru and Krishna:
Your life’s purpose is to please Krishna, a commitment evident since your childhood and strengthened after accepting Srila Prabhupada as your Guru. Stories shared by Vrindavan Prabhu in his book to glorify you mention how you delivered lectures and served even in great pain, demonstrating your unwavering desire to please Guru and Krishna.

3/ Remain united as a community:
You lead by personal example, caring for your Godbrothers and Godsisters, attending to every need, and serving with your full capacity.

4/ Enthusiasm in Bhakti to share Krishna consciousness:
The annual yatras, attended by 10,000–12,000 devotees, are a testament to your enthusiasm and compassion to spread this knowledge. It is very inspiring to see that you are personally overseeing every detail and delivering hours-long classes daily, even at an age when most cannot sit for minutes.

5/ Never forget that Bhakti is about quality, not quantity:
You never compromise on quality, infusing it into every aspect of your service, stretching yourself daily to serve devotees selflessly.

Given my position, I feel unqualified to write these words and am sure I make many mistakes due to my false ego. Please forgive me.

Srila Gurudeva, though I am unworthy, I rely on your magnanimity. Please accept this most fallen servant and shower your causeless mercy upon me, for without it, I have no hope. I am in great need of your blessings and seek your encouragement/push to progress on this path of devotion.

Your fallen servant,
Amit Tantia

My most beloved Gurudev, His Holiness Radhanath Swami Maharaj,

On this sacred day of your Vyasa Puja, I bow down at your divine lotus feet with a heart full of gratitude and love.
You are the living embodiment of Lord Caitanya’s compassion — a gentle stream of mercy that has touched and transformed countless lives, including mine.

Through your words, I have learned what it means to love selflessly.
Through your humility, I have begun to understand the beauty of serving others.
Through your example, I have seen what true devotion looks like in action — constant, pure, and full of grace.

Your life itself is a scripture to me — every moment a verse of surrender, every act a lesson in compassion, every breath a prayer of gratitude to the Lord.

I still remember an incident that deeply touched my heart.
During a festival at a crowded temple, an elderly devotee arrived late and could not find a place to sit. The hall was packed, and you were just about to begin your class.
To everyone’s surprise, you quietly stepped down from the stage, walked through the crowd, and gently helped that devotee find a seat. You even brought a cushion yourself, ensuring he was comfortable before returning to the stage.

The hall became completely silent — not because of a powerful lecture, but because we had all witnessed love and compassion in action.
Later, when someone mentioned your humility, you softly said,
“If we cannot express compassion in the small moments, how will we express love for God in the big ones?”

That one moment taught me more about bhakti than hundreds of lectures ever could.
It showed me who you truly are — a heart that sees Krishna in everyone and serves with no expectation of recognition.

Gurudev, in your presence, my restless mind finds peace,
my hopeless heart finds purpose,
and my lost soul finds its way home.

Your love is like the morning sun — gentle, steady, and life-giving.
You have taught me that bhakti is not about being extraordinary, but about becoming deeply human — to be kind, grateful, humble, and always dependent on the Lord’s mercy.

On this auspicious day, I pray that I may always remain an instrument of your service.
May I carry your message of love and compassion wherever I go.
May I remember always that the greatest joy is not in receiving, but in giving love selflessly, as you do every moment of your life.

My dearest Gurudev,
You are my teacher, my guide, and my shelter.
Your compassion lights my path, your humility melts my heart,
and your devotion reminds me of the eternal beauty of serving Sri Guru and Sri Krishna.

On this Vyasa Puja day, I offer my heart — imperfect though it may be — at your lotus feet,
praying only for the strength to serve you with sincerity and to live by your teachings.

Ys,
Amol

Among your innumerable divine qualities, we wish to glorify two that have especially touched our hearts — your aura and your merciful heart.
We began visiting Śrī Śrī Rādhā Gopīnath Temple regularly in the years 2001–2003. At that time, our daughter Parusha was about nine years old and our son Parth was just three and a half. Even at that young age, both our children were deeply touched by the divine atmosphere of the temple and by your saintly presence.
Parth would observe you with great attention and awe. He was especially inspired by your unique way of beginning a lecture — after singing the maṅgala-caraṇa, you would fold your hands, glance lovingly across the assembled devotees from one end to the other, and in that sacred silence, every heart would become still. Then, softly, you would begin your class, and the hall would fill with transcendental wisdom and love.
At home, Parth would imitate you with devotion. Sitting on the sofa, he would ask us to sit in front of him, fold his little hands, and slowly glance over us — expecting the same silence you inspired in the temple. When we failed to comply, he would innocently ask, “When Maharaj does this, everyone becomes quiet — why not you?” We would all laugh, then fall silent, delighting his heart.
Your words too, Maharaj, left a deep mark on him. You often reminded us that within the temple, we are protected from Māyā, but as soon as we step out, she waits to bewilder us. After each Sunday programme, as we stepped outside, little Parth would hold our hands tightly and whisper with concern, “Papa, Māyā is standing outside — she will catch us!” That childlike faith still brings tears to our eyes and reminds us of your ever-merciful protection.
You have always been so affectionate toward children. Once, you lovingly placed your hand on Parth’s head, and we felt our lives were blessed forever. You instructed us to bring up our children in Krishna Consciousness as a service to the Lord. We took this instruction to heart and made it our life’s mission.
Our daughter Parusha too has grown beautifully under your merciful guidance. She completed her engineering and MBA from reputed institutions and is now married. Although absorbed in her family life, she holds deep respect for Krishna Consciousness and tries sincerely to imbibe and share these values. She is now nurturing her one-year-old daughter with affection and care — introducing her to Krishna from her earliest days. It fills our hearts with gratitude to see this spiritual legacy flowing to the next generation, all by your divine grace.
Guru Maharaj, out of your causeless mercy, you accepted us — though utterly unqualified — as your disciples in the year 2008. Your compassion, instructions, and personal example continue to be our guiding light.
By your blessings, Parth has completed his engineering from IIT Delhi and continues to chant 16 rounds daily, study Bhagavad-gītā As It Is and Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam, and sincerely strive to become a humble devotee. We are confident that, with your mercy and the association of devotees, both our children and our grandchild will continue to grow in Krishna Consciousness and serve Śrīla Prabhupāda’s mission with sincerity.
Guru Maharaj, words can never express our gratitude for your boundless love and mercy. Your divine aura continues to illuminate our hearts, and your compassion sustains our spiritual journey.
All glories to Śrīla Prabhupāda.
All glories to you, our beloved spiritual master, HH Radhanath Swami Maharaj.
Your unworthy servants,

Anand Nidhi Das
Anandni Priya Devi Dasi

Dearest Gurudeva,
Please accept my humble obeisances. All glories to Śrīla Prabhupāda.
 
Trying to write for you feels like trying to measure the sky with a ruler; whatever I attempt falls short, yet the attempt itself feels like a blessing. Still, with a hopeful heart, I place these words at your lotus feet.
 
 A quality of you, Maharaj, that continually touches my heart is the way gratitude flows so naturally from you. You thank everyone, you uplift everyone, you make every person feel seen. Watching you, I’ve slowly understood that gratitude is not decoration in spiritual life; it is the very essence that softens the heart and makes devotion possible. This single lesson has reshaped how I look at my own journey.
 
 Your instructions during this year’s Govardhan Dham Kartik Yatra made an especially deep impression on me. I could hear from you about your journey in “The Journey Home” where you traveled through so many traditions and philosophies. When you said that “to be a servant is the conclusion of all philosophies,” it struck me very deeply. It felt like the distilled truth behind everything I have ever read or attempted to understand. To the degree we try to sincerely imbibe this spirit of service, Kṛṣṇa reciprocates and cleanses the heart. Hearing this from someone who has personally walked through those philosophies and realized their essence is an immense blessing that I still cannot fully comprehend.
 
 I remember my guide, HG Hari Bhakti Prabhu, once telling me that to be a disciple means to have the dedication to follow instructions and be accountable to the spiritual master. Those words have stayed with me like a compass to keep checking when I drift. I definitely do not walk the path perfectly, but I aspire to cultivate that spirit of responsibility, both in following the instructions given to me and in aligning my life with your teachings.
 
 You speak about cultivating the eyes of love, *premanjana-churita-bhakti-vilocanena*. I know I do not have such vision, yet by your mercy, I feel I am allowed to see glimpses of that wonderful Damodara through your eyes. Whatever little taste or inspiration I have received has come by showering myself with your Vani, not by any qualification of my own. This is something I remain deeply grateful for.
 
 Another teaching from you that continues to shape my mind is your explanation of envy and its absence in Vṛindavan. You described how in Vrindavan everyone simply wants to please Kṛṣṇa, and if someone else can render a service better, they are joyfully put forward. This simple yet profound mood is the real cure for envy. It gives me a direction for what I should actually cultivate in my own heart.
 
 Your example makes even lofty ideals feel practical. You show us that humility is not weakness, gratitude is not sentimentality, and service is not mere activity; it is identity. I want to live my life in a way that reflects even a drop of that understanding.
 
 My deepest aspiration is to embrace the mood you embody so naturally, to be the servant of the servant. I pray that this aspiration becomes real, not just something I recite, but something I ingrain. I pray for the sincerity to follow your instructions and those of your representatives wholeheartedly, without excuses.
 
 Thank you for giving meaning to every struggle and hope in my spiritual journey. Thank you for allowing me to stand anywhere near the shelter of your feet. I remain forever grateful and pray for the strength to serve your mission and your devotees with integrity.
 Your insignificant aspiring servant,
 Anand.

 Please accept me as your servant.

Hare Krishna, dear Guru Maharaj.
Please accept my humble obeisances.
All glories to Srila Prabhupada.

This year marks your 75th Vyasa Puja, and my heart is filled with wonder. Even in this advanced age, you continue to bless us daily — joining the morning programs, chanting japa with us, and offering your deep classes every evening during Kartik Yatra for our spiritual nourishment.

I was deeply moved when I saw Your Holiness absorbed in prayers before Sri Giriraj Ji. That sacred moment reminded me of your beautiful statement:

> “Bhakti means to observe.”

Today, my heart also travels back to 2020, when we had planned to celebrate H.H. Bhakti Charu Swami Maharaj’s 75th Vyasa Puja in Surat. But the world changed then, and we lost his divine association during the pandemic. Though I am your disciple, I was fortunate to have received so many opportunities to associate with His Holiness Bhakti Charu Swami Maharaj. That loss was heavy on my heart.

Now, by the Lord’s mercy, I am again blessed to witness a 75th Vyasa Puja — yours. In your presence, I feel the same warmth and compassion that I once felt with Bhakti Charu Swami Maharaj. Whenever I see you, I remember him; and when I saw him, I often remembered you. Truly, this is my great fortune.

Just as one beholds a ripe mango and instantly remembers its sweetness, juiciness, and taste, in the same way, when one sees you, it is felt that you are filled with pure devotion for Sri Sri Radha-Krishna. And whoever associates with you begins to feel that divine love awaken in their own hearts.

During Kartik Yatra, in your presence, my restless heart found calm and fullness that words cannot express.

Yet, Maharaj, as I look at the world today, I see so many wars, conflicts, natural disasters, and an endless storm of technology pulling hearts away from Krishna. Everything is becoming refined outwardly, but our inner connection to the Lord is fading. We appear to practice bhakti, yet often without true urgency or dependence on Krishna. Only your shelter, your mercy, can save me from this illusion.

Last year, on 17th September, you kindly awarded me saffron cloth. Please bless me that I may remain truly humble, for I feel that since wearing this sacred colour, some pride has quietly entered my heart — a desire for respect and honour. But you have always taught that saffron is not for prestige, but for service, sacrifice, and dedication to Srila Prabhupada’s mission.

I pray, dear Maharaj, please bless me to maintain the dignity of this dress, to stay far from the traps of lust and honour, and to develop a small drop of real taste for the Holy Name.

Thank you, Guru Maharaj, for carrying us all with your compassion and patience. May I always remain at your lotus feet, aspiring only to serve.

Your aspiring servant,
Anand Vraj Das

 Dear Guru Maharaj,
 
 Please accept my humble obeisance. All glories to Srila Prabhupada.
 
 
 Śrīla Prabhupāda once wrote in a letter to his disciple:
 
 “A devotee means he is able to tolerate all kinds of discomfort and whims of material nature, and because he is so much absorbed in serving Kṛṣṇa, he has no time to become angry or take offense with others or find fault—no. A devotee means very liberal and kind to everyone, always a gentleman under all kinds of conditions of life.”
 
 In my humble opinion, you embody this instruction of Śrīla Prabhupāda in the most complete and natural way. You travel the world and meet people from so many backgrounds and cultures. Within ISKCON, you are connected—directly or indirectly—to countless projects, services, devotees, and responsibilities. You listen to an endless variety of concerns, challenges, and problems, both serious and simple. Yet, despite all this engagement with people, management, and constant travel, you remain a humble servant of your spiritual master—always enthusiastic to give Kṛṣṇa, to speak about Kṛṣṇa, and to elevate the consciousness of every soul according to their capacity.
 
 As I myself grow older, I increasingly recognize my own shortcomings. I realize how difficult it truly is to deal with people's emotions in a way that does not discourage them. To represent the truth—both relative and Absolute—and yet express it in an uplifting manner that inspires devotees and the general public to come closer to Kṛṣṇa is not a simple task. But you do this constantly. You communicate with sensitivity, always adjusting your message to the time, place, circumstance, and audience.
 
 In this world—material, spiritual, and even within religious institutions—there are so many opinions, divisions, and differences. People naturally take sides, and discord often follows. To navigate this landscape of egos requires deep humility, compassion, and surrender to a higher principle. You exemplify all of these qualities. You truly represent the essence of what Śrīla Prabhupāda came to teach the world.
 
 Therefore, on this most auspicious day of your divine appearance, I place a humble request before you: please bless me so that I may become even a small representative of your mood, just as you are a pure representative of your spiritual master.
 
 I am impulsive, impatient, and easily agitated—qualities arising from the mode of passion. If I truly wish to “talk the talk” and “walk the walk” from a spiritual perspective, I must cultivate the divine qualities that you so naturally live by.
 
 My dear Guru Mahārāja, you tirelessly push forward the movement of His Divine Grace. I humbly beg for your blessings on this auspicious day so that I may become your humble instrument of will.
 
 Thank you for the kindness you have shown to me in the past, the kindness you show now, and the kindness you will show in the future.
 
 
 Hare Krishna!
 Your servant always,
 Ananda Jagannath das
 Des Moines, Iowa

Dearest Guru Maharaj,
 
 Please accept my humble obeisances, all glories to Srila Prabhupada!
 I remember this time last year when I came to your vyasa puja for the first time. I had the deep desire in my heart to take shelter of you for a few months before that, for you to be my diksa guru, and that morning my authorities at Soho Street temple had given me their blessings to pursue that course - to become your initiated disciple.
 When I arrived at Krishna Avanti School that day for the vyasa puja I felt a little out of place, a little nervous, but also excited and relieved. Excited for what was to come in my spiritual life with you, and relieved that the deep desire in the core of my heart had been acknowledged and trusted by my authorities at ISKCON Soho. Sitting inside Krishna Avanti I felt a little unqualified to be amongst such exalted devotees, fully surrendered to serving you and Srila Prabhupada’s mission, but by the end of the day, I very much felt the warm bliss of being embraced by your representatives, my family, on returning “home”.
 
 It’s funny, that day only a handful of names were pulled out of a hat to read their offerings to you. I was so new to all this at the time and I hadn’t written anything, and as I sat alongside Radhanath Swami’s disciples, I was a bit of a rabbit caught in the headlights. As they were pulling the second name out of the hat, I turned to Tripad Prabhu and said somewhat exasperatedly - “Prabhu, I haven’t written anything, please say they don’t pull my name - “ at which point XANDER HEPHER my name, boomed out across the room. Of all the possible names, and of the few that were selected at random, of course mine had been pulled out! I went up and read a small reflection I had written. It was actually such great mercy, and such great kindness. It was some reciprocation with my desire to please you and serve you, and in some sense it felt like confirmation that I was making the right decision. Thank you for always guiding me, and for always remaining with me.
 
 I still am the same uncertain individual in many ways, trying desperately to please yourself and the devotees I have the pleasure of associating with, but now, one year on, I have the great and inconceivable blessing of your eternal shelter. And so any anxieties and insufficiencies I possess are forgotten in the presence of your great mercy. Words cannot suffice to thank you for what you have done, and are doing in my life. From when I first met you last January in Govardhan Eco Village, to the present day, everything has changed. In meeting you for the first time I had my first tangible experience of what real love was, through your embrace outside Madan Mohan Temple, and through your encouragement. You have lived in my heart since then and I pray that my meditation on you may become deeper, clearer and more absorbed as I seek to purely and sincerely please yourself, Srila Prabhupada and all the Acaryas with my service. I will always try to represent you by being an example of your mood - to serve with utmost humility, honesty, and deep, deep care and compassion for all living entities. I will try, and do my utmost, to follow in your footsteps.
 
 Sometimes I long for your personal association and wonder whether it is a sentimental desire or a desire of the heart to be more intimately serving you. But I know that the deepest intimacy is in serving your instruction, and that through being situated here in the West, you are pleased by my humble attempts to propagate Srila Prabhupada’s movement to the Western people, to the best of my ability. You said that Studio 108 is working because things are being done in a mood of pure devotion, and that we must maintain. Purity is the force and preaching is the essence, and so I will do my best to continue serving here in separation from you, as purely as I can, which means following your guidance, and your instruction. Then I can give others the opportunity to one day experience the love that you have given me.
 
 On the day of my initiation, everything changed Guru Maharaj. As I walked onto the stage with my parents, my mother looked at me and said, “Go!”, gesturing towards you. I know out of the sensitivity and kindness of your heart you invited them on stage to give their blessings, and for me to offer them my heartfelt obeisances. My mother saying “Go!” towards you, felt very much as if she was willingly and lovingly handing me over to your shelter. They knelt behind me as I lay at your feet Maharaj - it was as though they offered me up to you, and I lay down at your feet. Lying at your feet is where I wish to remain. I cannot begin to express my gratitude for my parents being there, and for your kindness towards them. They gratefully received your words of appreciation on that day, thanking them for coming, and gratefully received the burfees and cookies you offered them. I feel more deeply connected to them under your shelter now, following that day that we all shared. My father says he would like to meet you to have a more personal discussion, and if that one day happens it would be so special. My mother loves you already.
 
 I only hope that for years to come I can please you more and more in service of Srila Prabhupada. That I may make you proud, and that I may become a representative of your mood and mission, wherever I may be.
 
 Your eternal servant,
 Ananda Nitai Dasa

You are truly a collector of hearts—loving even those of us riddled with flaws and failures, yet guiding us as a steadfast father toward our highest potential.

When I was engaged in transcribing your lectures, I experienced perhaps the most fulfilling service of my life. Each word I typed felt alive—like drops of nectar falling into my heart. Listening again and again, I realized your voice was not just sound vibration but a wave moving beneath the surface of my being, creating silent tremors that reshaped my journey in Krishna consciousness. Your lectures are soul-stirring; they both comfort and challenge. They soothe our restless minds with compassion, yet awaken us to urgency—reminding us to take shelter of the Supreme Lord without delay.

Through this service, I began to see bhakti not as a theory but as a living reality. I learned to recognize anarthas, not with despair but with hope, and to view them as obstacles removable through the process you so patiently explain. You taught me how to face them step by step, and how to anchor my life in the principle of following the instructions of guru and Krishna.

During this time, my daughter was within me, silently receiving the current of your words along with me. Often, I would replay the same class multiple times, carefully catching every phrase, and I would think, “She is also receiving this.” Today, I see her as a gift of your mercy linked to you, not just through me, but through the sound of your vani that she received even before birth, nourished by the same stream of transcendental sound.

On this auspicious day, I pray that I may forever remain under your shelter, serving you in whatever small way I can, carrying your words within my heart until they blossom into unwavering devotion. Your love and guidance have captured my life completely, and by your mercy, I aspire only to be your servant, now and always.

Your servant, and daughter
Ananga Sundari devi dasi

Hare Krishna dear Guru Maharaj
 Please accept my humble obeisances at your lotus feet
 All Glories to Srila Prabhupada and your Holiness.
 
 I’m very grateful and infinitely indebted to have your divine shelter in my life. As I look back into my life’s journey, it’s inconceivable how your compassion, your divine presence has transformed my life, the lives of my family members, and all of them whom I know. And yet, as a neophyte, I’m just starting to realize this aspect - considering what our incredible fortune has been in this life after traversing through 8.4 million species to connect with a bonafide Guru completely surrendered to Srila Prabhupada.
 
 Guru Maharaj, I want to offer my gratitude for so many things to you. Today I am reminded of an instance from 2020 when moments of your association changed our life. During this time, my wife, Anuradha Priya DD not initiated then was battling 4th stage cancer. None of the treatments were working. She was bedridden for 8 months and doctors felt she could pass away any moment. Under this critical situation of intense pain, battling life and death, her faith was very shaky and mostly down. With two children aged 5 and 13, she had constant anxiety of separation from children which could happen any moment. The devotees of the Michigan congregation were constantly serving us with counseling, prasadam, their intense prayers, taking care of our kids, grocery shopping, and so many other innumerable ways that are beyond our comprehension. However, since we had just stepped into Krishna consciousness, this reversal in life combined with no results from any treatment and our previous misguided association acted as a deterrent to Krishna consciousness for my wife. Needless to say, I was helpless, clueless, and could not be of any service other than praying for help. It was during this time that HG Yugal Kishore Prabhu kindly arranged for a disciple meeting with you for all the devotees in the Michigan congregation over Zoom. It was a very sweet meeting where all the devotees were offering their heartfelt gratitude and seeking your blessings, and it was as if you were distributing benedictions filled with enormous love. Just seeing the exchanges filled our hearts with gratitude. When my turn came, I was blank and couldn't speak anything. At this time, HG Yugal Kishore Prabhu kindly briefed you on our family situation and requested your prayers for my wife. During this time, you spoke to her for less than a minute. You affectionately spoke to her saying - Krishna is with her in this fight and she should do the needful. You also mentioned you will pray for her. That association of a few moments was transformatory for my wife and my entire family. The care, love, and affection that she experienced gave her strength, and you instilled her faith which didn't exist moments before. Srila Bhaktivinod Thakur sings - ohe vaishnava thakur, dayaro sagor…….krishna je tomar krishna dite paro, tomaro sakati aache. Lava matra sadhu sange sarva siddhi hoye. I could see a tremendous transformation in her from that moment. Because of the power of the prayers of a pure devotee as yourself, her health immediately in 2 weeks started improving radically and she regained very close to normal health. This reboosted her faith, and she was able to continue in Krishna consciousness, and her heart was filled with gratitude for what she received. During this time, she had expressed many times her desire to serve all the congregation devotees someday who were constantly serving us. After having a healthy life for about 2 years, the cancer was back, and her health began to deteriorate in 2022. During all this time, she had an intense desire to get initiation from you and get the beads from your divine lotus hands in person. As her health continued to deteriorate, I did not know how this would be practically feasible, and I suggested that she consider online initiation as in my heart, I knew that time is running out. But she was persistent in her desire. Towards Nov 2022, we were notified about upcoming initiations in Ohio in the next few weeks. She was very excited about it, but I knew it had challenges because by this time, she had lost her mobility significantly. Just days before the initiation, as my anxiety grew on how to carry her to Ohio, we were told that you were coming to ISKCON Farmington Hills for the initiation ceremony which was a 7-minute drive from our home. This overwhelmed us with joy, and we could understand immediately it was an immense shower of mercy from your Holiness. Even better, you were coming on the occasion of your divine appearance. It was on this occasion that she got initiated. Time flew quickly, and we were on the day of initiation. During initiation, as she was trying to somehow wobble and move towards you due to low mobility, you noticed her approaching slowly, and the first thing you said on noticing her was, “I’m praying for you.” Visually, she looked way different from when you had seen her in 2020. This was due to the chemo treatment her looks had changed, but we understood - you could see the soul within and immediately identify. Guru Maharaj, this meant so much for us. After all, who are we? We are just nobody, but your love is so unconditional. Your love towards us is non-different from the love that Krishna has saksad hari twena samasta sastrair. And this is our hope, Guru Maharaj. We could be no one today, but if we could develop genuine sincere loving service towards you, then our this birth would be most successful. Going back to after initiation, 24 days after the initiation, your spiritual daughter, Anuradha Priya DD, left her body, surrounded by devotees with giriraj charanamrit, dust of Govardhan sprinkled on her body, maha garland of Sri Sri Radha Kunjabihari, Sri Sri Radha Gopijana Vallabh, and Sri Sri Radha Shyam Sundar. You were on the flight when all this was happening, but by your divine arrangement, there was HH Radha Govind Das Goswami Maharaj and HG Malati Prabhu and so many congregation devotees on a Zoom call chanting for her in the middle of the night. Our sincerest heartfelt gratitude for delivering Anuradha Priya, Guru Maharaj. As I look back, this is incomprehensible even today in my mind how this happened, but it's purely your causeless compassion by which there's a shower of unlimited mercy. Going back to the Zoom call of 2020, you showed by personal example what is actually compassion through your genuine care and affection. Having seen this, experiencing this, I realized that it's not just the words that made a difference, but your genuine pure devotion and your mood of servant of the servant in service to Srila Prabhupada. Guru Maharaj, at this point, I want to admit and beg you for something. I have to admit that I am totally unqualified to be your disciple as I don't have any devotion in my heart and I’m bereft of even a drop of the mood that you carry. I would humbly beg, clasping your lotus feet, to bestow your causeless mercy so that I can serve Srila Prabhupada’s movement birth after birth in the mood of servant of servant with genuine devotion. I want to please you, Guru Maharaj, by sincerely following your instructions. You had mentioned to senior devotees that the below five items would please you, and hence I humbly seek your blessings:
 - Going deep into hearing, chanting, and service
 - Cultivating the mood of pleasing Krishna
 - Striving to be united as a community
 - Practicing enthusiasm to share Bhakti Krishna consciousness
 - Never forgetting that Bhakti is not about quantity but about pleasing Guru and Krishna.
 - Being a good example personally for the upbringing of children in a Krishna conscious way.
 
 I have so much to share because your causeless mercy is infinitely protecting and inspiring us, but I seek your blessings so that I can journal these going forward as my memory is fading away and I don't want to lose these moments.
 
 Before concluding, I want to offer my highest gratitude to you for your causeless mercy:
 - Giving me devotees in my life, especially some devotees who are constantly sustaining me on a day-to-day basis
 - Reconnecting us always with Srila Prabhupada’s mission
 - Gifting with your classes - always stressing on pure devotional service, how we can please Krishna and his devotees Vaishnav seva. In fact, your love for your God brothers and God sisters, Vrajavasis, and for all devotees in general is heart-melting and always reflects your love towards Srila Prabhupada.
 - Giving your invaluable association in Kartik yatra thru Hari Katha, Hari Kirtan, giving us the unlimited opportunity to get your divine association and the association of those whom you love, amidst your super busy schedule - you were cooking for us, you are making us realize how grateful we need to be to all those who are serving to making this yatra happen, you are showing us every moment how much you value your God brothers and God sisters and practically everyone around you.
 - Giving us unlimited opportunity to learn so much during Kartik yatra from the association of all exalted devotees around us.
 - Giving us a wonderful congregation in Michigan and enthusing us every moment.
 - Gifting us with your divine association during Sadhu Sanga this year.
 - And many more….
 
 Last but not the least, Guru Maharaj, you’re giving us so much and in fact persistently giving yourself to us despite all odds. I beg for your blessings so that one day I understand your heart and can be a menial instrument to give you pleasure in each and every thing I do, every moment to moment. I offer my sincere prayers at the lotus feet of Sri Sri Radha Kunjabihari, Sri Sri Radha Gopijana Vallabh, Sri Sri Jagannath Baladev Mai Subhadra, Sri Sri Gaura Nitai, and Sri Sri Nitai Patita Pavan Gaurahari that they bestow you long life with good health so that you can deliver millions of souls for the pleasure of Srila Prabhupada.}}
 Your insignificant servant
 Ananta Vilas Das

Thank you so much for guiding me and giving me faith in bhakti.

Your katha is like the current of life for me. If your katha were not there, perhaps the chariot of my devotion would have remained stuck in one place, like a chariot without wheels. No matter how many difficulties come into my life, your katha has that magic that makes me stand up again. Just as a traveler wandering in the desert feels satiated even by a single drop of water, your katha works in my life in the same way.

The way you focus on the essence of bhakti in your lectures, especially on the mood and attitude with which one should serve, is something I have never heard anywhere else.

Everyone is busy encouraging each other. It was very inspiring to see the values you have imparted to the devotees and the excellent culture that has been established through them.

Maharaj, I have not had much personal interaction with you in my life, nor am I so fortunate. However, I feel a connection with you from many, many lifetimes. I know full well that I am a very fallen, lowly, and sinful soul, always engrossed in sinful activities. It is definitely only by your mercy that I am able to perform whatever little devotion I can.

Guru Maharaj, I am in extreme need of your mercy; otherwise, I do not know when I might lose this opportunity as well. Please accept me as your duly initiated disciple.

My prayer at your lotus feet is that for the ocean of love that is in your heart for Krishna, Radha Rani, the Acharyas, and Srila Prabhupada, may even a single drop of it arise in my heart. May this heart, which has been a house of garbage for lifetimes, become purified, and may the Lord manifest fully within it. May I have respect and loving friendship for the devotees in my heart, and deep respect for the spiritual masters.

I am currently at a phase in my life from where this life can turn me in any direction, and Maya devi is trying her best to trap me in her illusion. I humbly pray to you to please give me your blessings, accept my prayers, and protect me.

May I always remain grateful to you and never even have the thought of leaving your lotus feet. May I always remain under your protection, or under the protection of your senior devotees.

Your aspiring servant,
Anmol Varshney

Dear Gurudev,
 Please accept my humble obeisances at your lotus feet. All glories to Srila Prabhupada. On this sacred day of your seventy-fifth appearance, my heart longs to glorify you — for your presence is a blessing that brings life, hope, and devotion to countless souls.
 
 Gurudev, you are the living expression of Srila Prabhupada’s compassion. Every word you speak, every gentle action you take, and every tear that falls from your eyes reflects your unwavering love for Srila Prabhupada and his movement. In your heart, Srila Prabhupada’s desires remain safe; through your life, his vision continues to flourish. Whenever I think of you, I feel that Srila Prabhupada must be smiling, for you carry his legacy with such sincerity, humility, and purity that even sacred places awaken under your touch.
 
 By your inspiration, forgotten heritage has risen again. In Vrindavan, I visited Radha Damodar Temple — where Srila Prabhupada prayed and prepared to fulfill his spiritual master’s desire — your devotion feels alive, like an unbroken continuation of his offering. Standing near Rupa Goswami’s samadhi, one can sense the very qualities you embody: humility, gentleness, and a deep longing to serve. At Sanatan Goswami’s samadhi, your sincerity shines like a quiet flame — reminding all who come near that devotion is measured not by quantity but by the simplicity of the heart. And at Narottam Das Thakur’s samadhi mandir, the loving way you share Krishna consciousness — through warmth, care, and genuine affection — feels like a living reflection of his own devotional mood.
 
 Your life carries sacredness wherever you walk. And in Kolkata, I witnessed something extraordinary. Bhaktivinoda Asan — once a neglected, dilapidated house — now stands beautifully restored, dignified, and spiritually vibrant. This is the place where Srila Bhaktivinoda Thakur wrote, prayed, and nourished the seeds of Lord Chaitanya’s teachings for the modern age. To see it revived felt like witnessing history come alive. Only someone carrying Srila Prabhupada’s heart could restore such an important jewel of Gaudiya heritage with such care and devotion. In that moment, I felt deeply that Srila Prabhupada must be so pleased with you.
 
 Gurudev, your qualities are beyond explanation. Your humility softens even the hardest hearts. Your compassion heals those who feel forgotten. Your kindness gives hope to souls who have lost direction. Your forgiveness melts hurt. Your presence alone brings comfort. You guide not with force, but with love so deep that it inspires transformation from within.
 
 To glorify you is to glorify the very essence of devotion. Your life shows what it means to serve Srila Prabhupada with one’s entire being — mind, heart, breath, and soul. Because of you, sacred places are awakening, devotees are finding shelter, and Srila Prabhupada’s movement is becoming strong, vibrant, and lovingly nourished.
 
 On this holy day, I pray that even one drop of your qualities may someday touch my heart. Please bless me to become humble, gentle, sincere, and dedicated like you, and to serve Srila Prabhupada’s movement with affection and devotion.
 
 Gurudev, thank you for being there. Thank you for loving Srila Prabhupada so purely. Thank you for pouring compassion into the world and touching the hearts of so many with your tenderness. Thank you for all that you have given, all that you continue to give, and all that you will inspire for generations.
 With deep gratitude, affection, and surrender,
 I place this small offering at your lotus feet.
 
 Your eternally aspiring servant,

 खरंतर महाराजांबरोबरची माझी पहिली यात्रा जगन्नाथ पुरी येथे झाली. त्यावेळेस महाराजांचे जवळून दर्शन झाले नाही. जेव्हा दुसरी यात्रा माझी मायापूर येथे झाली, तेव्हा महाराजांचे जवळून दर्शन झाले. तेव्हा मला खूप आनंद वाटला. आता या वेळेस वृंदावन येथील गोवर्धन येथे तर माझ्यावर कृपा झाली. महाराजांचे अगदी जवळून दर्शनाचे भाग्य मला लाभले. या यात्रेत खरंतर मला सेवा करणाऱ्या लातूर ग्रुपच्या माताजींसोबत जाण्याचा योग दोन दिवस आधी आला. जेव्हा आम्ही गोवर्धन येथे पोहोचलो, तेथे माताजींसोबत सेवा करण्याची संधी मला मिळाली. आम्ही माताजींसोबत ड्रायफ्रूट्स कटिंग करण्याची सेवा केली. मला समजले की महाराज येथे येणार आहेत. मी अगदी थोड्याच वेळाने पाहिले, महाराज तेथे आले. आम्ही सर्व माताजी त्यांच्या स्वागतासाठी बाहेर आलो. महाराज गाडीतून उतरले आणि हात जोडून सर्वांना पाहत होते. पाहत पाहत समोर येत होते आणि मी आणि माझी मुलगी हात जोडून त्यांना दंडवत प्रणाम केला. मला त्यावेळेस असे वाटले की महाराज आपल्या नेत्राद्वारे कृपेचा वर्षाव माझ्यावर आणि माझ्या मुलीवर करत आहेत. तो क्षण माझ्यासाठी खूप अविस्मरणीय होता. महाराजांच्या अंगी नम्रता हा गुण खरच खूप ग्रेट आहे. गोवर्धन येथील सात दिवसाच्या यात्रेत महाराजांकडून मला गोवर्धन लीला ऐकण्यास मिळाल्या. आणि महाराजांचे कीर्तन त्याहून ग्रेट. महाराजांचे संकीर्तन चाल दररोज वेगळी असायची आणि ती मला खूप आवडली. जेव्हा महाराज म्हणायचे "जय जय श्री राधे...", तेव्हा असं वाटायचं की खरंच राधा राणीजवळ आपण जाऊन पोहोचलो आहोत. जसं काय आपल्याला महाराज गोलकधामात घेऊन गेले आहेत असे वाटले. शेवटी एवढीच भगवंताच्या चरणी प्रार्थना करते की महाराजांचे आरोग्य सुदृढ लाभो आणि महाराजांचा असा संघ मला दरवर्षी भेटत राहो, हीच ईश्वरचरणी प्रार्थना. माझ्या आध्यात्मिक सेवेत प्रगती होत राहो, हीच गुरु चरणी प्रार्थना.

Dear Gurudev, Please accept my humble obeisances.

 Recently, during the auspicious Kārtika month, I had the great fortune to hear your transcendental lecture series on the childhood pastimes of Bāla Gopāla in Gokula and Vṛndāvana.
 You beautifully described how the gopīs became fully immersed when Śrī Kṛṣṇa played His enchanting flute, forgetting everything—home, family, and worldly duties—drawn only by His divine call.
 You spoke of Yaśodā-māī, lovingly churning butter while singing the glories of her beloved Kṛṣṇa, her mind and heart completely absorbed in Him. You reminded us how the entire land of Gokula and Vṛndāvana lived in full immersion—every action, every breath centered around Kṛṣṇa.
 You also narrated how Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, while conversing with Śrī Rāmānanda Rāya, became deeply immersed in the transcendental pastimes of Lord Kṛṣṇa. In those moments of divine ecstasy, Mahāprabhu revealed the profound moods of separation and love that reside in the heart of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī. Hearing this, our hearts were carried to the banks of the Godāvarī, where Mahāprabhu tasted the nectar of Kṛṣṇa’s līlā.
 You also shared how our great ācāryas were immersed in the Lord’s pastimes:
 Śrīla Haridāsa Ṭhākura, who immersed his entire being in chanting the holy name with unwavering love and faith.
 Śrīla Rūpa Gosvāmī, so deeply absorbed in remembrance of Śrī Śrī Rādhā-Kṛṣṇa, that he once did not even recognize Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī Herself when She personally appeared before him.
 And Śrīla Prabhupāda, who immersed himself in the order of his spiritual master, crossing oceans with complete faith to carry forward the mission of Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu to every corner of the world.
 Gurudeva, you immerse yourself fully in the līlā of the Lord, and through your devotional narration, you draw our hearts into that same sacred space. Your gentle voice, combined with special sound effects, makes the experience so vivid that it feels as if the Lord’s pastimes are unfolding right before us.
 
 Following in the footsteps of our Guru-paramparā, you bring all of us—your disciples and followers—into that same spiritual current of bhakti, allowing us to taste a drop of the sweet nectar of the Lord’s līlā.
 
 On this most auspicious day of your 75th Vyāsa-pūjā, I bow down at your lotus feet and offer my heartfelt prayer:
 “May I receive even a tiny drop of the deep immersion you carry in your heart for the pastimes of Śrī Kṛṣṇa. If by your mercy I can taste even a small portion of that bhakti-rasa, my life will be truly successful.”
 
 Gurudeva, thank you for allowing us to experience the sweetness of the Lord’s pastimes through your pure heart and words.
 
 Please bless me so that I may always remain immersed in devotional service, connected to your lotus feet, and anchored in the eternal shelter of Śrī Śrī Rādhā-Kṛṣṇa and their pure devotees.

As I sit at the sacred foothills of Girirāj Govardhan, meditating on your innumerable divine qualities, my heart becomes overwhelmed with gratitude for the unlimited mercy and love you continuously shower upon me—especially through the transcendental sound vibration of your lectures.

In Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam, Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī glorifies Govardhan Hill as haridāsa–vārya, “the best among the servants of Lord Hari.” Why? Because Girirāj provides Śrī Kṛṣṇa, Balarāma, Their cows, calves, and cowherd friends with everything they need—cooling water, soft nourishing grass, protective caves, and a variety of fruits, flowers, and vegetables.

In a similar and deeply meaningful way, you, Gurudeva, are among the finest servants of Śrīla Prabhupāda. Like Girirāj Govardhan:

You offer water-like nectarean lectures that quench the intense thirst of my heart for Kṛṣṇa-kathā - your voice overflowing with love, devotion, and a child-like enthusiasm that awakens life in my spiritual journey.

You offer caves of shelter in the form of your empowered disciples, whose guidance and care perfectly reflect your mood of compassion and devotee care—just as Govardhan’s caves provide relief and protection.

Your humility is like the soft grass of Govardhan, embodying the instruction of Mahāprabhu—tṛṇād api sunīcena. Witnessing your interactions with your godbrothers nourishes us with the sweetness of genuine Vaiṣṇava humility.

Your presence is fragrant like Govardhan’s flowers, naturally attracting the hearts of devotees and non-devotees alike. Whoever comes near you inevitably receives divine nourishment—just as bees receive nectar simply by coming close to blossoming flowers.

Your teachings are the fruits and vegetables of Govardhan, full of essential spiritual vitamins—gratitude, forgiveness, love, cooperation, humility—which strengthen our immunity against the relentless influence of Māyā.

 Your insignificant servant,

Hare Krishna dear Guru Maharaj,
 I offer my repeated obeisances at your lotus feet, O spiritual master, by your mercy alone one receives the mercy of the Supreme Lord.
 
 Guru Maharaj, this is my first attempt to write an offering, so I beg your blessings to express my heart sincerely and purely.
 
 In this iron age of Kali, conditioned souls like me are naturally pulled away from Krishna by the strong currents of material desires. The shackles of sense gratification bind me tightly, creating endless cravings that push me from one birth to another, making me suffer again and again.
 
 Although I am an eternal servant of Krishna, due to my misfortune I have remained indifferent to Him since time immemorial. Identifying myself with this temporary body, I wandered throughout this world, burning in the threefold miseries—
 ādhyātmika, ādhibhautika, and ādhidaivika.
 
 Running after puja, labha, and pratistha, I befriended those who inflated my ego and distanced myself from those who challenged it. Thus entangled, I passed lifetimes changing bodies repeatedly.
 
 But by Krishna’s causeless mercy, after millions of births, I have miraculously come under your shelter. Your compassion has given me the greatest fortune of my life—the association of Hari, Guru, and Vaishnavas.
 
 Your words have touched my heart. Your instructions have given me spiritual direction, emotional strength, and clarity in every aspect of my life—material, spiritual, mental, and psychological.
 
 By your mercy:
 
 • I have received opportunities to render service to the Deities and devotees.
 • I have received a counselor who guides me with patience, care, and genuine affection.
 He protects me, corrects me, and uplifts me during my spiritual, emotional, and material challenges.

 Whatever progress I have made is only by your mercy flowing through him.
 • And by your inconceivable kindness, even my mother has become a devotee.
 She attended the Kartik Yatra and is now aspiring to take initiation from you.
 This is one of the happiest moments of my life.
 
 Everything auspicious in my life is coming only by your shelter and your blessings.
 
 Guru Maharaj, I pray for your good health and long life so that you continue to guide countless souls who are lost and suffering, like me. Your presence protects us, purifies us, and gives us hope.

 I beg for your shelter birth after birth.
 Please allow me to remain your servant eternally.
 Your aspiring servant,

Dear Gurumaharaj,
 Please accept my respectful obeisances at your lotus feet.
 All glories to Śrīla Prabhupāda.
 By a great stroke of mercy, earlier this year I sat before you at ISKCON of Silicon Valley, surrendering my life. Devotees told me that accepting you as my spiritual master might mean little, if any, personal association. Though this made me nervous, I knew I had to accept it and learn to serve as your disciple regardless.
 You are actually present before me at all times, giving me strength and inspiration to carry on. As Śrīla Bhaktivinoda Ṭhākura sings, *ekaki āmāra nāhi pāya bala harināma-saṅkīrtana* — on our own, we have no strength in devotional service and cannot propagate the glories of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu. But simply by serving His bona fide representative, in the mood of the servant of the servant, we receive the most precious drop of faith.
 Your disciples are your limbs, and everything we do is actually done by you alone. By your divine instructions and flawless example, you nurture the creeper of faith within our hearts and allow us the privilege of serving Kṛṣṇa through harināma-saṅkīrtana.
 The spiritual father or guru is dear because of his relationship with Kṛṣṇa — the ultimate reality. Uddhava glorifies the Lord, explaining that Kṛṣṇa appears externally as the ācārya in order to lead the conditioned souls back home, back to Godhead. As Kṛṣṇa’s pure representative, you are our lifeline on the path of pure devotional service. Just as Kṛṣṇa can simultaneously reciprocate with each of His devotees, you also reciprocate with your disciples. Through your lectures, you mirror His words, qualities, and desires — so that a conditioned soul like myself may find inspiration and guidance.
 The life of Śrīla Prabhupāda is a tangible example of what it means to give oneself fully in Kṛṣṇa’s service, and you have followed in the wake of his lotus footsteps, devoting your entire life — from youth to old age — to inspiring and encouraging others to surrender to Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu’s lotus feet.
 I do not feel qualified to be the servant of such a glorious master as yourself, but as the Lord tells Prahlāda Mahārāja:
 “Those who follow your example will naturally become My pure devotees. You are the best example of My devotee, and others should follow in your footsteps.”
 Therefore, I feel justified in making the bold request that you please allow me to do as you have done — to give up all material desires, all petty weaknesses of heart, and all lingering ambitions for name and fame, and instead develop the spiritual desire to uplift others and devote my entire life in your service.
 As Śrīla Bhaktivinoda Ṭhākura prays, *śakti-buddhi-hīna āmi ati dīna, koro’ more ātma-sātha* — although I am devoid of all strength and intelligence, I beg you to please make me your beloved servant.
 Your aspiring servant,
 Balarām Gopāla Dāsa
