Meeting with our dear Guru Maharaj in Alachua
 ________________________________________
 May/June 2025
 It was the Memorial Day long weekend in the United States, a time when the Sadhu Sanga retreat is held annually. Devotees from across the country were traveling to attend, and it had been announced that several esteemed sannyasis and senior Vaishnavas would be present. Immediately following Sadhu Sanga, a special memorial program was scheduled in Deland, Florida, to honor the divine memory of His Holiness Bhakti Charu Maharaj. Many devotees from Atlanta planned to attend both events and then continue to Alachua, where our beloved spiritual master, His Holiness Radhanath Swami Maharaj, was expected to spend a few days.
 It was announced that Guru Maharaj would be giving the Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam class on Wednesday, followed by a panel discussion on Thursday evening with His Holiness Sivarama Swami Maharaj. All disciples were invited to attend the program in the temple room.
 Revathy and I decided to drive to Alachua from Atlanta, on Thursday to attend the panel discussion. We left Atlanta around 11:30 a.m. and reached Alachua by 5:00 p.m. After checking into a Holiday Inn and freshening up, we arrived at the temple by 5:35 p.m., only to find it surprisingly quiet. The temple room was nearly empty, and we saw very few devotees. Concerned, we tried reaching out to friends from Atlanta to confirm whether the program was still on, but received no immediate responses. We left messages, unsure of what to do next.
 While pondering our situation, I noticed a quiet Brahmachari honoring prasadam. I approached him and asked if the program had been canceled or moved. With a bright smile, he greeted me warmly, saying, “I’m so happy to see you, Mataji!” I replied, “I'm very happy to see you too.” When I inquired about the panel discussion, he informed me—rather regretfully—that it had recently been canceled.
 A bit disheartened, I asked if there were any other programs happening or if there might be a chance for a darshan with Guru Maharaj. He suggested I check with some matajis in the temple kitchen. As I made my way there, he suddenly came running to me with a spark of inspiration: “Call Pran Govind Prabhu. He’s with Maharaj and might know if there’s a home program.” He gave me the number, but as I already had it saved, I called immediately.
 To my relief, Pran Govind Prabhu answered. I introduced myself and explained that we had driven all the way from Atlanta, hoping for even a brief darshan with Guru Maharaj. He asked, “Did you come from Charlotte?” and I clarified, “No, from Atlanta.” He said, “Give me ten minutes. I will speak with Guru Maharaj and let you know.”
 While waiting in the temple room, Revathy and I debated whether we should just return home. I was growing impatient and felt sure no one would call us back. Our friends responded that since the program was canceled, they left to Orlando. Just as we reversed the car, ready to leave, my phone rang.
 It was Pran Govind Prabhu: “Mother Preethivilasini, where are you?”
 “I’m still at the temple,” I replied.
 He said, “Guru Maharaj wants to talk to you!”
 I was stunned. “What?! Okay!” I put the phone on speaker so Revathy could hear.
 Then came the most unexpected and heart-melting moment.
 “Hare Krishna Preethivilasini Mataji, please accept my humble obeisances. All glories to Srila Prabhupada,” came the kind and gentle voice of our Guru Maharaj.
 Overwhelmed and choked up, we both offered our respectful obeisances and replied, “Hare Krishna Guru Maharaj!”
 He continued, “So you drove all the way from Atlanta?”
 “Yes, Maharaj.”
 “Unfortunately, the program was canceled. Sivarama Maharaj decided to cancel, and I was pulled into some private meetings; it has been an exhausting day. I’m sorry you came all this way only to find it canceled.”
 We quickly responded, “Please, Maharaj, don’t apologize. We understand completely. Thank you so much for calling us—it means the world to us.”
 Then came the moment we will never forget.
 “Since you came all the way,” he said, “I will come and see you.”
 We were stunned and said, “Maharaj!?”
 He said, “How many of you are there?”
 “Just the two of us—my friend Revathy and me.”
 He smiled, “I’ll come under one condition: I will meet you under a tree in the parking lot. I’m not coming inside the temple or anywhere there’s a crowd. This visit is just for you two.”
 We said, “Guru Maharaj, we do not want you to take the trouble; we will come and see you there.”
 He said, “Yes, it is a great trouble; I am surrounded by an ocean of crocodiles and snakes,” and he chuckled. He said, “I will see you in about 15 minutes.”
 We were speechless.
 We waited under a tree, soaking in the surreal beauty of the moment. Revathy said, “Should we ask him to sign a book? Or maybe we should prepare a spiritual question?” We nervously rehearsed what we might say.
 But suddenly, it began to rain heavily—almost apocalyptically. We had to run to the car for shelter. I told Revathy, “Maybe we’re not destined to meet him after all.”
 She calmly replied, “Who told you rain is a bad omen? This rain is a blessing—it means Guru Maharaj will come.”
 I messaged Pran Govind Prabhu about the rain, saying Guru Maharaj needs shelter. His reply: “We will be there soon!”
 Within minutes, a car zipped into the parking lot—it was Guru Maharaj and Pran Govind Prabhu!
 We ran to the car and offered our obeisances. As we got up, Maharaj stepped out gracefully, looked up at the rain, and said with joy, “Ah! I like the rain!” Then he walked to the tree and gestured, “Come, come to the tree.”
 Despite the rain, he was cheerful, laughing and speaking with his characteristic warmth and humility.
 I said, “Guru Maharaj, it is raining; should we go to a place where there is shelter? You are getting wet.” He said, “Where is it?” I showed a distant shelter, and he dismissed that option, saying, “By the time we get there, we are going to get more wet!” and we agreed.
 I said, “Guru Maharaj, I’m so grateful that you prayed for my husband when he passed in 2020. I feel assured, by your mercy, that he has reached a safe destination.” He looked at me with such compassion. I continued, “Please bless us, that we may develop even a little love for Krishna and always remain loyal to you.”
 He smiled.
 I then introduced Revathy, saying, “She has been aspiring to become an initiated disciple of you for 12 years.” Maharaj turned to her with a compassionate glance.
 Revathy humbly said, “Guru Maharaj, you’re supposed to be taking service from us, but here you are serving us instead.”
 Maharaj laughed deeply, “Yes! Indeed, you’re making me serve you!”
 The rain soon stopped.
 Pran Govind Prabhu, who was holding an umbrella, joked, “Even Indra is afraid of you, Maharaj!”
 Maharaj replied, “Now I’m taking credit for things I didn’t do?!” and laughed again.
 Guru Maharaj said, “Don’t you think it’s good the program got canceled? Otherwise, we wouldn’t have had this beautiful meeting under a tree! This is the highlight of my Alachua trip.”
 We were overwhelmed. We replied in unison, “This is the highlight of our lives, Maharaj!”
 Then he asked, “How is Atlanta?” I told him it is very nice and how I’d lived in many places but finally decided to settle there.
 Pran Govind Prabhu added, “She conducts wonderful online classes.”
 Guru Maharaj asked for details about the name of the group and the classes conducted. I shared that our Bhakti Sanga Japa Group has morning chanting, Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam and Chaitanya Bhāgavata classes, and evening kids' classes for various age groups. He then asked about our audience reach; I explained that we have a YouTube reach of over 1,000 and about 50–60 regular live attendees.
 He asked, “Who all are the speakers?” I mentioned speakers and attendees from across the U.S., U.K., U.A.E., and India, including Pran Govind Prabhu. Pran Govind Prabhu added the names of several senior devotees like Chandramauli Maharaj and Chaitanya Charan Prabhu.
 Pran Govind Prabhu recalled, “Maharaj, you came into a Bhakti Sanga class while Chandramauli Swami was speaking.”
 Maharaj chuckled and said, “I invaded into his class; I came to see him and sat next to him and joined the class.”
 We told him joyfully, “Yes, Maharaj! That was a highlight for us—we took screenshots and celebrated your darshan, saying Guru Maharaj came to Bhakti Sanga!”
 Soon, Maharaj requested Pran Govind Prabhu’s son to bring two full plates of prasadam. Maharaj said, “Bring nice full plates, not something small.”
 As more devotees noticed Maharaj's presence, they started coming over. Meanwhile, Pran Govind Prabhu told us we must take pictures, and he started taking pictures of our meeting under the tree!
 As devotees joined in, they also took pictures with him. Guru Maharaj introduced us to them, saying, “These two wonderful ladies came all the way to see me, so I came to meet them.”
 I profusely thanked Pran Govind Prabhu for arranging this wonderful meeting. The brahmachari I had first met later came over with an arati plate. I introduced him to Maharaj, saying he was instrumental in making this meeting happen. The brahmachari smiled and said, “Of course—she’s my Bhakti-śāstrī teacher.” I was surprised to learn that he was Akshar Prabhu, a sincere student from our classes.
 As Pran Govind Prabhu’s son was bringing the plates, Maharaj remarked, “This must be very precious and special; look at the way he is carrying the plates with delicate care.” Later, Maharaj said, “I will give it to them,” and handed them to us with loving care. As we dropped our water bottles trying to accept the plates, others chuckled and said, “Look! Water bottles are on the ground,” and Pran Govind Prabhu said, “Looks like their hands are full!”
 Maharaj asked, “Are you staying tonight?”
 Revathy and I replied, “We’ll check with the hotel front desk. Maybe we’ll return tonight if possible.”
 Maharaj said firmly, “First, eat nicely. Then rest well at the hotel and drive back tomorrow after proper rest.”
 We immediately agreed; it was our spiritual master’s order!
 Maharaj smiled, walked back to his car, and we stood watching until it disappeared from view.
 It was the most unforgettable moment of our lives. Every bite of prasadam tasted like nectar—Mahaprasad from the hands of a pure devotee. That night, we barely slept, our hearts full.
 The next day, we returned to Atlanta—forever transformed.}}
 Jaya Srila Gurudev!
 ________________________________________
 Lessons:
 Revathy reflected: “If there is one thing to deeply imbibe from Guru Maharaj, it is his extraordinary humility.”
 I reflected: Just as Lord Rama ran to receive Vibhishan with apologies for making him wait in the sky, our Guru Maharaj—more compassionate than even the Supreme Lord—crossed all obstacles to give mercy to fallen souls like us.
 The Varāha-Charama Śloka declares that the Lord never forgets His devotees, even if they forget Him. So too, our spiritual master remembers and acknowledges every single soul.
 Guru Maharaj not only speaks of humility in every class—he lives it. In every step, every gesture, every word.

 Your insignificant servant,

I feel that I am so fortunate that I got shelter at the lotus feet of my eternal spiritual master, HH Radhanath Swami Guru Maharaja. Obsessed with material desires, I was trying my best to be happy in this material world. But the more I tried to be happy here, the more frustrated I became. But by the grace of Maharaja, today I know that trying for pleasure in this land of death is like looking for nectar in a poison jar. But just knowing the fact is not sufficient enough to attain salvation. To attain liberation from a miserable life and attain shelter at the lotus feet of Krishna, we have to give up all material attachments and get joyfully attached to the lotus feet of Krishna, who is the source and reservoir of eternal pleasure.

On our own, to attain that state is an impossible task, but if we get the shelter of the lotus feet of pure devotees of Krishna, then crossing over the ocean of material miseries becomes very easy. Even Prahlada Maharaja says that the only way by which we can free ourselves from the clutches of material attachments is by bathing in the dust of the lotus feet of a devotee of Krishna.

We are fortunate that we have got an opportunity to take shelter of the dust of the lotus feet of HH Radhanath Swami Guru Maharaja, who is so fully absorbed in chanting and sharing the glories of Krishna constantly.

Just like the bright rays of the sun dissipate darkness, similarly, Maharaja illuminates the heart of unfortunate souls like me, who are engulfed in the darkness of ignorance. When we hear the glories of Krishna from the lotus mouth of Maharaja, then our heart, which mostly cries in pain because of material obsession, begins dancing in joy.

Maharaja dedicated his life at the lotus feet of Srila Prabhupada, and as per the desire and instruction of Prabhupada, he has been spending every moment of his life in spreading Krishna Consciousness all over the world. Maharaja’s dedication to Krishna Consciousness is unprecedented, his glories are unlimited, and his determination is unparalleled.

On his 75th Vyasa Puja, I would like to share a few glories of Maharaja which are so inspiring.

Experiencing joy in sharing Krishna Katha - Whenever I hear any lecture of Maharaja, I see that he speaks about Krishna from the core of his heart. He speaks for hours with great enthusiasm and energy. Sometimes, when he shares the pastimes of the Lord, it seems that he has been part of all those pastimes. During the recent Kartik Yatra in Govardhan, he spoke for hours about Krishna’s Govardhan lila. Maharaja spoke in such detail about the different places of Govardhan Parikrama that all of us who were hearing him did parikrama of Govardhan again and again just by hearing it from the lotus mouth of Maharaja.

The brajvasis lived with Krishna in Vrindavan 5000 years ago and enjoyed various pastimes with Krishna. By the grace of Maharaja, we got an opportunity to relish those inconceivable pastimes of Krishna sitting near Giriraj Govardhan this Kartik Yatra.

Just as Maharaja enjoys sharing pastimes of Krishna constantly, I pray to him for his mercy so that I develop a taste for constantly relishing Krishna katha.

Inspiring devotees to give up sense gratification: The goal of life is to give up material sense gratification and engage our senses in the service of Krishna. But we know that our senses have become so addicted to sense gratification that, in spite of us doing our best, we fail to give up the enjoying mentality. Scriptures say that only by the mercy of great souls, we will get the determination and ability to shun material enjoyment. In my experience, every morning when I get up, I take a vow not to indulge in sense gratification, but as the day passes, I find how difficult it is to say no to the demands of the mind and senses. In spite of knowing the danger of sense indulgence, I fail to give it up.

But at least during Kartik Yatra, I see that I get some strength to stay away from sense gratification. When I sit with hundreds of devotees hearing Maharaj’s katha, I experience how wonderful it is to engage senses in hearing the pastimes of Krishna.

Maharaja mercifully is teaching me how to shun sense gratification and indulge completely in the service of Krishna. By doing so, one day I will become eligible to go back to Godhead and live with Krishna and his wonderful devotees in his abode.

Teaching us to remember Srila Prabhupada: During the Govardhan Kartik yatra, we celebrated the 129th disappearance day of Srila Prabhupada in the pandal. Maharaj organized the program in such a wonderful way that we got an opportunity to hear wonderful glories of Prabhupada and important lessons which Prabhupada teaches us.

Devotees were so inspired to serve Prabhupada as per the guidelines of Maharaja that they cooked several bhoga items for Prabhupada. Maharaj, in one of the classes, said that there were 300 bhoga items which were offered to Prabhupada. We offered Pushpanjali to Prabhupada at noon, and there was guru puja followed by prasadam.

In the evening, Maharaj so beautifully sang – je anilo prem dhan. We all got so immersed in the song that we felt separation from Srila Prabhupada. Although physically I have never got the opportunity to take darshan of Prabhupada, but I am able to see him through Maharaja.
Seeing Maharaj’s dedication for Srila Prabhupada was so inspirational. We also learnt how our life should be dedicated to Srila Prabhupada and how we should be enthusiastically serving his mission.

Binding devotees together with love: One of the biggest challenges which people face in the world is their inability to get along with each other. Even in a small family, we see disputes, quarrels, heartbreaks, and complaints.

But it is amazing to see how during every Kartik Yatra, more than 10,000 devotees from different parts of the world stay together united for more than a week. There is no quarrel, disagreement, chaos, heartburns, and complaints. Everyone respects others and tries to help others.

Even if there are some challenges and difficulties, still devotees, understanding the circumstances, do not become disheartened and dissatisfied. It is because they know the purpose for which they have gathered.

And most importantly, the joy all gets in associating with Maharaj makes all difficulties and challenges appear insignificant. When the heart gets flooded with Maharaj’s nectarean lectures and melodious kirtan, then all material pains just disappear.

Teaching us how to see all spiritual masters with equal vision: Maharaj teaches by his own example how we should deal with the disciples of Srila Prabhupada, the present spiritual masters in ISKCON, and all the devotees who are connected with ISKCON.
Maharaja showers great love and respect especially upon his godbrothers and godsisters. This is why we see so many of his godbrothers and godsisters come during Maharaj’s Kartik Yatra year after year. We also get an opportunity to hear from them their personal realizations and their experience of dealing with Srila Prabhupada. Maharaj teaches us that we should not be guru fanatic. We should see all spiritual masters with equal vision and should have utmost respect for them.

Maharaj’s glories are unlimited, but I am trying to share a few of those for my personal purification. On Maharaja’s 75th Vyasa Puja, I pray at the divine feet of Sri Sri Radha Govinda, Lord Jagannath, Baladeva, and Subhadra Maharani, Sri Sri Nitai Gauranga, and Srila Prabhupada to give me determination so that I follow the footsteps of Maharaja and never leave his lotus feet. I also beg at the lotus feet of Maharaja to shower his mercy upon me so that I develop distaste for sense gratification and develop taste in hearing and sharing the glories of Krishna.

HH Radhanath Swami Guru Maharaj’s eternal servant
Purushottam Nitai Das
ISKCON Newtown, Kolkata, India

आपल्यापैकी प्रत्येकजण आपल्या जीवनात महाराजांची कृपा आणि सहवास मिळवून भाग्यवान समजतो. जेव्हा जेव्हा मला माझ्या आयुष्यात कोणत्याही आव्हानांचा सामना करावा लागतो, तेव्हा मी महाराजांची व्याख्याने ऐकण्याचा किंवा जर्नी होम सारखी त्यांची पुस्तके वाचण्याचा प्रयत्न करते.

त्यांच्या शिकवणी दिव्य ज्ञानाने परिपूर्ण आहेत, त्यामुळे आलेल्या कोणत्याही परिस्थितीत सर्वोत्तम कृष्णभावनामृत उपाय शोधण्यास मदत होते. माझे आध्यात्मिक गुरु प.पू. राधानाथ स्वामी महाराज यांना त्यांच्या ७५ व्या व्यासपूजेनिमित्त मी अर्पण करते.

आपल्या आध्यात्मिक गुरूंच्या पावलावर पाऊल ठेवून, महाराजांनी आपले जीवन लोकांना शुद्ध आनंद देणाऱ्या आंतरिक संपत्तीचा शोध घेण्यास मदत करण्यासाठी समर्पित करण्याचा निर्णय घेतला. आणि जेव्हा आपण कृष्णाच्या चरणकमलांशी जोडले जातो, तेव्हाच ती आंतरिक संपत्ती आपल्याला मिळू शकते.

महाराज त्यांच्या व्याख्यानांमध्ये वारंवार यावर भर देतात की आपण बाहेरील जगात नाही, तर स्वतःमध्येच आनंद शोधला पाहिजे. महाराज म्हणतात, "जोपर्यंत माणूस स्वतःच्या हृदयात आनंदी नसतो, तोपर्यंत तो काहीही मिळवला तरी तो आनंदी राहू शकत नाही."

खरा खजिना आपल्या आत आहे. दुर्दैवाने, आपण तो विसरलो आहोत. पण एकदा तो आपल्याला मिळाला की, आपण आपल्या आयुष्यात कधीही दुःखी राहणार नाही.
पण दुर्दैवाने, कृष्णभावनेत येऊन आणि अनेक वर्षे साधना करूनही, आपल्याला तो आंतरिक आनंद मिळत नाही. आणि म्हणूनच कधीकधी आपल्याला भक्तांना एकमेकांशी जुळवून घेण्यात अडचणी येत असल्याच्या दुर्दैवी घटना घडतात. हे भक्त समुदायात असू शकते किंवा कुटुंबातही असू शकते.
आपल्याला आतून अतृप्त वाटत असल्याने, आपण बाह्य साधनांनी स्वतःला समाधानी करण्याचा प्रयत्न करतो. कधीकधी आपल्याला वाटते की संपत्ती जमवून आणि भौतिक सुविधा जमा करून आपण आनंदी राहू शकतो. किंवा आपण सत्ता आणि पदे मिळवण्यात आनंद घेऊ लागतो. आपण नाव आणि प्रसिद्धी शोधू लागतो. पण यातून आपल्याला फारसा आनंद मिळणार नाही.
खरं तर, हे शेवटी दुःखाचे कारण बनू शकतात. कोणत्याही बाह्य मार्गाने हृदय कधीही समाधानी होऊ शकत नाही. जर आपण आतून आनंदी असू, तर आपण नेहमीच समाधानी राहू आणि आपण सर्वत्र आनंद पसरवू शकू.

या ७५ व्या व्यासपूजेच्या शुभ प्रसंगी, माझे आध्यात्मिक गुरु प.पू. राधानाथ स्वामी महाराज यांचे मी हृदयापासून आभार मानते की त्यांनी मला कृष्णभावनेची संपत्ती प्रदान केली. त्यांच्या सूचनांचे नेहमी पालन करण्यासाठी आणि त्यांच्या इच्छेनुसार कृष्णाची सेवा करण्यासाठी मला बुद्धिमत्ता आणि दृढनिश्चय द्यावा, ज्यामुळे माझे मानवी जीवन यशस्वी होईल, अशी मी त्यांच्या चरणकमलांकडे प्रार्थना करते.

"Radhagita Dasi,Nasik  

My most beloved Gurudev,

Gurudev, I offer my millions of humble obeisances at your lotus feet.
In this dreadful and dark age of Kali, you have delivered me, and for that, I express my deepest gratitude.

Time and again, you have helped me engage in service and devotional practices. I pray for strength, enthusiasm, humility, tolerance, Vaishnava seva, and the opportunity to distribute transcendental literature.

Each one of us considers ourselves fortunate to receive your mercy and association in our lives. Whenever I face challenges, I try to listen to your lectures or read your books like The Journey Home.

Your teachings are filled with divine wisdom, guiding us to find the best Krishna-conscious solutions in any situation. On this auspicious occasion of your 75th Vyasa Puja, I offer my heartfelt gratitude to my spiritual master, His Holiness Radhanath Swami Maharaj.

Following in the footsteps of our spiritual masters, Maharaj has dedicated his life to helping people discover the inner wealth that brings true happiness. And that inner treasure can only be attained when we connect with the lotus feet of Krishna.

Maharaj repeatedly emphasizes in his lectures that real happiness is not found in the external world but within ourselves. Maharaj says:
""Unless a person is happy within his own heart, no matter what he achieves, he cannot be truly happy.""

The real treasure lies within us. Unfortunately, we have forgotten it. But once we rediscover it, we will never be unhappy again.

Sadly, even after coming to Krishna consciousness and practicing for years, we sometimes fail to experience that inner joy. This is why unfortunate situations arise where devotees struggle to harmonize with each other—whether in the community or within families.

When we feel unfulfilled inside, we try to satisfy ourselves through external means—by accumulating wealth, material comforts, power, positions, fame, and recognition. But these cannot give us lasting happiness. In fact, they often become sources of suffering. No external method can ever satisfy the heart.

If we are joyful within, we will always remain content and spread happiness everywhere.

On this auspicious occasion of your 75th Vyasa Puja, I offer my heartfelt gratitude to my spiritual master, His Holiness Radhanath Swami Maharaj, for blessing me with the wealth of Krishna consciousness. I pray at your lotus feet for intelligence and determination to always follow your instructions and serve Krishna according to your desires, so that my human life becomes truly successful. 

Your insignificant servant,
Radhageeta Devi Dasi Nasik"

And second is your broad-mindedness in serving Krishna and spreading the mission of Lord Chaitanya far & wide.
You repeatedly instruct me to always do all the services in great absorption, seriousness & sincerity. You not only just instruct me but personally demonstrate how to do Japa attentively by personally coming for chanting with devotees in the temple hall or in the Pandal during Kartik Yatras. From a material viewpoint, your physical body is quite old 75 years age, but still, you sit on the ground near Tulasi Maharani with your back straight and chant the holy name with great eagerness & attention. This is very instructive to me. How I also should increase my eagerness & concentration in Japa. While speaking Krishna Katha, you always maintain the balance of narrating the pastimes with great details at the same time giving lessons at appropriate times with appropriate stories or day-to-day examples. You become so much absorbed while giving a lecture by your sitting posture with a straight back & not even drinking water for hours together.
Regarding the second quality of being broad-minded in spreading Lord Chaitanya’s movement. Although you are always focused on reaching new people through various outreach programs, you also have a keen concern for maintaining the spiritual & devotional aspects in cooking for all the devotees I heard that you personally taste & check all the preparations, attending to the needs of Varishtha Vaishnavas, children, matajis, grihasthas, brahmacharies, foreign-bodied devotees, other sampradaya devotees & maintaining the cleanliness of the premises where our programs are held. Your unworthy disciple,

3. Hare Krishna dear Guru Maharaj,
  Please accept our humble obeisances at your lotus feet. All glories to Srila Prabhupada. On this most auspicious occasion of your 75th Vyasa-puja, we offer this small and heartfelt glorification from our family—Rama Mukunda Dasa, Radhika Lila Devi Dasi, Tulasi Gopika Devi Dasi and Tulasi. We pray that these few words may express even a drop of our gratitude for your mercy.
 Guru Maharaj, there is no joy in this world like the joy of seeing you and hearing from you in person. When you stand before us, something sacred fills the atmosphere. There is a sweetness, a purity, almost a magic in the air that cannot be explained. To receive your darshan in one’s own hometown, in one’s own temple, is a very special blessing from the Lordships. All of us in Seattle felt truly fortunate and deeply grateful when you kindly visited us from the 19th to the 22nd of May, 2025. Those days were filled with happiness as we watched you lovingly greet every devotee, blessing each person with your gentle smile and compassionate glance. Your presence brought so much warmth and encouragement; it felt as if mercy was flowing continuously.
 In your presence, faith becomes natural, devotion becomes joyful, and the heart becomes soft. You are the reservoir of all that is sweet, gentle, humble, and pure. You accept everyone without judgment. You see the good in every soul, and not only see it—you magnify it. You are filled with gratitude for everything and everyone. Even though you are so exalted, your shyness, your innocence, and your simplicity remind us of a child, while at the same time, your determination, courage, and spiritual gravity are like a thunderbolt. You are a true sadhu. Though deeply austere and inwardly strong, you always depend solely on Krishna through prayer and surrender. You avoid taking service from others, yet you are always eager to serve. Your life has been an extraordinary journey—filled with freedom, adventure, pain, and joy—but through every season, you have only listened to the voice of Paramatma in your heart.
 Your compassion is vast and practical. Whether through Govardhan Ecovillage, Annakshetra, Barsana eye camps, or countless other efforts, you show what true spiritual love looks like. You never give importance to external designations like background, race, or religion. You simply see a soul—part and parcel of Krishna. You live only to fulfill Srila Prabhupada’s dreams and the mission of Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. You unite hearts. You teach us to value relationships over achievements, people over projects, affection over ego. You never involve yourself in anything that could disturb the unity Srila Prabhupada desired in his movement. You only inspire cooperation, care, and mutual respect.
 Your hari-katha is the treasure of our lives. It has the power to purify and uplift the entire universe. For us, it is the source of our greatest joy. Even when you speak about tolerance, you never emphasize your own. Yet we have heard that your life has been filled with pain, and still you never allow it to touch others. Instead, you show only kindness. Your deep humility, your devotion to Gauranga Mahaprabhu, and your unwavering remembrance of Srila Prabhupada shine through every word and action.
 On this sacred Vyasa-puja day, Guru Maharaj, we pray at your lotus feet for just one blessing—that every step we take, every word we speak, and every thought we allow into our mind may be guided by your gentle voice and your teachings. May we serve in a way that brings a little happiness to your heart and contributes, even in a small way, to the mission you hold so dear.
 We offer our heartfelt prayers to Sri Sri Radha Neel-Madhava to kindly keep you always in the best health, filled with divine strength, and always in sweet remembrance of your beloved spiritual master, Srila Prabhupada. Thank you, Guru Maharaj, for your presence, your compassion, and your unconditional love.
 Your insignificant servants,

Please accept my most respectful obeisances unto your divine lotus feet.
 All glories to Srila Prabhupada.

Thank you very much, Gurudev, for enlightening and empowering my life with your beautiful and very precious instructions, and for everyday protecting us through your very precious Vani association.
 Your Vani association is our living force in our journey of life.
 Thank you very much, Guru Maharaj, for giving us the most precious gift by sharing the nectar of your spiritual journey with the world through your most precious book, "The Journey Home."
 We are trying to follow and learn many beautiful lessons you shared in the book by meditating on your most precious pastimes, and also by hearing your wonderful pastimes and the loving exchanges with all your dear disciples and the disciples of your beloved God-brothers.
 
 Dear Guru Maharaj, through your very beautiful qualities like humility, simplicity, self-honesty, sensitivity, selfless servitude, unconditional love, and very compassionate caring concerns, you are always attracting many souls towards the path of devotional service.  You were offering service to Srila Prabhupada through your dear God-brothers and not directly approaching your beloved spiritual master.

 "If you have to please your Guru, you have to please his servants, the representatives of Guru. Because they are connected to Guru Maharaj and therefore not separated from Guru Maharaj. In this way, we can develop the mood of the servant of the servant."
 Gurudev, you are always happy to serve your dear God-brothers, and to increase your happiness, we also try to follow and serve your dear God-brothers to our best of capabilities whenever they are coming to Ujjain temple in Srila Prabhupada Memorial festivals every year.
 
 Gurudev, you are always following Nityananda Prabhu's compassion and teaching us:
 "We should be very strict in following the four regulative principles for ourselves, but at the same time, we should be compassionate to the people who are not following the four regulative principles. We should know how to recognize and how to help others compassionately at whatever level they are."
 You are always appreciating our insignificant efforts and encouraging us and boosting our enthusiasm to serve by putting our heart into each and every service. You are always teaching through "praner arther dhiya vacha."
 You are always living your promise:
 "Someday I promise to do something good for the people of India."
 You are following the same, not only for India but for the world.
 
 Always seeking your blessings, as I am trying to meditate on some of your instructions and teachings to follow in action:
 * Show your gratitude in your actions and not only in your words.
 * "Our free will could convert a curse into a blessing or a blessing into a curse. To bear difficulty and turn to God is a priceless blessing."
 * Detachment in the mind and softness in the heart.
 * Cultivate inner strength and outward gentleness, to be gentle and tolerant.
 * I dive with purpose and float with faith.
 * I went to dive deep and went to float light.
 * I release with love and trust divine protection for all.
 * O dear Lord, grant me the humility to absorb the innate beauty of Your devotees.
 * I trust the divine choreography of my life.
 * Even when I am stranded, I am still being guided.
 * I choose divine madness over worldly reason.
 
 I am trying to follow your most precious instructions and teachings to practice.
 And for that, I am trying to learn and grow under the guidance and shelter of your dear servants who are so much dedicated and very compassionately guiding us in our spiritual journey to become the servant of the servant.
 
 Thank you very much, Guru Maharaj, for giving us the shelter of your dear disciples to always be protected and spiritually nourished and strengthened to blossom in the practicing process of devotional service.
 Dear Guru Maharaj, please accept my heartfelt gratitude and most respectful obeisances for all your causeless mercy upon this insignificant soul.
 Please forgive me for all my shortcomings and conditioning.
 Just an insignificant servant of the servant of the servant of your dear servants.
  Rangavati Devi Dasi
  Indore, M.P.

Your love towards Srila Prabhupada, all your Godbrothers, all devotees, Vrindavan, and the jivas – whether they are conscious or unconscious – made me relish a drop of nectar from the spiritual world while living in the perishable material world. 1. Please go deep into chanting, hearing, and service.
2. Cultivate the mood of pleasing Krishna.
3. Strive to be united as a community.
4. Practice enthusiasm to share Bhakti - Krishna Consciousness.
5. Never forget that Bhakti is not about quantity or numbers, but it is about pleasing Guru and Krishna.

Your Insignificant Servant

Dear Guru Maharaj, Please accept our humble and respectful obeisances. All glories to Srila Prabhupada.

Even those who feel rejected everywhere are uplifted by your genuine glorification, which makes them feel important and worthy.
 Whether it is a great personality or a simple squirrel, your loving heart embraces all. I remember you once shared how you stopped your car to be with a deer who had just been struck and was leaving his body. That compassion reflects your nature. I also recall listening to your class on friendship, where you explained that when friends need us, we do not quote philosophy—we simply stand by them with love and a compassionate heart.
 I have personally experienced this. When I was new to Krishna Consciousness and struggling with bad habits and poor association, you showed me so much affection that the path of devotion became sweet and joyful. Today, whatever little service I am able to render in Srila Prabhupada’s mission is only because of your unlimited love and attention during those difficult days.

 Maharaj, I beg at your lotus feet—please always keep me in your shelter and service. I struggle with conditioning and lazy habits, but with your blessings I can move forward. This foolish daughter of yours seeks only your mercy to engage her mind in serving you.

Dear Guru Maharaj,
 Your 75th appearance is a very joyous occasion. King Rahugana was instructed by Jada Bharata that the opportunity to perform devotional service cannot be attained unless one is blessed by the dust of the feet of great devotees. I see no reason other than your divine grace, bestowing on me the blessings coming through our dear Srila Prabhupada and our Acaryas, that is responsible for me having the opportunity to glorify you. Thank you.
 
 This year is also my 50th birth anniversary, a very fearful event. More than half of this has been in the association of devotees, and I have been contemplating on whether I have progressed at all, and what the nature of that progression is.
 
 In your sermons, you often times quote that Krishna is saragrahi; He sees the intent. It is only recently that I am able to understand the gravity of this. If He was only interested in the results of my service, or His grace would flow only to those that are uniquely capable and adept at doing certain services, then my situation would have been completely helpless.
 
 And over the years, it is your lectures and personal example through which you have been molding that intent in my heart. In spite of being adamant on being attached to my opinions and my ideas, you have molded the intent in my heart to serve the divine couple. Every class I listen to is almost as if personally meant for me, to help me understand my shortcomings, of which there are many, and to make adjustments in my intent.
 
 And when I fail to attentively listen to you, then I have seen that the opportunities to serve have dwindled, either by lack of personal motivation, or by the distaste to chant, or by being resentful of devotees and their association. But you have never given up. In fact, through the means of your disciples or by circumstances, you have brought me back to listening to you and realigning my intent.
 
 Thus, your instructions have become the very source of my survival in Krishna Consciousness. You give the intelligence and the opportunity through which I can still be around devotees. As you mention, Srila Prabhupada once mentioned that we should not be surprised that devotees leave; be surprised that they stay. My staying, Gurumaharaj, is just by your grace.
 
 So, my progress I think is that I have much more faith, and dare I say, complete, unconditional faith in your Grace, that you will never leave me. Wherever I am, you will come to guide me to surrender to the loving service of the Lord and His devotees.
 
 For that, as you have documented in your book, you have faced deathly diseases, violent, vicious attacks, family heartbreaks, personal abuse, scarcity, and so many insurmountable difficulties. For me! And you continue to do so. Year after year, you continue to provide the grace of the sweet, nectarian words carrying the full potency of the essence of all Vedic knowledge, sweetened by the realizations of our Parampara, uncontaminated in its essence, which nourishes me.

Through the Conscious Meals for All program, inspired by Food for Life, more than 30,000 meals are being served annually through Dallas. Recently, the Eco Farm community project has embarked to protect cows and create sustainable communities. The Atma Bhakti Center is slowly progressing and creating educational programs for several. Your Rasika Rani is trying to embark on a medical career, and she has also started a dance school. She is inspired by your Bhaktivedanta Hospital and wants to create a career around integrative medicine.
 
 Thank you, Gurumaharaj, for giving me entry into this sweet world of unlimited ecstatic service. I pray to remain engaged in a humble and insignificant way, with the right intent, in your service to Srila Prabhupada.
 
 Your very insignificant servant,
 Rasaraja das

परमपूज्य राधानाथ स्वामी महाराज पारदर्शक दुवा
नमो विष्णु पादाय कृष्ण पृष्ठाय भूतले
श्रीमते राधानाथ स्वामी इति नामिने
महाराज
आपके 75 वे जन्मदिन को हीरक महोत्सव के रूप में इको विलेज गोवर्धन में मनाया जा रहा है। कृतज्ञता व्यक्त करने हेतू ऑफरिंग देना चाहती हूँ।
कृपया इसका स्वीकार कीजिए।
मैं आपकी शिष्या रूपवती राधिका देवीदासी। 2003 साल में इस्कॉन आगमन हुआ।
शुरुआत में मैं इस्कॉन में नहीं थी। तब मैंने आपके एक लेक्चर में सुना था। आप बोल रहे थे कि मैं जो भी आध्यात्मिक कुछ कर रहा हूँ, इसका पूरा श्रेय मेरे गुरु ए.सी. भक्ति वेदांत स्वामी शील प्रभुपाद को जाता है।
जब मैं यह सुन रही थी, इसका अर्थ मैं नहीं समझ पा रही थी।
मैं सोच रही थी, महाराज, जो भी आध्यात्मिक कार्य सेवा कर रहे हैं, वह खुद ही तो कर रहे हैं।
फिर कैसे महाराज का श्रेय उनके गुरु शील प्रभुपाद को हो सकता है?
इस विषय के बारे में महाराज की जो वाणी थी, उसका प्रभाव मुझ पर इतना पड़ा कि बहुत दिनों तक इसके बारे में सोचती रही। लेकिन उन दिनों मुझे कोई उत्तर नहीं मिला। लेकिन आज 22 साल के बाद मैं अब विश्वास के साथ कह रही हूँ, मेरे तरफ से आज तक जो भी आध्यात्मिक क्रियाएं, सेवाएं हो पाई, उसका पूरा श्रेय मेरे गुरु महाराज परमपूज्य राधानाथ स्वामी महाराज आपको ही है।
भगवान की इच्छा ही गुरु की इच्छा होती है। भगवान के क्वालिटीज गुरु वैष्णव में होती है। भगवान की क्वालिटी हम तक पहुंचाकर हमें वैष्णव बनाने के बीच जो पारदर्शक दुवा होते हैं, वह गुरु हैं।
मेरे लिए वह पारदर्शक दुवा आप ही हो महाराज।
आज तक मैंने जो भी आध्यात्मिक सेवा प्रकट की है, भले ही मेरे खुद के शुद्धीकरण हेतू क्यों न हो, और इसके आगे जो भी आध्यात्मिक सेवा प्रकट होगी, भले ही गुरु महाराज रूप में भगवान इनके प्रति कृतज्ञता व्यक्त करने हेतू, इसका पूरा श्रेय मेरे गुरु महाराज परमपूज्य राधानाथ स्वामी महाराज जी को जाता है, इसमें आज मुझे कोई डाउट नहीं।
श्री श्री राधा माधव गौरी निताई, शील प्रभुपाद और आपके चरणों में इस शुभ अवसर पर प्रार्थना करती हूँ।
इस्कॉन संस्था ऐसे ही फले-फूले। संस्था का कणा, महाराज, इनकी दीर्घायु बढ़े। संस्था के प्रचार में गुरु महाराज मार्गदर्शक के अनुसार हमारा सहयोग और जीवन संस्था के लिए हमेशा समर्पित रहे। आपके चरणों में स्थान मिले, यही अभिलाषा है।
आपकी विश्वासू दासी,
रूपवती राधिका देवी दासी

A Heartfelt Poem for His Holiness Radhanath Swami Maharaj on His 75th Divine Appearance Day
 By your unworthy servant, Sabari Duguju
 
 Hare Krishna, Please accept my humble obeisances
 unto your divine lotus feet, the shelter of my life.
 All glories to Srila Prabhupada—
 the master you serve with unwavering love and strife.
 
 Happy appearance day, His Divine Grace,
 Hare Krishna to you, His Holiness, my guide.
 Today I bow down with gratitude and tears—
 at the feet of a father who nurtures from the inside.
 
You are a real father, whose words heal and embrace,
 a real guru, who rescued me from birth and death’s chase.
 A real spiritual guide, whose gentle hands take me near
 to Srila Prabhupada and the holy name so dear.
 
 Your words and actions are the medicine of truth,
 soothing the pain of the fallen, lifting broken youth.
 Dear His Holiness, you live without pretending—
 and teach us honesty, simply by your being.
 
 You hear without defending, and we learn humility.
 You speak without offending, and we learn sensitivity.
 You love without expecting, and we learn compassion.
 Through your example alone, devotion takes form and action.
 
 Your regular Sadhana shows what chanting truly means—
 with seriousness, sincerity, and love unseen.
 Your gratitude to Prabhupada teaches us faith
 to trust Guru and Vaishnavas with every breath we take.
 
 Therefore—thank you, dear Gurudev, for everything.
 Every word, every glance, every prayer you sing.
 On this sacred day, I fall at your feet and cry.
 Please bless this fallen soul, though unqualified am I.
 
 Please help me follow every instruction you give,
 to live by your teachings, by which real life we live.
 I am begging for your association.
 Please don’t ignore
 this poor and ungrateful jiva, lost on the shore.

Please accept my humble obeisances at your lotus feet on this most auspicious 75th Vyasa-puja celebration.

Today, as the devotees worldwide gather to offer their hearts in loving tribute, I beg your mercy to place these few humble words at your feet, knowing full well that I am unqualified even to touch the dust of your divine qualities.

Twenty-five years ago, by your boundless compassion, you accepted this fallen soul as your disciple. From the very first moment I heard your voice—soft yet thunderous with love for Krishna—I knew my life had found its true direction. Your every word, every glance, every smile has been a shower of nectar upon the barren field of my heart.

I remember your tireless preaching in the early days—travelling from village to village, city to city, sometimes with fever, sometimes without proper rest—yet never compromising on your sadhana or your love for Srila Prabhupada’s mission. You taught us that devotion means to *live* for Krishna, not merely to speak about Him. Your life is the living Srimad-Bhagavatam—each chapter a lesson in surrender, each verse a call to love.

Even now, at 75, your enthusiasm remains undimmed. You rise before dawn for mangala-arati, chant with tears in your eyes, and preach with the fire of a young brahmacari. Your journeys across continents, your care for thousands of disciples, your personal touch with every soul—these are not duties to you, but expressions of your spontaneous love for Guru and Gauranga.

Maharaj, you have shown us that *bhakti* is not a ritual, but a revolution of the heart. You taught us to see Krishna in the eyes of every living being, to serve with humility, and to chant with longing. Your laughter melts material bondage; your silence speaks volumes of Vraja-prema.

I am painfully aware of my countless shortcomings. I have failed to follow your instructions with the seriousness they deserve. My chanting is distracted, my service inconsistent, my heart still entangled in maya. Yet you never withdraw your mercy. Like Lord Caitanya with Jagai and Madhai, you embrace the most fallen.

On this sacred day, I beg only this: *Please never give up on me.* Let me remain forever a speck of dust at your lotus feet. If I have any good quality, it is only your mercy reflected. If I have any hope, it is only your grace.

May your divine health be protected by Sri Sri Radha-Gopinath. May your preaching mission expand unlimitedly. May every desire in your heart—for the pleasure of Srila Prabhupada, for the awakening of pure love in every soul—be fulfilled a millionfold by the combined mercy of Sri Guru and Gauranga.

Aspiring to be your eternal servant,
Your insignificant disciple,
Sanatan Caitanya Das

 A Vyas Pūjā Offering to My Beloved Spiritual Father — HH Radhanath Swami Maharaj on His 75th Appearance Day
 
 
 
 In this age of smoke and steel,
 Where hearts have forgotten how to feel,
 You walked, O Swami, barefoot in prayer,
 Carrying Vṛndāvana’s dust in your hair.
 
 From Western winds to the Gaṅgā’s side,
 You searched for the one who makes hearts wide,
 And there, beneath the holy sun,
 You found your Master — and became one.
 
 You built not temples of pride and stone,
 But hearts where Kṛṣṇa could sit alone;
 You taught us love is not a dream,
 But service flowing like a stream.
 
 You saw the lost, the tired, the weak,
 You wiped their tears before they speak,
 You spoke of Rādhā’s gentle grace,
 And tears adorned your saintly face.
 
 Seventy-five years of sacred flame,
 You burned yourself in Kṛṣṇa’s name,
 Each spark that fell became a star,
 Guiding souls from near and far.
 
 O father, friend, and ocean deep,
 Where all our restless rivers sleep,
 Your glance became my only shore,
 I need no other home, no more.
 
 When I am lost, when fears arise,
 You lift my heart toward Rādhā’s skies;
 And whisper softly, “Try once more —
 Kṛṣṇa still waits at your heart’s door.”
 
 Today I bring no grand attire,
 No eloquence, no gold, no fire,
 Just this trembling heart, this tearful song —
 “Rādhā-Govinda, keep me strong.”
 
 For in your steps I’ve seen the proof —
 That love can live beneath the roof,
 Of duty, struggle, study, pain —
 Yet bloom like lotuses in rain.
 
 So, on this sacred, golden day,
 I fold my palms, I kneel and pray:
 O Śrī Guru, whose heart is wide,
 Let me serve beneath your side.
 
 Let every breath of this small life,
 Be freed from ego, freed from strife;
 Let this soul — lost, stubborn, wild —
 Become again your simple child.
 
 
 ---
 
 🕊️ Your fallen servant,
 Sarang Dhara Das
 On the 75th Appearance Day of His Divine Grace HH Radhanath Swami Maharaj — 2025

 Oh dear Guru Maharaj,
 On your 75th auspicious appearance day, I offer my heartfelt obeisances unto the dust of your lotus feet. I am deeply grateful for the opportunity to glorify you even with my imperfect words. Every year, out of your causeless mercy, you give fallen souls like me the chance to speak something about you... though I know it is like showing a lamp to the sun or offering water to the ocean, still, Guru Maharaj, by your mercy, my words become free… my heart becomes free… and somehow, you allow me to express the gratitude I carry within.
 Thank you Maharaj for organizing Kartik yatra every year. This 2025 Kartik Yatra to Govardhan was my first ever yatra in my Krishna Consciousness till now. And Maharaj, during this Kartik Yatra, something happened that left a deep mark on my heart. On the fourth or the fifth day of your lecture, you mentioned that the highest goal of our life is to please the hearts of the Brajvasis and the pure devotees of the Lord.
 I heard the words… but the next day, Krishna allowed me to experience them. It was Śrīla Prabhupāda’s disappearance day. We were doing Vraja parikrama, singing kīrtan, exhausted and thirsty. We stopped for sugarcane juice, and someone said, “Till the juice prepares, let us do some kīrtan.” So softly we began:
 “Rādhe Rādhe Govinda, Govinda Rādhe…”
 Suddenly, from somewhere, a group of Brajvasis - elderly women and devotees from various Gaudiya parivāras - came and became completely ecstatic. Their joy overflowed into us, and our small kīrtan transformed into a powerful, joyful festival of hearts.
 What to speak of those elderly women, even the sugarcane juice walla, street vendors, everyone became ecstatic.
 After kīrtan, those matajis came to bless us, with such wholehearted affection, with so many blessings, like a child loves pampers and blesses with her hands, that my heart felt full to overflowing. In that moment, I felt we had truly pleased the hearts of the Brajvasis. Your words were not a lesson anymore; they were a living reality. That blessing filled me with a sweetness I cannot describe. I never experienced that moment ever before.
 
 Those two minutes…………
 Maharaj, due to some unavoidable circumstances, I joined the yatra a little late. On the very first morning japa, when I saw you a few steps ahead, I completely froze. For years I had only seen you online, and there you were, close, breathing the same air. I didn’t know what to do; my words left me. The whole yatra felt like a dream after that.
 All through the days I kept trying to get a moment with you, to offer my feelings, my realizations, my gratitude, but it seemed impossible. On the last day, I prayed with all my heart: “Maharaj, even for a few seconds, please let me offer what I brought for you.” I had brought some mahāprasād from Ayodhya as my offering. It looked like it would not be possible.
 But, but by your mercy, you came right in front of me. I was speechless, shaking, unable to say even the simplest thing: “Maharaj, I brought an offering for you.”
 You looked at me for complete 2 minutes, you spoke something, and those two minutes, just two minutes of your presence and attention, became the best two minutes of my life.
 I will carry them forever.
 After the yatra ended, I could not stay in the dhāma even for a moment. I felt an unbearable separation, not just from you but from the devotees who had become my family. Many of them I had met only online before. Meeting them offline felt not like a first meeting but like a homecoming; it felt as if I belong to them and they belong to me. Their warmth, their mercy, their blessings, I do not have words. Being with them made my Krishna consciousness bloom; leaving them made my heart ache. Truly:
 In your lectures I have heard that “we can only experience the real depth, real beauty of Krishna Consciousness in the association of devotees.”
 Also Bhagwatam describes: “bhaktis tu bhagavat-bhakta-saṅgena parijāyate.”
 “Devotional service to the Supreme Lord is awakened and nourished only by the association of His devotees.”
 And I really felt that. The separation was unbearable to such an extent that I really didn’t want to stay for even some minutes, that too in the Dham.
 
 Maharaj, once I heard your lecture where you said that “expressing gratitude is the womb of humility.” Those words remained in my heart, but during the yatra I saw them come alive through your own example. The way you thanked every devotee, every sevak, every organizer with such affection, respect, and sincerity, it felt as if you were personally teaching us how a true Vaiṣṇava honours everyone around him.
 Seeing that, Guru Maharaj, awakened a deep desire in me. I pray that one day I may develop even a tiny particle of the gratitude and humility that you embody so effortlessly. Inspired by your words, during the yatra I tried consciously to express gratitude to the devotees around me. And in those moments, I felt something changing within... as if a softer, more humble part of my heart was being uncovered by your mercy.
 Maharaj, whatever transformation begins in me is only because of your instructions. I pray that I may follow this teaching of yours more deeply, so that even in my small attempts, I may bring some glory to you and your mission.
 And thank you, Maharaj, for blessing us with your wonderful [messengers], His Grace Radheshyam Prabhu and His Grace Vaishnav Sharan Prabhu. Whatever I have today in my Krishna consciousness, it is by standing under the shade of their guidance. Many times, their corrections felt heavy, but later I understood they were actually saving me from myself.
 Especially the association of Vaishnav Sharan Prabhu, I learned how gentle, how personal, and how affectionate, how caring a devotee can be.
 Guru Maharaj, through these two devotees, I feel your mercy constantly flowing toward me. Their presence in my life is one of the greatest gifts you have given me.
 Oh Maharaj…
 During this yatra, I made some promise at your lotus feet. But today, honestly, I am still struggling to live that promise fully. My determination is weak, my habits pull me down, and my mind keeps distracting me.
 So on this auspicious day, I beg you for just one boon:
 Please bless me with the strength, enthusiasm, purity, and sincerity
 to fulfill the promise I made to you
 so I can serve you and your devotees in the best way possible.
 This one more, this year, gift I want from you.
 This is the only gift I want to offer back to you.
 
 One of your most, most, most, most insignificant servant
 Satyam Gupta

Your childhood experiences, natural simplicity, humility, faith in the Supreme Lord — even during a time when you did not yet know who the Supreme God is — all these things astonished me. For the first time, I felt that someone’s thought process resonated so strongly with my own heart.
 
 It is only because of you that I took Krishna Consciousness seriously. From you, I learned the true importance of devotional service in my life. My faith in Srila Prabhupada and the process he has given has grown steadily simply by hearing you, observing you, and reading the philosophy through your lectures. Your lectures have become my life and soul. Even though my memory is short and not very sharp, and I cannot grasp deep philosophical points easily, your teachings give me clear direction about what to do and what to avoid in order to progress. Even though I fail many times due to my anarthas, it is your guidance that gives me the way forward.
 
 I am often amazed how Srila Prabhupada’s lectures, your lectures, and my daily book reading all revolve around the same points. This indicates to me that your mercy is bringing the blessings of the entire Guru Parampara into my life, despite my fallen condition.
 
 Through your lectures, I learned how miserable the material world is and how essential it is for every sādhaka to have a proper plan for leaving this world. But that was just the beginning. As your lectures progressed level by level, I was gradually introduced to deeper aspects of Krishna Consciousness — from the basics of body and soul, to devotional service, our relationship with God, spiritual emotions and pastimes, and later even more advanced topics like devotee care, rasa, and complete sacrifice. At first it felt overwhelming, like giving a heavy feast to someone with a weak digestion. But with the guidance of my superiors — who are your mercy agents through the counsellor system you established — I continued. Slowly my conviction developed, my faith increased, and I could digest these teachings and understand the real picture.
 
 Gradually, I realized the great danger of Vaiṣṇava-aparādha, the importance of offering respect to others, the formula for avoiding offenses through tṛṇād api sunīcena, the necessity of prayer, the tendency to take things cheaply and how to overcome it, and how Supersoul guides us at every moment if we learn to hear Him. This journey of hearing your lectures and being introduced to different aspects of bhakti has been truly adventurous, and for me it still continues with the same excitement. I pray that I may receive more and more shelter of your vani, and by your mercy understand how you want me to serve you, Srila Prabhupada, and the devotees.
 
 You are known for your exemplary behavior — your sadacara. Your dealings with your Godbrothers, senior disciples, junior disciples, and followers teach us how to behave in devotee association and how to care for others by bringing them closer to Krishna. Whatever you speak in your lectures, you follow perfectly in your conduct. It is said that one cannot become a perfect guru without first being a perfect disciple. The way you followed Srila Prabhupada’s teachings and engaged others in the same is a shining example.
 
 From the very beginning, I feared taking things cheaply, because I had that tendency. But I never wanted that in spiritual life. Your lectures always emphasize quality over quantity, and using quantity to eventually improve quality. You constantly teach how to remain conscious in every activity — not mechanical in service, sadhana, or relationships — and how to put our full heart and soul into everything we do. You teach attention to detail, serving not for show but for purification, and aiming for Krishna-prema.
 
 When someone asked you which is the highest level of devotee, everyone expected you to quote tṛṇād api sunīcena, yet you quoted āśliṣya vā pāda-ratāṁ…. Your lectures always focus on pure devotional service — nothing less. Still, you wonderfully engage all types of people in Krishna Consciousness. How your lectures satisfy such a variety of hearts according to their level of realization is a mystery for me.
 
 In every aspect, your message remains the same: aim for quality with full consciousness — performing sadhana without pride, serving with humble servant-of-servant mood, remaining grateful, not judging or comparing, giving our best in every situation, never compromising in sadhana, and realizing Krishna through humble service rather than merely speaking about Him. These are the teachings I am striving to follow.
 
 One of your greatest blessings upon me is giving me shelter of the leaders trained by you — HG RSP, HG CCP, HG Gauranga Prabhu, my counsellor, and many others. They are your mercy agents, constantly guiding and protecting fallen souls like me. Through them you care for me in every aspect, especially in overcoming pride. Whatever little effort I am making comes from the inspiration you have given through your lectures.
 
 The importance of prayer has changed my life. It has made me more dependent on the Lord and the devotees. Through prayer, I realized the significance of our eternal prayer — the Holy Name. Recently I have begun trying to chant not only with clarity externally but with heartfelt shelter internally. As HH Bhakti Rasamrita Swami Maharaj often mentions, your two topmost instructions are:
 
 1. Always serve everyone in the mood of servant of the servant.
 2. Take complete shelter of the Holy Name with your whole heart.
 
 These are the gifts you have given me through your vani.
 
 I pray at your lotus feet that I may follow your instructions exactly as you have given them, without compromise. Please remain with me always through your teachings and continue to guide me. Kindly forgive all my offenses to you and to your devotees. Thank you for transforming my life completely. Thank you for giving me shelter again and again.
 In short — thank you for everything.
 Your aspiring servant,
 Saurabh D

They have guided my path and have helped place me in a much more meaningful and spiritually grounded position now. Maharaj, I cannot thank you enough, nor can I ever repay even a fraction of the inconceivable mercy you have bestowed upon me.
 
 When I was in darkness, your lectures brought light and hope. When I was in pain, they became a soothing balm. When I was in deep distress, they nurtured me like a mother’s embrace. When I had lost trust in the people around me, your words rekindled faith and steadiness within.
 
 Although I have not always been able to fully follow your instructions, especially to view adversity as the Lord’s opportunity for surrender and growth in bhakti, I sincerely tried my best.  Chanakya Pandit has said, daridratā guṇa-rāśi nāśi — “When one becomes poverty-stricken, all his good qualities, virtues, and even his favorable destiny lose their value.” In the same way, when one is bereft of devotion to the Supreme Lord, all so-called virtues and accomplishments become meaningless. I am such a spiritually impoverished person, devoid of genuine devotion. The sorrow of this daridratā cannot be remedied by any amount of wealth, fame, beauty, education, noble lineage, or social standing. Indeed, we are suffering from this deep inner poverty.
 
 But you, Gurudev, are truly the wealthiest of all. You have accumulated an inconceivable treasure of devotion to the Supreme Lord, and with boundless compassion, you are distributing that wealth freely to the destitute souls like myself. Your very life is a moving exhibition of divine compassion and generosity.
 
 On this most auspicious day of your Vyas Puja, I come before your lotus feet as a beggar — seeking not gold, not prestige, but a mere drop of that devotion which you so abundantly possess. This distress of bhakti-daridratā has made me burn in the fire of material existence. Kindly shower your mercy upon me, Gurudev, and bless me with pure, unalloyed devotional service to Sri Sri Radha Gopinath.
 
 Offering countless obeisances at your lotus feet, I beg for just a particle of your mercy.
 Your insignificant servant,
 Shankaranand Das

"THANK YOU SOO MUCH GURUMAHARAJ."

Then your mercy worked like that. When I started coming to the temple, I saw many devotees going to Vrindavan, Mathura, but I couldn't. Even when I chanted 16 rounds for one year, then I thought, "Now I got a chance to go with devotees," but then also I couldn't go. I was literally very sad that a server devotee is going, why am I not going? Even that devotee is going who came to the temple after me, who didn't chant 16 rounds also. I was literally very sad, Gurumaharaj. But then, on the day of the Kumbh Mela, I got mercy from you. After that, one week later, a devotee who is serving in the kitchen in sector 6 Netra Kumbh finished his service, and he made a plan to go to Vrindavan suddenly. Then I helped him in shifting his luggage from the mela to the temple, and after that, we made a plan to take a bath in the Sangam with all 5-6 devotees. Actually, that day, one devotee came from Chowpatty, HG Subal Pran Prabhuji, for some arrangements for his congregation yatra to Prayagraj, Chitrakoot, and Ayodhya. So I was with him from morning till evening in searching for hotels for devotees who were coming in the yatra. So we took a bath in the Sangam. After that, that devotee told me to come with him to Vrindavan, and I was like, "How will we go on such short notice?" And he asked me at 8 pm, and the train timing was 11 pm. I told him that my parents were not allowed. So he said, "I'll talk to them." But I knew that my parents were not allowed. But now your mercy started working. I don't know, but after hearing, they simply said okay, and I was shocked. The plan was made at 8 pm, and my parents were ready to allow me to board the train at 11 pm. Now, from that day, I realized, "Without the mercy of Guru, you can't reach Vrindavan."
"THANK YOU SOO MUCH GURUMAHARAJ."

And also, after your mercy, I got many services in the temple like Yamuna Aarti and deity worship. Although there are many chaos also, sometimes misunderstandings happen between devotees.

So I just want to pause here because I want to write many more also, but I think it's too long. I don't want to waste your time. If you are reading this, I just want to say an extremely big thank you to you for everything, and a huge thank you to Srila Prabhupada for giving me you as my spiritual father. "PLEASE ACCEPT ME."
THANK YOU SOO MUCH GURUMAHARAJ.

Your aspiring servant,
Shashwat

Dear Devotees,
 
 Empowering Leadership Rooted in Compassion
 Through his teachings, personal example, and spotless character, Guru Maharaj has nurtured countless devotees, helping them grow in spiritual maturity and serve society with greater devotion and responsibility. He often reminds us that a true leader is one who creates other leaders, and by his warmth, care, and deep concern for every soul, he inspires devotees to lead and uplift others with sincerity and love.
 Guru Maharaj leads not by authority, but by empowerment, humility, and unconditional compassion. His presence gives courage, his words give direction, and his love gives purpose. He teaches us that real leadership in Krishna consciousness means becoming an instrument of Krishna’s mercy for the upliftment of all.
 Guru Maharaj’s pure character and divine qualities touch the hearts of all who meet him. Even a gentle smile, folded hands, or a loving embrace reflects the bhāva of Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu and speaks more powerfully than words.
 
 Unmatched Humility, Love, and Personal Care
 
 Guru Maharaj’s humility, love, and care touch the hearts of everyone. He is deeply personal in his dealings, showing genuine affection and attention to each devotee.
 His every word and action reflect pure love flowing from a heart filled with devotion and compassion.
 
 Realised and Revealed Lectures
 
 Guru Maharaj’s lectures are truly heart-touching and completely eye-opening. His simple yet profound analogies give instant strength and clarity, helping me understand what a genuine bhakta really means.
 One analogy that deeply touched my heart is that of the solar panel. Just as a solar panel absorbs the light of the sun and then gives that same light for the benefit of others, in the same way, a devotee must first absorb spiritual strength by sincerely receiving the mercy of the Lord and Guru. Only then can he share that light with the world.
 A solar panel has no ego. It knows that it is not the source of energy; it simply receives and gives. Similarly, if we want to offer something meaningful and uplifting to others, we must first fill our hearts with something higher—devotion, purity, and spiritual wisdom. We can only give what we have truly received. By Guru Maharaj’s teachings, I pray to become a humble instrument to carry and share even a small ray of that divine light.
 Encouraging True Absorption in Krishna Consciousness
 Guru Maharaj teaches us to practice Krishna consciousness with true absorption. He explains that real absorption means to tune our heart and mind while chanting, praying, and meditating. To absorb ourselves in spiritual life is to open our hearts to absorb the grace of the holy name, the grace of kirtan, the grace of the Lord, and the grace found in sincere prayers.
 A Storehouse of Divine Qualities By Hg Rukmini Krishna Prabhu Ji
 
 Guru Maharaj is a true reservoir of divine qualities. His humility, simplicity, and purity of heart naturally attract everyone. When he speaks Hari-katha or describes the pastimes of Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, those divine moments feel present and alive, as if the spirit of Mahaprabhu’s movement is flowing through his words, kirtan, and compassionate dealings with all.
 Despite empowering and guiding so many wonderful leaders within the movement, Guru Maharaj remains completely humble and detached, always seeing himself as a servant of the Vaishnavas. His character and devotion remind us that true greatness is measured not by position, but by the depth of one’s love and surrender.
 
 A Loving and Genuine Glorification of Devotee Service
 
 I witnessed this beautiful nature of Guru Maharaj during the Kartik Yatra 2025 in Govardhan. While speaking Hari-katha, Guru Maharaj lovingly glorified every devotee engaged in service. One statement touched my heart deeply—he said that the kitchen devotees are not merely cooking to feed others, but are sharing a love-feast, offering devotion through every detail of their preparation.
 He mentioned how some Matajis were making nearly 20,000 chapatis by hand, serving tirelessly from 4:30 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. for all five days of the yatra. Guru Maharaj expressed that in the holy abode of Govardhan, the Lord is watching their service, and that such loving service is never futile. Every small act done to please the devotees brings great joy to the Supreme.
 Complete Faith and Surrender to Guru and Krishna
 
 In every lecture and in his daily life, Guru Maharaj remains absorbed in a mood of transcendental devotion. In his kathā and kīrtan, we can feel his genuine gratitude to Srila Prabhupāda, his loving respect for the Deities and the Holy Name, and his unwavering surrender to Guru and Krishna.
 Guru Maharaj’s love is not limited to humans—he sees all living beings as parts and parcels of Krishna and extends his affection to everyone. During the Govardhan Yatra, Guru Maharaj beautifully shared that the Vrindavan mood is not “I and Me”, but “We and Us”—the mood of the Brajavasis, who live only to please Sri Sri Radha and Krishna and to spread this spirit of loving cooperation.
 
 With deepest regards,
 [Your Name]

Dear Guru Maharaj,
Please accept my humble obeisances at your lotus feet.

I do not have the power to glorify the Sun; however, as per the instructions of the authorities, I am trying to share a few words in glorification of you and for my own purification.

Your life is a role model of dedication and compassion, to follow in the footsteps of previous Acaryas.

To my tiny understanding, I am seeing your life is totally centered around Lord Caitanya Mahaprabhu's Shikshastakam, especially the 3rd verse from शिक्षाष्टकम...
तृणादपि सुनीचेन तरोरपि सहिष्णुना।
अमानिना मानदेन कीर्तनीयः सदा हरिः!!

So I am taking an opportunity to explore this verse and your सदाचार in following this verse in your life.

Your Humility:
Your mood of genuine humbleness attracts millions of people. Presently your glories are spread throughout the world; still, you remain humble and genuine, giving all the credit to Srila Prabhupada and all the devotees who supported you.

Your Tolerance:
As ISKCON is an institution, and for an institution to grow, it needs management. While leading, there are so many differences of opinion and sometimes criticism, blame, etc. However, you tolerated all and inspired everyone because you have realized ISKCON is Srila Prabhupada's body, which is helping to fulfill Lord Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's Sankirtan mission.

Your mood of not expecting respect:
You practiced and realized that there is nothing permanent in this world, and you do not expect any respect. In most of your lectures, you quote about Srila Bhakti Vinod Thakur's prayer: प्रतिष्ठा is शुकरेर विस्टा.

Your mood of glorifying and giving respect to others:
However, in glorification and respect to others, we have seen you. You treat your godbrothers and godsisters as kings and queens and glorify them abundantly. Also, you give love and respect to each and every one of your disciples who assist in the mission of Srila Prabhupada.

Your faith in the holy name:
Once, you had been asked that many Srila Prabhupada disciples serve their own deity. Which is your deity of worship?
You replied by showing your bead bag that this is my deity, and he remains with me 24 hours of the day.

Today, on this auspicious day of your platinum jubilee Birthday celebration, I beg at your lotus feet to please continue showering blessings and make me an instrument in the hands of your authority and capacity to serve selflessly, to ultimately please You.

Srila Gurudev, Thanking you for everything.

Hare Krishna,
Your grateful servant,
Shravananand das

My most worshipable Sri Guru Maharaj,
 Please accept my humble and respectful obeisances unto your lotus feet.
 All glories to our beloved Srila Prabhupada and our Guru Maharaj.
 
 I am sincerely very grateful for your unlimited mercy and compassion. Almost 7 years ago, by your causeless mercy, I got the shelter of your blessed lotus feet. I am extremely fortunate to get this opportunity to present my Vyas Puja offerings on this blessed moment of the 75th appearance day of my Sri Guru Maharaj.
 
 Although all your words, lectures, and instructions are transcendental gems in my spiritual life, I would like to list a few 75 instructions and teachings which are the guiding principles for all of us:
 
 1. Being loyal and faithful is the foundation of a disciple’s character.
 2. Humility softens the heart and captures God’s heart.
 3. A spiritual approach to life that is based on humility and service transforms even unknown servants to glorious recipients of Lord’s love and mercy.
 4. When you are proud, you are already fallen; the rest is just details.
 5. Take seriously the responsibilities given by your guru/Parampara — that is the basis of bhakti.
 6. Accept that you are insignificant compared to the all-great Lord and His servants — this builds humility.
 7. In giving respect, we can be very happy; expecting respect brings misery.
 8. Collective unity is better than individual purity.
 9. Real faith is awakened from within — not imposed externally.
 10. If we judge devotees, it is our spiritual destruction.
 11. Every word we speak or everything we do is either an offering to Krishna or our ego.
 12. The disciple that pleases the guru is the one who can be depended upon: in all the situations and circumstances, he will be there.
 13. Don’t take any service whimsically. If you are asked to change a life-boat, that changing is your path back to Godhead.
 14. Serve with gratitude and enthusiasm — service is your connection to Krishna.
 15. Even in the discharge of one’s most ordinary daily activities, one must do it very consciously and very carefully, and one must put one’s heart into it.
 16. The real blessings of the spiritual master come when we become dependable, when he can trust.
 17. Volunteer for higher service only after fulfilling the given responsibility.
 18. For spiritual advancement, whatever little service you are given, you have to take that as your life and soul, and you have to be responsible.
 19. The acceptance of your responsibility is the basis of bhakti.
 20. Don’t be lazy about the given service.
 21. What pleases a guru: when a disciple knows, no matter what happens, I will be there.
 22. Follow the instructions of your guru-parampara, not the whims of your mind.
 23. A true disciple aligns his mind, senses, family, and society to do the service assigned.
 24. The behavior of a disciple can be an ornament for or a scar on the reputation of the spiritual master.
 25. Service to the guru’s mission is not about ego or recognition; it is about being an instrument.
 26. When there is disunity amongst devotees, there cannot be proper Sankirtan.
 27. We have the responsibility to chant every day, the prescribed number of rounds.
 28. We have the responsibility to follow the four regulative principles.
 29. We need to be cooperative and put ourselves second, to create unity amongst the Vaishnavas.
 30. The spiritual master may delegate service via his assistants; if you are dependable, you become dear to him, even if the master does not directly instruct you.
 31. Don’t let a breath escape from your body without Krishna’s name. That should be our determination throughout our life.
 32. The heart seems to have just a few wishes, as the surface of a sea seems to have just a few fishes, but if you see the deep inside, it gives a mesmerizing view.
 33. Chant attentively; it’s not just the number but the quality of rounds.
 34. Whether advanced or a beginner in Krishna Consciousness, we should not be neglectful even for a second. That one second could mean our spiritual life. It could even mean our material life.
 35. Spirituality is based on development of character and philosophy.
 36. Mercy means to get what we do not deserve.
 37. Great souls are merciful. Srila Prabhupada was pleased with the little things that someone did, even if that person had all bad qualities.
 38. All glories to Guru Maharaj means nothing left for us, no credit for us.
 39. Krishna consciousness is not achieved but awarded.
 40. Ultimately everything will perish except our relationship with Krishna. Whatever we invest in that relationship is eternal.
