With folded hands,
 
 Brought up in the city of Amritsar with very conventional desires, I never thought I would be fortunate enough to know someone as special as H.H. Radhanath Swami Maharaj, let alone call him my Guru.
 During yatras, he cooks and serves prasad to devotees with utmost humility and seva bhav. When he does kirtan, the feeling of surrender and love for Krishna can be heard in his voice, filling the room with a divine energy. When he tells stories, he does it with such conviction that he transports you to the world where those divine leelas are happening. He smiles his wonderful smile when asked unexpected questions after lectures, and answers them perfectly, as if the question was never unexpected in the first place.
 When he came to Amritsar, he chose not to step on the petals spread for his lotus feet. He greeted everyone with folded hands. I have seen photos and videos of him embracing cows and calves with deep compassion, accepting flowers from little children, and blessing them with so much love and care. Maharaj does not just preach humility and compassion; he lives them. And he lives them so beautifully that, for a moment, you forget he is a global personality with thousands and lakhs waiting for even a minute of his association.
 After so many years in bhakti, with countless disciples and lectures, he still leads a life of simplicity, and that is inspirational. Sometimes, a little appreciation or success in seva can make one think, “I did it.” But Maharaj is not like that. He lives by the verse:
 Trinad api sunicena
 Taror api sahishnuna
 Amanina manadena
 Kirtaniyah sada Hari
 As a teen, he set out to find the true meaning and purpose of life. That journey challenged him physically, mentally, and emotionally. But he never gave up. His commitment inspires me, because he moved continents with faith, endured struggles with faith, and ultimately found what he was seeking because of that same faith. That faith is the guiding light of my life and the lives of many others. When he faced theft, uncertainty, and loneliness on his journey, he still found hope in the smallest signs. But today, we don’t have to move continents; we have Maharaj’s blessings and guidance.
 So when the road of life gets bumpy, when things feel too hard or complicated, may I also be able to say the words from one of the letters he wrote to his family: “Roads get bumpy at times, but they are fine roads.”
 I am not as great, wise, or learned as Maharaj; in fact, I am not even the dust on His feet, but I can try to walk the path he shows us, not just through his lectures, but through his way of life. To have faith like he did, and to be humble like he is, while doing whatever little seva I get to do—these are the goals of my life.
 HH Radhanath Swami Maharaj Ki Jai!

Last year in Māyāpur Yatra I heard from your lotus mouth and I observed it personally:

1. Intense Japa in Devotee Association
Every morning you make it a point to chant with devotees intensely. How important it is to chant together in association with devotees feelingly early in the morning — putting chanting as the highest priority.
It’s mentioned that out of all the instructions of the spiritual master, chanting 16 rounds is the most important.
You received the mahā-mantra from Mother Gaṅgā and later from His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Śrīla Prabhupāda.
It’s really impressive and inspiring to see that you take up doing intense japa so seriously.
Wherever you are in the world, you try to chant with devotees and also try to chant the whole day whenever there is free time after 16 rounds are complete.
This is a great inspiration for me.
Those six days of chanting with you in Śrī Māyāpur Dhām are my greatest treasure that I shall cherish my whole life.

2. Hearing from Śrīla Prabhupāda Daily
You hear from Śrīla Prabhupāda’s recorded lectures every day.
Out of the 64 items of devotional service described in Śrī Bhakti-rasāmṛta-sindhu, the first three are related to the spiritual master: śrī-guru-pādāśraya, dīkṣā, and sevā.
You have taken this so seriously and that’s so inspiring to see.
I also wish to make it a goal that I hear from you every day and thereby nourish the most important connection.

3. Sensitivity Toward Vaishnavas
Last time in Śrī Māyāpur Dhām Yatra, I was deeply touched to see your sensitivity.
On Nov 5th, during Śrīla Prabhupāda’s disappearance observance, when the time was ticking, you let HG Mandākinī Mātaji go on with her offering and also let HG Mālati Mātaji speak next — who promptly pointed to the time for “Je Anilo Premadhana” prayer, which was your turn to sing.

Last Māyāpur Yatra, around 12,000 devotees came.
You had every option and justification to reject or cut off after a certain number, but you accepted all with an open, compassionate, magnanimous heart.

“The more the devotees, the more there are opportunities to serve.”
What a broad and magnanimous way to encourage everyone.

That was so inspiring — to see how to put oneself last and everyone else first.

I wish to please you by following these principles in my life.

हरे कृष्ण! परम पूज्य राधानाथ स्वामी महाराजांच्या चरणी दंडवत प्रणाम. 👏

महाराजांना प्रथम भेटण्याचा योग गोविंद धाम, निगडी येथे झाला. ब्रह्मचारी असलेला माझा भाऊ रोहिणी तनय दास हा कॅन्सरमुळे 2/3/2011 ला भगवतधामात गेला. कृष्णभावनावित व्यक्तीला मृत्यू देखील महत्त्वाचा वाटत नाही, तो त्याच्या खऱ्या माता-पित्याकडे जातो, याचा आनंद आहे, असे म्हणणे आणि तीव्र वेदनांना हसत सामोरे जाणे, हे त्याच्याकडून शिकलो.

आणि 14 तारखेला श्री श्री राधा-राधागोविंदजीची प्राणप्रतिष्ठा होती. आम्ही मंदिरात उभे होतो, तेव्हा फुलसंगी माताजी भेटल्या. त्यांनी विचारले, "तुम्ही महाराजांना भेटलात का?" आम्ही म्हटले, "नाही, कसं भेटणार?" त्यांनी माझा हात हातात घेऊन गर्दीतून वाट काढत महाराज जिथे होते, तिथे नेले. कारण तेव्हा महाराज निघाले होते. "चला, मी तुम्हाला भेटवते," म्हणून घेऊन गेल्या.

आम्ही सर्वजण त्यांच्या मागे महाराज थांबलेल्या ठिकाणी गेलो आणि जेव्हा महाराजांना सांगितले, "हे रोहिणी तनयाचे आई-वडील आणि बहीण-भाऊ आहेत," त्यांनी वडिलांना घट्ट मिठी मारली. तो क्षण अविस्मरणीय होता. त्यापूर्वीच महाराजांना रोहिणी तनयाच्या माध्यमातून गुरु म्हणून निवडले होते आणि महाराजांबद्दल रोहिणी तनयाकडून खूप ऐकले होते. प्रत्यक्ष त्यांचे दर्शन झाल्यानंतर मी भारावूनच गेले. एकीकडे भावाचे दुःख आणि दुसरीकडे गुरु महाराजांचे प्रत्यक्ष दर्शन मिळाल्याचे समाधान. कोणीच कुणाशी काही बोलत नव्हते, सर्वजण डोळ्यांनीच बोलत होते. त्यादिवशीपासून ठरवले की माझे गुरु महाराजच असतील.

नंतर प्रसादाच्या लाईनमध्ये उभे असताना आईच्या हातात कोणीतरी महाराजांचा फोटो ठेवला. आईने तो फोटो माझ्याकडे देत म्हणाली, "मी काय करू या फोटोचं? हे घे, तू करते माळा जप, तुझ्याकडे ठेव." आणि मला समजले, ही सर्व भगवंताचीच योजना आहे. मी तो फोटो घेतला आणि तेव्हापासून प्रत्येक गोष्ट, प्रत्येक दुःख मी महाराजांसोबत शेअर करत आहे आणि त्यांनी मला अप्रत्यक्षपणे सर्व प्रकारे मार्ग दाखवला.

आणि आज त्याचे फलित म्हणून महाराजांनी त्यांच्या बऱ्याच लेक्चरमधून सांगितलेल्या चैतन्य शिक्षा अष्टकमचा श्लोक अनुकरण करत "तृणादपि सुनीचेन तरोरीव सहिष्णुनाम्..." करण्याचा प्रयत्न करत आहे. माझी पात्रता नसताना महाराजांसारख्या दिव्य गुरूंना त्यांना ऑफर करत आहे. खूप संकटं आली, परंतु महाराजांनी भक्तीमध्ये स्थिर, धीर राहण्यासाठी मदत केली. महाराजांना उदंड, निरोगी आयुष्य भेटो आणि सर्व भक्तांसाठी कृपामयी, करुणामयी महाराज सदैव असेच आनंदात राहो.

काही चुकीचे आणि उत्साहपोटी निघून गेले असेल, तर दासाला क्षमा करावी. 👏

Hare Krishna. My humble prostrated obeisances at the lotus feet of the most worshipable Radhanath Swami Maharaj.👏
My first opportunity to meet Maharaj happened because of my brother, Rohini Tanay Das, who was a brahmachari at Govind Dham, Nigdi. Due to cancer, he left for the Bhagavat Dham on 2/3/2011. A person absorbed in Krishna consciousness does not consider death to be important; he feels joy, knowing he is going back to his real mother and father. I learned from him how to say this and how to face intense pain with a smile.
On the 14th, during the Pran Pratishtha of Sri Sri Radha Radhagovindaji, we were standing in the temple when Phulsangi Mataji met us. She asked, ‘Did you meet Maharaj?’ We said, ‘No… how can we meet him?’ She then held my hand and, cutting through the crowd, took us to where Maharaj was, because he was about to leave. ‘Come, I will take you to meet him,’ she said.
All of us followed her to the place where Maharaj was standing. When she told Maharaj, ‘These are Rohini Tanay’s parents, sister and brother,’ Maharaj embraced my father tightly. That moment was unforgettable. Even before that, through Rohini Tai, I had already accepted Maharaj as my Guru and had heard so much about Maharaj from Rohini Tanay. After seeing him personally, I was overwhelmed — on one side, the grief of my brother, and on the other side, the satisfaction of receiving the direct darshan of my Guru Maharaj. No one spoke anything; everyone was speaking through their eyes.
From that day on, I decided that Maharaj would be my Guru. Later, while standing in the prasadam line, someone placed a photo of Maharaj in my mother’s hand. She gave the photo to me saying, ‘What will I do with this photo? You chant on beads, you keep it.’ At that moment, I understood that everything was Krishna’s arrangement. I took the photo, and since then I have been sharing every happiness and sorrow with Maharaj. In many unseen ways, he has guided me, and the result of that is that I am trying to follow the verse from Maharaj’s many lectures — the verse from Chaitanya Shikshashtakam: “Trinad api sunichena, taror iva sahishnuna…” Although I am not qualified, I am offering my efforts to such a divine Guru like Maharaj.
Many difficulties came, but Maharaj helped me remain steady and patient in bhakti. May Maharaj be blessed with a long and healthy life, and may he, full of compassion and mercy, always remain joyful for the sake of all devotees.
If anything wrong or inappropriate has been spoken out of enthusiasm, kindly forgive this servant.👏"

 On this divine and most sacred day of your auspicious appearance, we—your insignificant servants—bow our heads in deep gratitude. This blessed time of the year gathers all your devoted children in one family of love, united by your compassion. And as we join them, our hearts tremble with wonder:
 
 How did we, who possess no purity, no insight, no devotion, become recipients of your boundless mercy?
 
 In this vast and turbulent universe, how did your soothing glance fall upon our small and struggling lives? How did we gain the fortune of your darshan, the sweetness of your voice, and the shelter of your lotus feet? These gifts are treasures far beyond our worth, yet you offer them freely—like a monsoon cloud pouring rain upon even barren land.
 
 It was never our qualification;
 it was always your causeless grace.
 We did not discover you;
 you discovered us.
 You searched for us, lifted us, and gently placed us on the path of devotion.
 
 Guru Maharaj, though your mercy flows ceaselessly, we remain like stones—unmoved, unsoftened—closing the doors of our own hearts out of fear that surrender will take away our petty attachments. We cling to illusion as if it were some priceless jewel, while neglecting the vast ocean of love you are offering. What misfortune could be greater than this?

 Please give us the strength
 to open our hearts to your grace.
 Please give us the courage
 to choose devotion over delusion.
 Please give us the sincerity
 to accept your healing touch.
 Please give us the fortune
 to become instruments of your compassion.
 
 We do not pray for transcendence for our own pleasure;
 we pray only that our family may become useful tools—
 however small, however unqualified—
 in your divine mission of love.
 
 Dearest Guru Maharaj,
 thank you for everything—
 for seeing in us what we could not see,
 for believing in us when we could not believe,
 for endlessly loving us when we did nothing to deserve it.
 
 On this day, and on every day,
 we offer our lives at your lotus feet.
 Your insignificant servants,
 Sri Kishore Das, Vrajamohini Devi Dasi, and family

From Sherwood Forest to Śrī Vṛndāvana:

In quiet Sherwood's leafy shade,
A boy once walked, alone he prayed,
Where Highland Park met sky and stream,
He whispered life’s unanswered dreams.

Young Gerald’s son, with searching eyes,
While others played, he gazed the skies.
Idelle, his gentle mother’s care,
And Grandpa Bill with stories rare.

An older brother, Marty, near,
But still he felt, “I don’t belong here.”
Though nurtured in a loving home,
His soul had wings — it longed to roam.

On his thirteenth year, a gift was laid,
Peter, Paul, and Mary played —
“Early in the morning, at break of day,
I ask the Lord to help me find my way.”

Folk songs, blues, and deep refrains,
B.B. King and Dylan’s strains.
"Within You, Without You," he would sigh,
George’s sitar opened the sky.

He heard the cry of Old Man River,
Felt the blues in his young heart shiver.
From Johnny Rivers' soulful plea,
“Look to your soul”—thus turned the key.

At fourteen years, he walked the halls
Of Deerfield High with hidden calls.
But classrooms could not hold his mind —
The world was vast; truth undefined.

To Florida’s warmth his journey led,
But not for leisure, fame, or bread.
At Miami Dade, he felt the fire,
A restless spark, a sacred desire.

He left the West, he crossed the seas,
Through trials, jungles, and disease.
At every turn, his soul was tried —
Yet grace unseen was by his side.

And then at last, he found his home,
Not built by hands, not carved from stone —
But nestled in a cowherd’s sacred land,
Where dust and love go hand in hand.

His heart embraced the Vraja ways,
The Brajvāsīs’ love, their simple praise.
For every cow, and bird, and tree —
He weeps in Vṛndāvan’s memory.

His hands so soft, his vows so strong,
In japa's depth he dwells lifelong.
His sādhanā, a blazing fire,
His humility — never to retire.

Among godbrothers, hand in hand,
He bows with love, he helps them stand.
With folded palms and lowered eyes,
He sees their glories, never tries
To rise above — he stoops to serve,
With all the honor they deserve.

O Gurudeva, kind and wise,
You see the soul beyond disguise.
For beast or man, for foe or friend,
Your compassion has no end.

You showed us how to live so plain,
With little need, no selfish gain.
With barefoot grace and monk’s attire,
You teach renunciation’s fire.

With folded palms, this prayer we raise,
To glorify your wondrous ways.
Please let us serve with heart and soul,
And walk behind you, toward the goal.
==================================================

 Gurudeva, I am first of all not qualified to glorify you, who are an ocean of wonderful qualities. But still, I take this wonderful opportunity to offer a drop from the ocean of your wonderful qualities.

I actually had no bounds to my happiness to see you, Gurudeva, in the same place where I was going for preaching for a decade. During your visit also, we arranged a college professors' program by HG Gauranga Prabhu, and it was successful with almost 100 people attending and taking prasadam. After that, HG Gauranga Prabhu visited the voice and blessed all devotees and encouraged us for more youth preaching. This year also, we started preaching, and it is picking up, but we have problems from time to time.
 
 Gurudeva, last year in book distribution, we distributed around 3200 books, but of course, I didn’t do much. It was the constant efforts of HG Raj Gopinath Prabhu and all devotees connected to NIT Jamshedpur, who collected funds, distributed books hand to hand, person to person. They worked hard to fulfill the desire of Srila Prabhupada of pushing the books, for if one reads a sentence or a word, his life is successful.
 
 Gurudeva, we are also trying to connect the parents of students connected to NIT through regular classes, yatras, and sometimes personal visits. Some of them are also picking up very seriously to chanting holy names and following the four regulative principles and reading Srila Prabhupada’s books, and also engaging in some services.  Gurudeva, as I informed about the other services I received in Newtown, Kolkata, i.e., deity services and some cultivation of well-wishers. Sri Sri Nitai Gauranga are very merciful here, and they are giving me so much opportunity to serve them in the form of their divine services. I am also trying to serve them to whatever extent possible, but because of my laziness, argumentative mentality, and finding faults, I am increasing their anxiety. Gurudeva, kindly bless that you have given me divine association and wonderful opportunity of chanting holy names and devotee association, but still, at times, I am not taking them seriously, rather I am misusing these opportunities. Gurudeva, in recent past years, we have tried to maintain the standards which we were taught from earlier times. Festivals have been improved by the endeavors of HG Vrindavan Chari Prabhu, from Janmashtami to Kartik month, to Gaur Purnima, to Rama Navami, to Brahmotsava, and every festival, thousands of visitors practically and everyone is in bliss to take darshan of Sri Sri Nitai Gauranga and Srila Prabhupada.
 
 Gurudeva, in recent past months, we are trying to connect all people who were serving deities by giving some financial help and some sort of Bhakti cultivation through programs in their homes and yatras. These are also going well, and they are voluntarily taking up services.
 
 Gurudeva, as per your desire, we need to erect a beautiful temple for the pleasure of Srila Prabhupada. We are also trying to march in that direction to please you and all other Srila Prabhupada disciples. Kindly shower your merciful glances and blessings that we can do something in this direction.
 
 Gurudeva, as my personal sadhana, I try to regularly hear your lectures and HDG A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada’s lectures and get a glimpse of divine association.  Gurudeva, I got to see this time your attachment to Srila Prabhupada and the deep separation you are undergoing from Srila Prabhupada.  Thank you once again, Gurudeva, for all that you have given me. And it is said that we cannot repay what the Spiritual Master has given to us. So, I remain an eternal debtor in this case, but I try to follow the instructions which you have given me through the lectures and try to honestly live by those principles and try my best to never let you down.
 
 Gurudeva, kindly forgive me for offenses and mistakes I commit towards you because of my ignorance and arrogance.

 Iskcon Newtown, Kolkata

 Jaya Śrīla Prabhupāda!
 Jai Gurudev!
 
 Today is a very auspicious day for me. By the mercy of the Lord, I have received the rare opportunity to glorify the divine qualities of my most worshipable Gurudev. I offer my full aṣṭāṅga daṇḍavat praṇāms at the lotus feet of my revered Guru Mahārāja.
 
 My Guru Mahārāja possesses unlimited transcendental qualities, but today I would like to speak on just a few of them—those which I have personally observed and learned from his divine behavior.
 
 
 ---
 
 1. Gurudev’s Equal Vision and Affection for Everyone
 
 One of the first qualities I learned from Guru Mahārāja is his deep affection, respect, and attentive hearing toward all—whether they are his godbrothers, godsisters, or any devotee.
 
 Earlier, I had only read in the Bhagavad-gītā the verse:
 
 vidyā-vinaya-sampanne
 brāhmaṇe gavi hastini
 śuni caiva śva-pāke ca
 paṇḍitāḥ sama-darśinaḥ
 
 This verse teaches equal vision toward all living beings.
 But in the presence of Guru Mahārāja, I see this verse living and walking.
 
 Even here at Govardhan Eco Village, Guru Mahārāja offers respect and affection even to simple workers, greeting them lovingly with “Hare Krishna.” This teaches us how a true ācārya behaves—not by words alone, but by his personal example.
 
 Guru Mahārāja even shows respect and kindness to the animals of Govardhan, including the dogs. By his actions, he teaches that a true learned person sees every living being as a child of God.
 
 
 ---
 
 2. Gurudev’s Deep, Heart-Melting Chanting of the Holy Name
 
 When I observe Guru Mahārāja chanting the holy name, I understand the true value of the Hare Krishna mahā-mantra in this age of Kali.
 His chanting is not mechanical—it is filled with devotion, absorption, and love.
 
 Just by seeing him chant, we realize how essential the Holy Name is for every person in this age.
 
 
 ---
 
 3. Gurudev’s Divine Smile, Compassion, and Humility
 
 Guru Mahārāja’s gentle smile removes all distress and pain from our hearts. His compassion, humility, respectfulness, and loving dealings are beyond ordinary description.
 
 Guru Mahārāja does not merely instruct us—he demonstrates every teaching through his own life.
 
 
 ---
 
 4. Gurudev Inspires Devotion in Everyone Who Meets Him
 
 Because of Gurudev’s qualities, Govardhan Eco Village has become a spiritual home for countless people. Many visitors come as tourists, but after seeing the behavior of senior devotees and hearing Krishna-kathā, their hearts transform—they begin to develop devotion and become inspired.
 
 This miraculous transformation is the mercy of Guru Mahārāja.
 
 Every person who comes to Govardhan Eco Village is lovingly told:
 “This is your home.”
 This simple statement creates warmth, belonging, and spiritual upliftment in everyone’s heart.
 
 
 ---
 
 5. Gurudev Performs Every Service With Love
 
 Guru Mahārāja never thinks he is above any service.
 He personally performs seva—whether it is caring for the cows, serving matajis, encouraging devotees, or even showing affection to the donkeys in the village.
 
 Every creature feels protected and loved in his presence.
 
 
 ---
 
 6. His Senior Disciples Reflect His Teachings
 
 I also learn from the senior disciples of Guru Mahārāja.
 Their dedication, humility, and hospitality reflect the training given by Gurudev. They serve every guest with full energy and heartfelt respect.
 
 By observing them, I understand more deeply the teachings that Guru Mahārāja has instilled in all his followers.
 
 
 ---
 
 My Personal Prayer
 
 I pray at the lotus feet of Guru Mahārāja:
 
 “May your mercy always remain upon me.
 Please give me the strength, sincerity, and purity to serve your projects at Govardhan Eco Village with greater dedication.
 May I always follow your teachings not only in words but through my actions.”

 I consider myself truly fortunate to write this offering to HH Radhanath Swami Maharaj, my spiritual master, on the occasion of his 75th Vyasa Puja.
 
 I would like to begin my offering with the day I received initiation from Maharaj and was blessed with the name Sridhar Priya Das. By the grace and wish of Krishna, everything happened so quickly that within a short span of time, I was blessed to have such a great soul, HH Radhanath Swami Maharaj, as my spiritual master.
 
 I still remember the moment of initiation. I went to Maharaj with folded hands, completely blank, simply surrendering to Krishna. The moment Maharaj glanced at me and smiled, I cannot even express what I felt. Those few seconds of his divine smile filled me with immense hope. I felt deeply blessed, knowing that now someone was there — and will always be there — to guide me.
 
 Even though we cannot reach out to Maharaj directly for guidance, through his lectures, quotes, books, and social media updates, we are always connected and constantly guided on how to live our lives in Krishna consciousness.
 
 Every morning, when I start my day and open Instagram or YouTube, the first thing I see is either a quote or a short video of Maharaj. I take it as inspiration or as a direct instruction from him for that day.
 
 I have no words to thank Maharaj for everything he has done, is doing, and will continue to do — for guiding so many souls, bringing them back on the right path, and reminding us of the true purpose of human life. Maharaj has also done so much for the future generations. Govardhan Ecovillage is one of the best examples of his compassion and vision. At a time when we have harmed and exploited nature so much, projects like Govardhan Ecovillage stand as a beacon of hope — promoting sustainability and showing us how to live in harmony with nature.
 
 During my time in Mumbai, when I was staying alone for about 2.5 years while my family was in Amritsar, I often visited the Sri Sri Radha Gopinath Temple, Chowpatty — the divine congregation created under Maharaj’s guidance. The moment you step into that temple, you feel you are home. The atmosphere makes you feel safe, sheltered, and blessed. The devotees there truly feel like family.
 
 I am certain that even if someday my friends or relatives fail to support me, these devotees — regardless of caste or background — will always stand by me. Because Maharaj has shown us that we are all one family, and our only purpose in life is to make Krishna happy and go back to Him.
 
 Honestly, there is so much more I want to say and thank Maharaj for. But I would like to end my offering here with a heartfelt thank you to Maharaj and a humble prayer:
 
 That even though I am not capable, may I be of some use in fulfilling Maharaj’s mission. If I can do even a small service in that direction, I will feel that my life has truly become successful.
 Your servant,
 Sridhar Priya Das

By your mercy, you accepted me in 2017. Though I had been chanting since 2000, I later struggled to complete my rounds. After moving to the Bay Area in 2019, H.G. Sukhesvari Mataji connected me with H.G. Shankaranand Prabhu, whose association helped me resume steady chanting with joy.
 As a child, I was never inclined to read beyond academics, but by your grace I developed a taste for Srila Prabhupada’s books. Reading with devotees brought me deep happiness. Later, I found similar nourishment through the Chant & Be Happy group under H.G. Shankaranand Prabhu. My brother, H.G. Anandarama Prabhu, sowed the seed of bhakti by giving me the maha-mantra, and H.G. Lilanand Prabhu’s classes on The Science of Self-Realization strengthened my conviction. I see all these devotees as your merciful instruments nurturing my spiritual growth.
 This year, I immersed myself in your lectures, The Journey Home audio, and your glorifications by senior God-family members. Learning about your transcendental qualities has helped me face life’s challenges. During a difficult time in service, your lecture on compassion deeply moved me—“We can’t love God if we dislike someone. We may not like what they do, but we must hate the disease and love the diseased.” Those words guided me to forgive and continue serving peacefully.
 In recent years, I have gone through many personal challenges. When I briefly shared them during your visit to the Los Angeles temple, you listened kindly despite the crowd. Later, when you visited ISV, Mountain View, the whole God-family joyfully prepared to welcome you. My son Suraj and I felt immensely blessed to serve together during your visit and experience the joy your presence brings.
 Recently, a Godbrother advised me to seek a siksha guru for ongoing spiritual guidance. I humbly request, Guru Maharaj, that you kindly consider establishing the counselor system for disciples outside India, so that devotees like myself may receive regular support and accountability.
 I am currently torn between continuing my material education and dedicating more time to temple services and Bhakti Vaibhav study. Due to circumstances, I have chosen to continue studying but pray for the vision to see it as service to Krishna. With age and limited strength, I long to engage more directly in devotional service. I pray for your mercy to help me balance my responsibilities and dedicate all my efforts—spiritual and material—as offerings to you and the Lord.
 Earlier, I once felt saddened hearing that you give priority to Srila Prabhupada’s disciples and their disciples before your own. But now I understand that this reflects your deep humility and dedication to Srila Prabhupada. I am grateful for whatever mercy I receive, knowing it is far beyond my qualification.
 I hope to continue serving you—perhaps again through transcription—and eagerly await the upcoming yatra book. I pray that I may sincerely balance my Grihastha duties while deepening my spiritual life and, by your mercy, attain Sri Krishna’s lotus feet in this very lifetime.
 Your humble servant,
 [Your Name]

Hare Krishna Dear Srila Gurudeva,
 Please accept our most humble obeisances at your lotus feet. All glories to Srila Prabhupada!
  
 On this most auspicious occasion of your 75th Appearance Day, we bow down with hearts overflowing in gratitude. We cannot fathom the extent of our good fortune for being sheltered under the divine grace of Srila Prabhupada, blessed by your causeless mercy, and guided by the loving association of so many of our godbrothers and godsisters. By your unlimited compassion, you are teaching us, showing us, and leading us with the very essence of spirituality. You are a reservoir of divine qualities and streams of nectarean wisdom continually flow from your lotus mouth, cleansing and nourishing our hearts. Your oceanic compassion showers even the most fallen souls like us, giving us an opportunity to relish the path of devotion. We are just insignificant and have nothing worthy to offer, but with folded hands, we beg the following from you:
  
 · May we chant the Holy Names with sincerity: Your absorption in chanting the Holy Names and singing kirtan from the core of your heart inspires us beyond measure. When once asked about your favourite sweet, you replied that the Hare Krishna Mahamantra is the sweetest of all sweets, for it offers the greatest flavour to the heart and the ecstasy of unmotivated and uninterrupted loving devotional service to the Supreme Lord. We are awestruck with your natural attachment for the narration of eternal pastimes of the Lord and His devotees. O Gurudeva, kindly bless us to constantly endeavour to hear Krishna Katha with attention and to chant the Holy Names with strong faith and deep feeling.
 
 · May we serve the Lord and His devotees with humility: Your life is a living scripture that teaches us true humility. We remain eternally grateful for the way you express your love through the selfless spirit of menial service to please Krishna. We are reminded of the days you tirelessly served as a pujari, worshipping the Deities, caring for the cows, hardly even sleeping, and offering everything for the pleasure of the Lord. You often narrate the pastimes of Sridhara Kolaveca, Suklambar Brahmacari, and Ghanashyam Baba, urging us to realize that the highest position in the world is to be the servant of the servant, devoid of false ego and free from personal motivation. O Gurudeva, let our consciousness, desires, words, and actions align with this ideal, to be eager and joyful to serve with no expectation of anything from anyone in return.
 
 · May we live with responsibility and share Srila Prabhupada’s teachings with integrity: We are amazed by your unwavering dedication to glorify Srila Prabhupada. Your determination to manifest Srila Prabhupada’s instructions in tangible form, whether in nurturing the spiritual atmosphere of GEV or establishing monumental offerings in Kolkata, fills our hearts with unlimited reverence. O Gurudeva, please empower us to embrace every word of Srila Prabhupada with a sense of urgency, seriousness, and responsibility. May our lives become instruments to serve you faithfully and with full integrity.
  
 Our heartfelt prayers at the lotus feet of Sri Sri Radha Gopinath to always keep you in good health. May They continually fill us with the mercy of your blessed association, and may They grant us to imbibe even a fraction of your mood and mission, living only to please Srila Prabhupada and serve your vision. On this sacred day, we pray for the strength to follow your footsteps, to uphold your teachings, and to remain strongly connected to your lotus feet.
 
 Your aspiring servants,
 Subhangi & Seshadri 
 Subhadra Priti DD
 Sudhir Gopal Das

Hare Krishna Maharaj Ji.
Please accept my humble obeisances.

To be honest, I don't know what to write. When I picture your face reading this, all my thoughts disappear. There are so many feelings, but no words for any of it. What can words possibly convey which you might not already know? The efforts are useless, still I am trying. I don't know why, but I'm doing this.

I don't even know how to write an offering, or what we are supposed to write, or how. I don't know any rasa or tattva, or any etiquette. This is all very new to me, yet somehow familiar as well...

All I know is that this stone heart of mine melts every time I think of you or hear you or your glories. Your words and your example gently lead me to my true self, towards self-realization and realization of God ultimately.

Since day one, you were so surrendered and so humble and so desperate for Krishna. You have in you the two qualities Prabhupada says are present in a perfect spiritual master — strong determination like a soldier and a heart as soft as a Bengali mother. Through tolerating hardships and accepting challenges, as well as through your humor and profound compassion, you have brought thousands of wandering souls to the shelter of the lotus feet of Sri Sri Gaura Nitai. You have dedicated your whole entire life to Srila Prabhupada and his mission, and you continue to serve him and, while doing so, move millions of hearts. Mine happens to be one of those.

I am still clueless what I'm trying to say — maybe this is my way of reaching out to your lotus feet. Thinking of serving Krishna is a far-fetched reality for me. I'm so insignificant; I don't know what I could possibly do for Mahaprabhu and his sankirtan mission. But if I am able to assist you even a bit in your service to Srila Prabhupada, my life would be successful.

I don't know about one life back home, back to Godhead. I may go to Goloka in this lifetime, or maybe take many more births; I don't want to think of all that. But in this moment, when my body and mind seem a little favorable, I just want to offer myself at your lotus feet. I want to offer my life to you. I don't know if I will ever get the fortune to become your servant formally by taking initiation from you, or if I will ever get your direct association. But in my heart, I'm already your menial servant, and I will always try to remember your words and follow them to benefit from your true association and live a life that is favorable and pleasing to you.

I will strive for perfection in each of my services and strive to serve and please all the Vaishnavas and preach this glorious mission as much as I can with all the ability I have. You would love to see the qualities of humility and tolerance in your servant; I can't cultivate them on my own, but I will surely beg to attain them, and beg that this verse, “tṛṇād api sunīcena taror iva sahiṣṇunā, amāninā mānadena kīrtanīyaḥ sadā hariḥ,” is the foundation of my life. I might fail, but I won't ever stop trying to chant attentively in the right mood.

I don't trust myself enough to promise all this, but I can say that I will try my best.
I have nothing else to offer, Maharaj Ji, please accept this.
Please accept me.

Your eternal servant.

Respected Dear Radhanath Swami Maharaja,

Please accept my most prostrated obeisances at your divine lotus feet. I am here trying to serve you through your vani. I am here trying to serve you in separation from you. Although at present you are both in your vapu and vani, not everyone has the opportunity to serve you in vapu. Your long kirtans into the late hours of the night reverberate in our vehicles while we are driving, while we settle down to rest in the night, or while we are doing kirtan ourselves. Your memories come to our hearts, and we remember how you drown us all in calmness and bliss with the chants of Hare Krishna. It always rings in my ears the two things you said years ago when we had your association in Kurukshetra.

One time in Singhal’s house, you said in quietude, “I am willing to help you to fulfill your desire to serve Srila Prabhupada, his ISKCON Movement.” This was when my issue was not getting sorted out in the GBC meetings. Although I wasn’t exactly your disciple, nevertheless, you had never discriminated and have always shown compassion to help me in my spiritual life.

Second time, when you had reinitiated me in my sanyas order of life, formalizing my position in ISKCON. That was in Jyotisar of Kurukshetra, in the presence of all the temple devotees. You had said, “I want to see you serve Srila Prabhupada to your heart’s content.”

The time I had spent with you was my fortune, which isn’t possible now, be it with you on your tours in the US, Athens, Pittsburg, Cincinnati, and Columbus. It isn’t imitating you but following your humble example of how you offenselessly move among devotees all over the world. Your mood of servant of the devotees and your humble demeanor make you comfortable and accommodate one and all. It is a simple yet a great lesson for our lives, at least for me, how to continue as a devotee in this world.

Dear Maharaj, please give a drop of your mercy on a struggling soul like myself. That will drive me in bhakti till the end of this body. Although I am far away from you physically, your remembrance helps me serve you through ISKCON life after life. I pray to stay under you, rendering service. Grateful for everything and am indebted to you.

Your aspiring servant,
Sukadeva Swami

Dear Guru Maharaj,
 Please accept my humble obeisances
 
 On this auspicious day of your appearance, I would like to thank you from the core of my heart for appearing in my life 10 years ago. You came into my life in the form of your book, "The Journey Home," just the next day after your appearance day. I remember how I saw the trailer of your book and also read a few pages from the book. I was really inspired to read that although you were born in America, your behavior and the lifestyle you preferred were totally different from the American way of living. Later, when I met my facilitator, I shared with him a few things that I felt inspired by from my reading. In this way, I was first introduced to you. As you quite often recollect and quote various special incidents in relation to Srila Prabhupada. This year is very special for me as it has been 10 years since I first got in touch with you. Over these years, my connection with you has deepened by hearing your lectures, associating with your disciples, and hearing from them about you.
 
 It has been just a year since I received initiation from you in December 2024. How unworthy, fallen, and unqualified I am; but still, out of your causeless mercy, you accepted me. And in accepting me, you have given me such a big responsibility. A responsibility to keep up my vows I have taken, a commitment to follow the four regulative principles, a commitment to chant my rounds as attentively as possible, a commitment to act in the mood of a servant of the servant of the servant, a commitment to remain a brahmacari throughout my life which I personally took, a responsibility to act exemplarily, a responsibility to read the books of Srila Prabhupada regularly, a responsibility to assist in the preaching mission of Srila Prabhupada, a responsibility to carry on with sincerity, seriousness, and most importantly, without any ulterior motives, and a responsibility to develop deep Vaishnava relationships amongst each other. Such a responsibility and commitment not just for a day or a week or a month or a year, but throughout my life. To be a disciple doesn't only mean to have some special interactions with one's Guru but most importantly to actually take his instructions very seriously to the core of one's heart: as Srila Narottam Das Thakur says, "guru mukha padma vakya cittete koriya aikya ara na kariho mane asa…". Even Srila Vishwanath Chakravarti Thakur says that "yasya prasadad bhagavad prasado…" only by pleasing the spiritual master can one please Krishna. When the spiritual master is displeased, there is only havoc in the life of a disciple. One may externally do a lot of things; however, if those acts displease you, then what's the use? As unqualified as I am, I seek your blessings so that I can truly follow the instructions you have given us throughout my life. As days are passing and seeing the strong influence of Kaliyuga, it's truly very, very challenging and almost impossible to keep up to one's sacred vows unless one is regularly associating with serious devotees and performing strict sadhana. I intensely pray that I could truly please you by keeping up with my vows and strive to share this message with others.
 
 Dear Guru Maharaj, the recent Kartik Yatra at Sri Govardhan Dham was such a great memory and experience which has etched within my mind. As you mentioned to us in your classes, I do wish that this memory be carried throughout this life and across all the lives I may remain within this material world. Let me always remain your humble servant engaged in your service life after life.
 
 Your servant,
 Sukumara Gauranga Das

Hare Krishna Maharaj,

 I remember that once I met you on the last Pune yatra, and I was one of the participants in a drama. We were going to perform a drama about the dacoits who attacked the Mayapur temple in earlier times. Just before the drama, I was distributing Mayapur Mahaprasad so that we all could be in the mood of Mayapur Dham while performing the drama. While distributing Mahaprasad, HH RNSM came in front of me, and I took the opportunity to give Mahaprasad to Maharaj. I was having a small packet of dry sweets, which are in the shape of a square shakarpara. I took one piece to give to Maharaj, as the dry sweets were limited and devotees were many. But when I gave it to Maharaj, he did not accept the Mahaprasad and gestured with his hand to put that single piece back in the packet. So I did the same, and then Maharaj gestured with his hand to offer the whole packet to him, and I did what Maharaj was telling through direction. Now Maharaj took the lowest of all lowest particles from that Mahaprasad and ate it, and Maharaj left from there with a smiling face. I then continued to distribute Mahaprasad to other devotees.
 
 Later, after many months, I realized that Maharaj was telling me that whenever you offer anything to the guru, you should always offer 100% to the Guru. This teaching was given to me without speaking a single word, and that too in hardly a two-minute duration. So I feel that great souls can teach so many things if we take their association, either in vapu or vani, with proper consciousness.
 
 All Glories to Guru Maharaj.

Your simplicity, humility, and compassion teach us that we should perform bhakti with love, sincerity, and purity. From you we learn that we, too, should live in this world with dedication, service, and a pure heart. Seeing your selfless devotion inspires us to serve with sincerity.
 
 HH Bhakti Rasamrita Maharaj shared with us on the occasion of your Vyasa Puja how you have mastered the art of speaking—how your words have influenced countless lives. Even in difficult circumstances, you always speak with humility, gentleness, sensitivity, and calmness. Your words never hurt anyone; they only heal. The sweetness of your speech awakens love and faith in the hearts of all who hear you.

 I would also like to share one memorable experience from my visit to the Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj during the last week of January 2025, where I was serving in the Mega Kitchen.
 
 One morning, after completing seva in the roti-making department, my friend Prabhuji and I went to our tent to rest. After about half an hour, we suddenly heard that you would be visiting the Roti Department in five minutes. We immediately rushed back. At the entrance, your secretary, Pranavananda Prabhu, stopped us, but when we told him that we were serving in that department, he kindly allowed us inside.
 
 When we entered, everyone was busy in seva and there was no clear place for us to join. I went near the roti machine where a brahmachari from Vrindavan was removing rotis and applying ghee. I humbly requested him to allow me to apply ghee, but he refused. Just then, you arrived. You looked at that brahmachari, smiled, and expressed gratitude to him. You did not look at me at all.
 
 The next day, we were again doing seva in the Roti Department. This time, when you came and I was genuinely engaged in service, you looked at me and smiled—your eyebrows softly twinkling. That small gesture taught me a profound lesson:
 Never pretend; always serve with sincerity and dedication.
 
 Yours Servant
 Seemadevi Sandeep Singh
 Svarupa Ananda Das

Thank you very much, Maharaj, for accepting this fool into the guru-shishya parampara, despite having no qualifications. It was a very amazing experience again this year during Kartik Yatra. Last year I couldn’t come, so it was almost like attending Yatra after two years. I was so touched again by your mesmerizing classes.
I would like to highlight some important qualities which touched my heart from your Krishna katha, expressed through the "GURU VANI":

G – Genuine Enthusiasm and Ever-Fresh Krishna-katha
        You always narrate classes with a lot of enthusiasm.
        You have been narrating these pastimes for many years, yet every story and pastime feels new and fresh each time for you and you narrate it as if you are narrating it for the first time. This shows how pure Krishna-katha is always ever-fresh and never boring, unlike mundane material topics which fade with time.
        
U – Unalloyed Pure Devotional Focus
        Your classes are truly based on pure devotional principles, with no tinge of any mixture, as Śrīmad Bhāgavatam says “dharmaḥ projjhita-kaitavo ’tra.”
        Focusing again, again on trinad api sunichena - humility, dasanudas - becoming servant, na dhanam na janam na sundarim - aspiring for pure devotion.
        
R – Respectful
        You are always very respectful to all your godbrothers and godsisters, although you are speaking to many thousands of devotees.
        
R – Rigorous and Long-Lasting Nectar
        Your classes are long and detailed, as Śrīmad Bhāgavatam says “dīrgha-satrena.”
        They act as the real medicine for the dirty hearts of Kali-yuga souls like me.
        You sit straight and speak for many hours with complete absorption and focus.
        On the contrary, I keep looking at the clock, which reveals my lack of taste. 
        
U – Unparalleled Sweetness of Words
        The words you use are divine and sweet; anyone who hears them falls in love with Krishna. Once HG Caitanya Charan Prabhu was appreciating your Journey Home book and said you never wrote it in an instructive way but as the journey of a person, gradually guiding people on the right path.
        This madhura-vacaḥ is another feature of a pure devotee, whose words touch hearts and transform lives.
        
V - Vibrant Devotion
        You are not just instructing us to develop taste for chanting and hearing Krishna-katha but you are a living example of it, you practically demonstrate it through your own example. You practically demonstrate the genuine taste for Krishna-katha. It is not artificial at all.
        Every class you give is filled with energy, emotion, and deep devotion. You show us that hearing and chanting about Krishna is the real happiness of life.
        
A – Absorbed and Analytical Depth
        While narrating pastimes, you lose track of time — a sign of your deep absorption in Krishna-katha. You never try to cut short pastimes; you go deep into them and fully immerse in Krishna-katha.

N – Nourishing
        mālī hayā kare sei bīja āropaṇa
        śravaṇa-kīrtana-jale karaye secana
                “When a person receives the seed of devotional service, he should take care of it by becoming a gardener and sowing the seed in his heart. If he waters the seed gradually by the process of śravaṇa and kīrtana [hearing and chanting], the seed will begin to sprout." 
        You are not only giving us the seed of bhakti but nourishing it through right hearing and kirtanam.

I – Illuminating Guidance and Instruction
        Your classes are both sweet and nectarean, yet at the same time they act as medicine through many instructions and shake us and awaken us. You so compassionately expose our anarthas, helping us see and overcome them.

Maharaj, I seek your blessings and prayers that I may make your instructions the main guiding light for my practice “guru-mukha-padma-vākya cittete koriyā aikya” and practically live by your teachings, always remembering your divine example in relishing Krishna-katha.

Your aspiring servant,
Tamal Govind Das

 Through thousands of instructive, spiritually nourishing, and uplifting lectures and kīrtans, you have touched countless hearts.

 The enlivening experiences of hearing from you, serving the devotees, and being surrounded by the holy dhāma continue to inspire me to go on with faith and enthusiasm on the path of Kṛṣṇa consciousness.

Dear Sri Gurudeva,
 Please accept my humble obeisances. All glories to Srila Prabhupada.
 
 On this sacred occasion of your Vyas Puja, I offer my deepest gratitude at your lotus feet. Maharaj, Your compassion to all living entities, humility, and unwavering dedication to the mission of Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu is a living example for me and many other fallen souls. Through your teachings, your books, and your personal example, you have illuminated the path of bhakti in my life, otherwise lost in the darkness of material life.
 
 Your firm determination to search for the Absolute Truth brought you to India during your young age. In spite of so many obstacles, you continued your search of God and finally reached India. I am so much moved by reading your experiences in *Journey Home*. When I first read your experiences in *Journey Home*, I was amazed at your endurance in the search of God. After reading *Journey Home*, I immediately decided to surrender unto your lotus feet.
 
 Your life is a testament to the power of surrender. By enduring every difficulty with gratitude and every success with humility, you have shown us what it truly means to depend on Krishna. You teach not merely through eloquent words but through the purity of your actions, the steadiness of your character, and the gentleness of your heart.
 
 Gurudeva, Your presence melts the hard knots of the heart. In your association, Krishna becomes not an idea, but a person; not a distant deity, but the most intimate friend. Recently, I got an opportunity to be in your association at the foothills of Shri Giriraj during Kartik Yatra 2025. I was so moved by your narration of different pastimes of the Lord, such that I felt I was physically watching the Krishna movie in 3D. Your compassion for every devotee during the Kartik Yatra had shown me its power. I personally felt so much awakening of my inner self in your association.
 
 By your kindness, I begin to believe that despite my shortcomings, we too can become instruments of Sri Guru and Gauranga, and I too have a hope of getting liberated from the clutches of maya.
 
 I pray for the intelligence to follow your instructions, the sincerity to remember your teachings, and the strength to serve your mission with dedication. Please bless me with the willingness to put aside my ego and selfish desires, so that I may become a small, genuine servant in your divine family.
 
 On this auspicious day, I offer my heart, my service, and my gratitude at your lotus feet. May I always remain sheltered by your guidance and never forget your kindness.
 Your insignificant servant,
 Utpal Pandya

"Hare Krishna. Dandavat pranām Mahārāj. Please accept my humble obeisance at Your lotus feet.

Then I started watching Your videos and learning about You. It wasn't with such intensity then, but I had a lot of curiosity to know about You.

Mahārāj, I don't know how to glorify a guru. Please kindly accept my offering.

When I wanted to know about You, I was in my second year, I think 2021.
Then I shifted to voice. Then I didn't know English at all, but by Your mercy, I can now understand Your words. My counselor, HG Jivdaya Prabhu, has helped a lot in this. When I used to pray a lot, asking for a guru, even knowing You, I couldn't decide who my guru was. Then, on the suggestion of a devotee named Prem Govinda Prabhu from Vrindavan, I wrote many letters to Adi Guru Nityananda Prabhu. I did this for a few months. Then my eagerness kept increasing. I found out very late that today is the last day to offer and there are only a few minutes left, so I couldn't write much, but I want to tell you more. I will tell you on that day when this festival happens in December.

Your servant, Vaibhav.

Hare Krishna Guru Maharaj,
Please accept my humble obeisances.
 All glories to Srila Prabhupada.
 
 Guru Maharaj, your example and teachings are extremely instrumental in the life of this fallen soul. Just as an expert doctor treats a patient with great care and sensitivity yet removes the disease from the root so that it never returns, similarly, through your deep and compassionate instructions, you reveal the faults and deficiencies within my heart, many of which I am not even aware of, and you fill that space with the nourishing juice of Krishna consciousness.
 
 “om ajñāna-timirāndhasya jñānāñjana-śalākayā…”
 Only by regularly hearing from you and sincerely trying to apply your teachings in my life, I experience protection from ignorance. But the moment I become negligent, Maya immediately influences me. This is how the spiritual master delivers the disciple from darkness by the torchlight of transcendental knowledge.
 
 This year has been especially filled with your causeless mercy. During my travel to the U.S. with HG Radheshyam Prabhu, my heart held one desire—to receive your personal association, as in India it is very rare for me. And you fulfilled that desire in the very first meeting at HG Vaisesika Prabhu’s home in San Francisco. There was almost no possibility that I could meet you that day, but by your grace, circumstances led me to your lotus feet.
 
 When you received HG Radheshyam Prabhu and lovingly embraced him, I stood quietly behind, simply hoping for your darshan. But out of your boundless compassion, you called me, embraced me, and asked me to sit inside. I sat at your feet and witnessed divine exchanges between you, HG Vaisesika Prabhu, and HG Radheshyam Prabhu, an unforgettable moment engraved in my heart forever. That loving embrace while leaving is still alive within me.
 
 During the 20 days in New York, although it is considered Maya’s headquarters, by your presence and your association, it became a holy dham, daily visiting the Bhakti Center, hearing your Krishna-katha and kirtans, visiting 26 2nd Avenue, and witnessing your profound love for Srila Prabhupada. Seeing how you revived 26 2nd Avenue exactly as it was in 1966, and hearing how you worked tirelessly with senior Prabhupada disciples to restore every historical detail, increased my faith immensely.
 
 I remembered how you were also instrumental in restoring Srila Prabhupada’s birthplace, the birthplace of ISKCON Ultadanga Junction, and now you also brought back the glory of 26 2nd Avenue. Similarly, during the Boston Arrival festival, when you walked with HG Radheshyam Prabhu and spoke about how Srila Prabhupada arrived alone on a cargo ship and now thousands of devotees gather on an opulent cruise, your deep meditation on Srila Prabhupada touched my heart profoundly.
 
 Your overflowing love for Srila Prabhupada, your unity with godbrothers, your care for disciples, incredible historical initiatives, Kartik Yatras, and temple festivals—all reveal your humility and simplicity. Even non-devotees are inspired to appreciate Srila Prabhupada and ISKCON because of your genuine Vaishnava qualities.
 
 I sincerely thank you, Guru Maharaj, for accepting me as your insignificant disciple and giving me the priceless shelter of your lotus feet.
 Your insignificant servant,
 Vaishnav Sharan Das

Dear Gurudev,
Please accept my soul-felt obeisances at your lotus feet on this very special occasion.
I am struggling very badly to comprehend how I could put down my gratitude and even more so your glory in few words!
Krishna says in the 9th canto of Srimad-Bhagavatam: sādhavo hṛdayaṁ mahyaṁ, sādhūnāṁ hṛdayaṁ tv aham, mad-anyat te na jānanti, nāhaṁ tebhyo manāg api.
When I first read this verse during my regular study of the Bhagavatam, with closed eyes the personality that immediately became visible in my consciousness is your brilliantly shining form. You are that perfect Sadhu that I have met after millions of lifetimes in this material world. That you always keep Krishna in your heart constantly is an established fact, but now I know, and I understand fully, that Krishna knows no one else but you.

Any thought of you, your lotus feet, is complete wholeness, and Krishna is fully present in that moment. I always wanted to please you, and for a very long time, this was the main motivation of my existence. But it was you who taught me in one of your Vrindavan yatra classes that the purpose of existence is not to please Guru but to please Guru by pleasing Krishna. Where can anyone in this entire creation find as genuine and authentic a Guru as your kind self!

In any assembly of Vaishnavas where you are present, envy is at once dispelled by your sadhutva. Enemies become friends, and bullies become sober! You extract the best in everyone, just like the great Mahajans in the Bhagavatam. Not just that, you transform people's hearts and existence. Please, someone explain to me what else is bigger magic? How can I even start to glorify your good qualities? Where can I start? I feel complete lack. Yet, by meditating on your lotus feet, I gain strength. You never like your glorification, yet I embarrass you every time I get your darshan at the airport or when I get to speak to you even momentarily after your classes or on any other occasion. Please take this as my foolish, childish enthusiasm to share the reality of what I am experiencing. I have communicated to you at least on two occasions that you are a magical Gurudev, and every time I asked you a question in my meditation during my morning reading of Srimad-Bhagavatam, or discussed any other difficulty of life with you, you helped me even when you were a million miles away! How do I begin to explain the specifics? I saw the embarrassment on your face when I glorified you like this last time at the airport, and while you didn’t dislike my honest statements, you communicated that there are more important things to do. Yet again, I dare to glorify you, knowing very well that you are more pleased not with your glorification but with the service of devotees, the movement, and cultivating Vaishnav behavior. I desire to be conditioned to the glorification of Radha Krishna, Prabhupada, and you, oh beloved Gurudev. And because I want to glorify you, I know I will end up glorifying all Sadhus with sadhutva.                                          Denial is gone, and Acceptance is the norm!

                           kalau naṣṭa-dṛśām eṣa, purāṇārko ’dhunoditaḥ.
You are the walking Bhagavatam and talking Bhagavatam too! Because whenever I lose the ability to see, you come as the guiding light of the sun in my dreams and sometimes in my awakened state of consciousness. You transcend the via medium to help and guide this conditioned soul.

Sanjaya declares: yatra yogeśvaraḥ kṛṣṇaḥ, yatra pārthaḥ dhanur-dharaḥ, tatra śrīr vijayo bhūtir, dhruvā nītir matir mama. Dear Śrī Gurudeva,
 Please accept my most humble obeisances at your divine lotus feet.
 All glories to Śrīla Prabhupāda.
 All glories to Your Divine Grace.
 
 On this sacred day of your Vyāsa-pūjā, I offer my heartfelt gratitude and my small, insignificant prayers. Though I am only your aspiring disciple, with an unsteady heart and limited qualification, I am endlessly nourished by your teachings, your humility, and your compassion. You are the very embodiment of strict sādhana and pure Vaiṣṇava-sadācāra. Just remembering you inspires purification and devotion.
 
 ---
 
 Your Mercy Reaching Me Through Your Exalted Disciples
 
 My journey into Krishna consciousness began in Kartik 2020. I was working in Singapore during the Covid lockdown when Krishna, out of His mercy, slowed down my life and allowed me to turn inward. This pause became the turning point of my spiritual life.
 
 My first connection with you, Gurudeva, came through your glorious disciple H.G. Gauranga Prabhuji. I happened to hear one of his lectures online and from that day, I would listen to him daily, constantly. His words gave me faith, strength, and direction.
 
 During that time, I lost my job, my health weakened, and I became socially isolated. But what I gained was priceless—
 the awakening of Krishna consciousness and the desire to chant the Holy Names.
 I began with one round during Kartik and by December 2020, I started chanting sixteen rounds daily. This was nothing but your causeless mercy flowing through your disciples.
 
 When I returned to India, my spiritual nourishment continued through another brilliant disciple of yours, H.G. Radheshyam Prabhuji. To this day, hardly a single day passes without hearing his classes.
 
 My mentors H.G. Mukundanand Prabhuji and Parameshwari Mataji lovingly guided me through Śrīla Prabhupāda’s books throughout 2021 and beyond.
 Another priceless blessing is the association of H.G. Anandvrindavan Prabhuji, whose japa sessions on Zoom have transformed my chanting and my consciousness.
 
 Even now, thousands of miles away in Colac, Australia, I continue to receive your shelter through your disciples H.G. Nityānanda Priya Prabhu and H.G. Vasudha Priya Mataji, who tirelessly preach with humility and dedication. Their association constantly reminds me of your mood and mission.
 
 Gurudeva, though I am far away, your mercy reaches me every day.
 
 ---
 
 A Sacred Pastime: The Darśana That Stays in My Heart Forever
 
 In early 2022, I stayed in Govardhan Ecovillage for my 500-hour yoga course. The thought of receiving my certificate from your hands filled me with eagerness, but because of Covid restrictions and your health, you were not meeting anyone.
 
 One day, at a distance across the Yamunā in GEV, I saw you absorbed in chanting. That vision alone felt like a treasure.
 
 On my last day in GEV, my heart was heavy. I had been seeing Sri Sri Radha Vrindavan Bihari every day, attending Maṅgala Ārati daily, and now I had to leave. While visiting Sri Radha Govindadev temple to offer gratitude, my mother suddenly said, “Look, Maharaj is here!”
 
 There you were—
 just a few steps away,
 with no one else around.
 
 My mother and I quickly offered our obeisances.
 You looked at us with humility, with a gentle smile, and folded hands.
 It was only a few seconds, but it felt like eternity.
 I felt unworthy and too small to approach, but my heart was overflowing with joy. I knew it was Krishna’s reciprocation.
 
 That moment is engraved forever in my heart.
 
 ---
 
 My Struggle as an Aspiring Disciple
 
 After marriage, I moved to Australia. Here I feel physically distant and unable to take initiation from you, and this sometimes causes deep pain within my heart.
 I feel helpless.
 I feel small.
 I feel unqualified—yet I long to serve you, Gurudeva.
 
 I beg for your mercy.
 I beg for your guidance.
 I beg for the strength to become qualified to serve you as your aspiring disciple, and one day, by your grace alone, to become worthy of your shelter.
 
 ---
 
 My Prayer at Your Lotus Feet
 
 On this auspicious Vyāsa-pūjā day, I offer one sincere prayer:
 
 Please bless me so that I may develop genuine humility, sincere chanting, steady sādhana, and the desire to serve devotees wholeheartedly.
 Please help me overcome my weaknesses and become a servant of your mission, wherever I am.
 Though I am far, please keep me close to your lotus feet.
 
 Thank you, Gurudeva, for every drop of mercy I receive through you and through your exemplary disciples. Whatever little Krishna consciousness I have is entirely your gift.
 
 Your aspiring servant,
 Varsha

Dearest Guru Maharaj,
 
 Please accept my humble obeisance. All glories to Sri Sri Guru and Gauranga.
 
 A few years ago, at the Govardhan EcoVillage, you took me on a walk. If I close my eyes now and meditate on it, I can try to see it…
 
 There isn’t any agenda or plan; nothing pressing to discuss or work on. You just start walking and motion for me to follow. And so I do. We make our way together, winding up and down pathways and roads, sometimes slowly strolling and other times vigorously walking, occasionally stopping to take something in. We mainly hold a comfortable silence, but sometimes you bring a topic up or tell a story. Sometimes I also nervously ask a question or try to prime you for more, all too aware that this magical experience may come to an end at any moment and wanting to take full advantage of this unexpected gift. But amazingly the walk keeps going.
 
 After circling around for a bit, we eventually slip into the interior of the Vrindavan Forest. You seem to be gliding rather than walking now— moving effortlessly from temple to temple, happily flitting between the samadhis and trees and miniature kunds like a hummingbird who knows where every flower is and how to draw out nectar from each one— and you sweep me along with you. You are so clearly at home here, and you seem to be inviting me to make this special place my home, too.
 
 We finally come to a spot by the Yamuna and you invite me to sit beside you on a rock. That comfortable warm silence rests with us again; since time is completely elastic now, we sit for either a few seconds or something close to an hour. Finally, I break the silence and ask you the questions that are burning in my mind: “Why me? What did I do to deserve this mercy? How am I so fortunate to have the gift of this time with you?” Spontaneously and inelegantly I even sputter out: “This makes no sense.”
 
 You smile and your response forever transforms my understanding of spiritual life and of the guru-disciple relationship.
 
 “Love doesn’t make sense,” you say, gently but also with conviction, “it doesn’t have to make sense. I love you and I like to spend time with you….” You go on to speak words that affirm and encourage me, that chip away at the layers of shame and doubt and insecurity that I’ve carried from my childhood and brought with me into my spiritual life. You let me know that I don’t need to be anyone but myself, that you love and accept me as I am, and that you also see my potential and love me as I grow into that potential.
 
 And in that instant, as special as I feel, I also simultaneously know that you feel the exact same way about each and every one of your disciples. That you genuinely see it as your special service to Srila Prabhupada to love and guide each of us, and that you are grateful for each and every one of us.
 
 Maharaj, when I met you I was a child. I was lost, hurting, deeply insecure and uncertain…. Looking for my forever family, my forever home, my spiritual father. You became all these for me and more. You’ve watched me grow up, you’ve seen me stumble and embarrass myself, you’ve guided and corrected and chastised me.
 
 But mainly, you’ve just patiently and unconditionally loved and encouraged me. Without any other agenda or for any other purpose. You’ve kept walking forward on the adventure of Krishna consciousness and kindly motioned for me to follow along. We’ve made our way together, winding up and down the challenges and triumphs. I’ve grown to just appreciate being in your presence, without needing to prove myself or win your attention; I’ve come to love that comfortable silence almost as much I love your storytelling.
 
 I love you everywhere, Maharaj, but I especially have come to love you at home in that magical Vrindavan Forest which you painstakingly created as an offering to your beloved Srila Prabhupada. I love how you glide effortlessly there, the transcendental hummingbird who draws out and shares nectar and reminds us to strive to always seek the nectar and forgive or tolerate everything else. And I am incalculably grateful that you’ve invited me and my family to call that sacred space our home, too.
 
 On this most blessed event, the appearance day that marks your 75th birthday, my family and I offer you our deepest heartfelt gratitude. Your constant love and support continues to sustain us in every way. And we pray to Sri Sri Radha Vrindavan Bihari and Mahaprabhu to protect and keep you in their care; to bless you with good health and a very, very long life; and to grant you so many opportunities to serve Srila Prabhupada in the ways that most inspire and nourish you.
 
 Who am I, what do I deserve? Krishna knows—and I think you do too—how broken and flawed I am, how far from what I am meant to be. But you won’t let me give up. Because love doesn’t make sense. It doesn’t have to make sense. Maharaj, I love you and I like to spend time with you.
 
 Your son,
 Venkata Bhatta das

 Krsangi devi das
 Sacimata devi dasi and
 Shruti Sara Kumari

सर्वात प्रथम मी माझे गुरु परमपूज्य राधानाथ स्वामी महाराज यांना मनापासून हार्दिक वंदन करते.

18 फेब्रुवारी 2018 रोजी GEV येथे माझी दीक्षा गुरु महाराजांकडून झाली. हा दिवस माझ्यासाठी फारच महत्त्वाचा आणि आनंदाचा होता. मी तो क्षण कधीच विसरू शकत नाही. महाराजांचे स्मितहास्य असलेला चेहरा लगेच डोळ्यासमोर येतो. सर्वांशी प्रेमाने व सर्वांना बरोबर घेऊन चालणारे होय.
महाराजांची यात्रा म्हटली की ती आम्हाला जणू पर्वणीच असते. असे वाटते की कधी कार्तिक मास येईल व आम्ही त्यांच्या यात्रेला जाऊ. यात्रेमध्ये महाराज तासंतास कथा करतात, गीता व भागवतांचे मर्म उदाहरण देऊन स्पष्ट करतात. त्यानंतर ते आम्हा सर्वांकडून संकीर्तन करून घेतात. त्यावेळेस लहान बालकापासून वयस्कर वैष्णव सुद्धा आनंदाने नृत्य करतात व ते इतके मग्न होऊन जातात की तहानभूक त्यांना समजत नाही.

महाराजांचा प्रारंभी जीवनाचा प्रवास अतिशय खडतर होता. त्यांचे 'अंतरीचा दिवा' हे पुस्तक वाचल्यावर काही प्रसंग जिथे महाराजांनी अतिशय कठीण प्रवास केला आहे, हे वाचून डोळ्यातून अश्रू प्रवाहित होतात. जसे रात्रभर डोक्यावर मुंगूस बसणे व बिलकुल हालचाल न करता स्तब्ध बसून राहणे. रानटी कुत्रे महाराजांच्या सभोवताली गोल करून भुंकत असतात की त्यामधून बाहेर पडणे जणू अशक्यप्राय. गंगेच्या पाण्याच्या दलदलीत ते फसतात व मदतीस सभोवताली कोणीच नसते. या सर्व प्रसंगातून धीर न सोडता ते बाहेर येतात, हे खरोखरीच धक्का देणारे प्रसंग आहेत.

महाराजांना कृष्ण कोण आहेत, हे माहित नव्हते. केवळ चित्र मिळते व गंगेच्या पाण्याच्या माध्यमातून महामंत्र चे ध्वनी प्रकट होतात. त्यावर विश्वास ठेवून त्यांनी पुढे खडतर प्रवास केला. एक परदेशी असून देखील लहानपणी आपले आई-वडील व घरदार सोडून भगवंतांच्या शोधात अनेक देश भ्रमण करीत ते भारतात आले. प्रभुपादांना भेटले व त्यांचे शिष्यत्व स्वीकार केले. प्रवासात त्यांना अनेक ढोंगी साधू भेटले. त्यांनी कुणालाच गुरु म्हणून स्वीकार केला नाही. परंतु प्रभुपादांची निसिम करुणा त्यांच्या हृदयात घर करून गेली. त्यांना गीता काय आहे, हे माहीत नव्हते. परंतु कृष्ण कोण आहेत, हे जाणण्याची जिद्द असल्यामुळे भारतात आले व आज ते भारतात सर्वांचे लाडके गुरु आहेत. मला त्यांच्याविषयी फार अभिमान आहे. अशा शुद्ध भक्ताकडून मला सुद्धा दीक्षा प्राप्त झाली आहे, ही केवळ त्यांची करुणा आहे. त्यांच्याकडून मला कृष्ण कसे सर्वोच्च आहेत, हे समजले. गीता व भागवताचे बोध झाले. भगवंतांची भक्ती कशी करावी, याचे विज्ञान समजले. जीवनात गुरूंची कृपा फार महत्त्वपूर्ण असते, कारण त्याच द्वारे आपण भगवंताजवळ पोहोचू शकतो.
अशा भगवंतांच्या शुद्ध प्रतिनिधींच्या चरणी माझे कोटी कोटी दंडवत प्रणाम.

After reading his book The Journey Home Antaricha Diva, tears flow from the eyes when we read about the hardships he faced—
like a mongoose sitting on his head the whole night while he stayed completely still,
wild dogs circling around him and barking, making escape almost impossible,
or getting stuck in the muddy waters of the Ganga with no one nearby to help.

Maharaj did not know who Krishna was initially.
He only had a picture, and the sound of the Maha-mantra emerged through the waters of the Ganga.

 Love without expecting. This instruction displays your quality of compassion. HG Gurudas prabhu once said that you are the most uncompromising, open-minded person he has ever met. Dear Guru Maharaj,
 Please accept my humble obeisances.
 All glories to Srila Prabhupada.
 I want to express my heartfelt gratitude to you for picking me up from the horrible depths of a life of sense gratification, and giving me shelter at Sri Sri Radha Gopinath Mandir. The community is a surreal oasis, a spiritual world, where sincere devotees who love you assist you in your service to Their Lordships, Sri Sri Radha Gopinath, Srila Prabhupada, and their devotees. And these devotees truly carry your compassion in their hearts. My profuse thanks to you for giving me shelter of Vaishnavas who perfectly imbibe your mood and mission; your love and loyalty to Srila Prabhupada; and your devotion and dedication to the sacred Brahma Madhva Gaudiya Parampara.
 Today, I would like to particularly thank you for the series of lectures you gave last year during the initiation festivals that we had in Mumbai, Nasik, Kolhapur, and Belgaum. I heard them as sincerely and attentively as possible and drew many important lessons for my own spiritual life. I would like to thank you for the same. The most important lesson I learned from your heartfelt instructions during these ceremonies, which I would like to particularly meditate on today on your 75th Vyasa Puja, is as follows:
 “All attractions of this world not only pale in comparison to the attractiveness of Krishna, but also ultimately come from an insignificant portion of Krishna’s splendor. Through occasions like initiation ceremonies, Krishna is beckoning us to come to Him and He has mercifully sent the parampara to help us come to Him.”
 When I heard this from you, I knew instantly that you were sent by Krishna, for you were on your way to the Himalayas, but inconceivably you got off the train at a station and then realized it was Mathura Junction, and that day happened to be Krishna’s appearance day. This was ordained by Krishna Himself—that you visit His birthplace on His birthday. Even at Patna, when you were hearing Ram katha from Ramsevak Swami, his disciple was translating the Hindi talk in English for you, but he only kept narrating the Damodar lila to you daily. Puzzled, you asked him why he repeated the same story daily while you could hear words like Rama, Sita, Hanuman etc. in the talks of Ramsevak Swami. The disciple humbly said that his guru had told him that Lord Rama had appeared to him in a dream and told him that you are a devotee of Krishna and you should hear Krishna katha. Unfortunately, the disciple didn’t know any other pastime other than Damodar Lila, so he daily spoke the same story to you while Ramsevak Swami was speaking Ramayana daily. This was another confirmation that you are especially dear to Krishna.
 Once, at Kumbh Mela, in January 2000, I saw a sophisticated CEO challenge you at the preaching tent. He repeatedly asked you why you left Judaism to embrace Hinduism when all religions essentially teach the same thing. You offered a diplomatic answer at first, saying how love of God is the message of all faiths; and perfection can be attained by any religious system. Instead of placating him, this agitated him more and he persisted with his challenge. Finally, when you realized that his questioning was pointed and specific, and there was no way you could avoid answering the truth, you humbly bowed your head and then softly, yet confidently, looking straight into his eyes, said, “I accepted Krishna consciousness because Krishna attracted my heart like nobody and nothing else.”
 All these incidents confirm that you are an eternal associate of Krishna, and sent by Krishna to save us from material life, and take us back to Him.
 In one of the mid-1990s lectures you gave to the fledgling congregation at Nigdi, you spoke the Brahmana wives pastime where the simple women ran, overcoming all obstacles and breaking all social barriers, to offer all the foodstuffs to Krishna and Balarama. At one point in the class, you paused and slowly said that just like Krishna sent the boys to the brahmanas, and then to their wives to ask for food, similarly, you have been sent by Krishna and Srila Prabhupada to ask them to offer their ‘food’ life to Krishna. You said with loving compassion that you are sincerely going to offer them to Srila Prabhupada and Krishna. Then, you requested all of us to not be like the proud and reluctant brahmanas but the simple and surrendered wives of the brahmanas.
 On this most auspicious occasion of your appearance day, I wish to repeatedly remember how you are most dear to Krishna and how you have been mercifully sent by Krishna to ask us to offer our lives to Krishna.
 Today, I wish to offer all that I have to you, for pleasing you, for I know you are faithfully serving Srila Prabhupada and Krishna’s orders of delivering the conditioned souls, who are rotting in this bizarre material world.
 Dear Guru Maharaj, please take pity on me and pick me up from the abyss of material life and accept my meager offerings made in a feeble voice. Please accept me and give me a chance to redeem myself and come back to Krishna in this one lifetime.
 Thank you again
 Aspiring to be the servant of your servants
